Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Shutter_bug_man
Reviews.Content: Simply the best place I have ever stayed, third visit, excellent in every way. Superb location, The hotel is amazing, but the the staff, well they are first class. The hotel has perfect and the room was of a good size and luxurious. Elegant, class, first rate service, exception dining, fab location, what more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in HK”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: I was in HK this past week and was fortunate enough to stay at "The Langham Hotel " not to be confused with the "Langham Place hotel " ( which I have not stayed at but the taxi tried to drop me there ) . The first thing that comes to your attention is the service . The moment I stepped out of the Taxi , I was treated to some amazing service . Nothing was too much trouble . The concierge was super helpful ( all of them , not just one superstar ) and the font desk , some how knew my name when I stepped up to register . Somehow the information was passed on from when I was asked my name at the front door to the short 40 m walk to the check in desk .. How clever and what a great way of the hotel telling you that you will be treated as a special guest ... The room was very nice but it is the service that would keep me coming back ... I was lucky enough to book this room on as part of a flight package and it I got a great deal also .. Win Win !! I will most certainly be coming back to the Langham in Kowloon .

Reviews.Title: “First Stop on Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Ken C
Reviews.Content: This was a smashing hotel, and for my wife and I a marvellous start to our honeymoon. We stayed for three nights at the end of July. The hotel has a lovely lobby and our room was of a good size and very luxurious. The whole plaace was elegant. As a result of a delay on our first connection our luggage did not arrive until the next day but the toiletries in the room covered every need. Free Wi fi was appreciated. We only ate one evening meal at the Tang Michelin starred restaurant and whilst expensive the food was fantastically presented so no complaints there. The bar was lovely to sit in and on our last day we also had afternoon tea. This was delightful and very reasonably priced for what they provided. The concierge was great as we had a problem with our suitcase locks and they helped in a variety of ways. No problems just got on with it, including the teams manager. Great service from them. I have paid more for far inferior hotels elsewhere and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What an expirience”
Reviews.Author: Ivor F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Langham in Kowloon on the way home from Australia. The hotel was trully amazing, however the key point was the staff were first class. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. We have travelled quite a bit and stayed in hotels in various places but the breakfast expirience her will be one that will never be repeated unless we just happen to stay at the Grand Langham again. This is a wonderful hotel and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Thank you to the staff once again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: gs-aussie
Reviews.Content: Too many steps, No doorman, NO Service. IF YOU HAVE A STROLLER/CHILD don't bother, no help what so ever. I couldn't even find ANYONE to help. Oh, the cleaners were so rude,that we at one stage we couldn't get in because they had ALL doors blocked. REAL HELPFUL - NOT !!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: saphie9999
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the past few years, but I think things are going downhill. We stayed here primarily because of the Club lounge, but this time we noticed things were not as they used to be, drinks were finished at 8pm promptly, previously they were offered till around 10pm. Breakfast was not so nice, it has a very limited buffet and the hot food on offer was tepid. The young lady on the front desk had poor knowledge of what time the shops opened on a Saturday morning, when I asked she said around 11 am or 12 noon, I asked which was it and she looked at me blankly. I went on the internet and found out it was 10am – how could she not know something so basic, why did she not even try to find out? Also when we checked out they told me I had already paid for one of our rooms, I knew nothing about this and they offered no explanation. The suite we had looked tired and had a very small bathroom, this was fine when things were so good at the Club, but as things deteriorate at the Club then tiered rooms with small bathrooms are no longer acceptable. I think it is time to try somewhere else in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Just Meet My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: WRTW
Reviews.Content: The location is right in the shopping district, and I find it very convenient. The front desk is polite and helpful. Food is ok, room is ok versus price charged. Nothing spectacular about it. The cost was absorbed by my company. If I were to select it myself, I would prefer a hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A really great stay”
Reviews.Author: JuggapahJK
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel which attempts fairly successfully to conform to traditional English style and service. The entrance hall is luxurious and impressive and the dining experiences are very good. Breakfast was pleasant; however, the same daily fare gets a little tedious after day 2 and the selection is not overly vast with the fruit counter exhibiting a poor show. Breakfast in the club lounge was far superior than in the main restaurant despite the smaller selection available.  The room was of a good size; however, it could really do with an update as they are looking somewhat tired. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and I was impressed with the  Penhaligon's toiletries in the bathroom, and The delicious turn down chocolates. Complimentary wifi with our package made such a difference to our stay and really helped us to plan our short time in HK.  Any discrepancies were resolved adequately and satisfactorily by management. The club lounge provides that touch of luxury to the overall experience. As previous reviews have indicated, there is no harbour view available at the hotel but the location is nevertheless excellent and very conveniently located to get about easily. A stay at the Langham will not leave you disappointed for whatever brings you to this vibrant and colourful city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Urbandon
Reviews.Content: From checking in to drinks in the Club Lounge to poolside an checking out, the service could not be faulted. Professional and friendly service. Room was immaculate the whole stay. Cleaned and buffed twice a day. Great location, great food in the Club, Not to sure why some reviewers say it's far from subway or ferry- you couldn't get much closer to both! Highly recommended if you are going to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxlien
Reviews.Content: Although it's a little bit far from subway, but nearby harbor city. It's a good shopping area. We stayed 2 night and we had a very nice experiences in hotel. They send a greeting card that print on your name and send a weather report and everyday, and let you feel so sweet. Our family like there very much. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaplancashire_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday to Hong Kong and Thailand. We stayed at the Langham as we wanted a hotel with a good location-we were not disappointed! We arrived at 7am local time and our room wasn't quite ready so we had breakfast ( which was really good) and then we went back to reception and our room was ready. We had been upgraded to a grand langham room which was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel is just a short walk from the star ferry and is right in the centre of the shopping district. Once , back in the room however it was quiet and welcoming. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the young man on the concierge desk who helped us to book a couple of tours . I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel superb location”
Reviews.Author: Burg3186
Reviews.Content: Hard to get a better location close to Nathan road and all the shopping action. Quite ornate styled but still looks fresh and classy. Service is very good, rooms are excellent (pillows could be firmer) and they have the best room safes anywhere - big enough to take a small backpack or larger laptop - now why don't more hotels follow the lead? The club facility is quite 'cosy' (small) but is about the best I've had with fantastic food options and a really good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BoodlesNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this beautiful hotel for 3 nights. We were impressed by the efficency of the staff and the elegance of the hotel itself. It is very conveniently situated in the heart of the shopping district ( think Chanel etc) and is within walking distance of the Star ferry to Hong Kong Island. The suites are gorgeous, comfortable and spacious. We unfortunately had to return home early due to a bereavement in the immediate family and the Concierge, Penny, was of utmost help in changing our airline tickets and our shuttle pick-up from the hotel to the airport. We can't recommend this hotel more highly

Reviews.Title: “A very surprised, enjoyable, comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: stephanie x
Reviews.Content: Most of the room amenities are pink which is the best color I like. The smell was so good in the lobby that made me relax and comfortable all the time. The staff checked in me was so gentle and lead me to the room, show me the room that was very full of sense of ownership. In one word, no doubt that would choose the hotel again in furure.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience to savour”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: After teaching in Chenzhou, I spent four days at The Langham Hotel. It was truly a wonderful experience. The staff were friendly, courteous, and very helpful. My last two days were spent by myself, but I felt quit comfortable at the Langham doing this. My room was very clean, spacious, and the decor was tasteful. I slept well in the comfortable bed under the cosy duvet. The turn down each night with chocolates was most welcoming. I dined at all the restaurants and found the food to be well prepared and presented. The waiter at the Tang Court was so helpful ordering dishes and I soon lost my uneasiness about dining alone within minutes due to the friendliness of staff there. The staff at all the restaurants were knowledgeable about the food and courteous. My last day at the hotel was spent getting a Chinese Acupuncture Massage followed by a leisurely swim at the outdoor pool. I found this hotel to be very peaceful and quiet which was just what I needed after my teaching assigment. I will surely be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: YiJunLim
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights stay in deluxe Langham room in this gorgeous hotel, rooms are not big (like most of the typical HK hotels) but very comfortable and delicate designs, love every single details in the room. Welcome snack (chocolate, fruits),sufficient drinking water, towels and toiletries was provided everyday. Bed and pillows are extra comfy, bathroom are clean and classy, they provide anything you'll need in bathroom, even extra, thumbs up to the hotel management for very considerate. Great location with all the branded retails shop (Harbour city, Prada, Gucci, Hermes, Chanel etc) below you or just a stone throw distance. Walking Distance to Star Ferry, harbour and other famous attraction nearby. We enjoyed our stays at here and if there's a chance of coming back, we'll love to just stay in the room and chill all day long, i would say it is a awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: baileychow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! very friendly staff. Breakfast: not bad because they have my favorites - congee! they also have this pan fried chicken that's good. You can also have your own noodles cooked to order (i wasn't able to avail of this because we only had 2 breakfasts and i prefer congee in the morning). They change some things but the usual are there. High Tea: not bad either. there are hits and misses. the hits are the sweets. the misses are the savories. out of maybe 7 or 8 savories i only liked a couple. and then there is that famous Langham smell. I bought the oil home and it smelled equally great! location can't be beat when you want to go shopping. our executive room was a bit cramped because there are 4 of us. we booked this room to guarantee that the 4 of us will stay in one room as connecting rooms may not be available. once when we returned late afternoon housekeeping was there and saw that we're all red from the heat outside. she was soo kind to offer a bucket of ice as we didn't put our bottles of water in the fridge before we left. water is always replenished no matter if it is consumed or not. everybody who works in the hotel makes sure you have a hassle free and pleasant stay. the evening chocolates are soo good too. i wish they would provide a foam pillow though. i keep forgetting to ask for one. but all in all i still slept well. yes we will go back!!! highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: biffnshaz
Reviews.Content: The Langham in TST offers great value for money if you do a bit of searching for the best rate online. Excellent 5 star hotel in a great location within walking distance of Harbour City shopping centre, star ferry and other attractions in Kowloon. Peking One building directly across the road houses the restaurant, Hutong on one of its upper floors which apart from the excellent northern Chinese cuisine also offers great views of the nightly light show on the harbour. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Julie t
Reviews.Content: Like the hotel when I first walked in. However reception changed my opinion of the hotel. The girl at the reception was scolding her colleague next to her for not answering her while checking us in. May be she thought we don't understand cantonese. Then half way through checking in, she went to help him solving his problems with his clients while we stand there waiting! Another colleague have to come in and finish her job. Room was not ready and we were told to come back 2 hours later for the key. We came back some 6 hours later, there was a long queue checking in. Reception told us they can't help us. We had to join the long queue to collect our keys. We waited for another half hour in order for this. While waiting inline, the hotel customer service staff was there talking to the people waiting to check in. We purposely said it loud enough for her to hear. When we are the next inline , she totally ignore us and talked to the couple behind us. Such a bad and lousy service. Your counter girls bring down your brand! Sad to say great hotels but poor service. First impression is very important!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Tsim Tsa Sui, Kowloon areas”
Reviews.Author: kya0
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Langham Hotel, Hong kong for 4 nights. It's a decent nice, old hotel (built on the 90s, I think), moderate price about hkd 2,000 a nite . I heard that so far only suites rooms that are renovated to a new modern looks. regarding the service, the staff/housekeeping is nice, they are pretty fast in delivering our requests such as extra beds, towels, complimentary water bottles. Also for your information, if you bring kids (I got 4 and 2 years old nieces), you can ask an extra bed for free. an extra bed costs you around hkd 110++ a nite for each room. On my last trip, I booked 2 rooms for 4 adults and 2 kids. So, I save hkd 880++ during my stay in Hong Kong. it's one of PLUS POINTS in staying in this hotel for family. About the location, it's the best place if you're staying at kowloon side. The MTR entrance is on the next building of the hotel, the harbor city and the kowloon ferry terminal (to macau) is walking distance. Inside the harbor city, there's an international supermarket on the 3rd floor, called city super. Overall its a nice experience staying at the Langham Hotel. I would recommend this hotel for those who plans to stay at the tsim tsa shui areas. it got a nice location (near MTR, next to harbor city, and the ferry terminal)

Reviews.Title: “Enchantment at a snip!”
Reviews.Author: ultraluxe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Langham Hong Kong for four nights in June and were enchanted from start to finish. No request too much, no small detail missed, from the attentive and polite staff, to the well appointed rooms, well decorated room and plush surroundings right down to the rose scented lobby, staying here is like staying in a fairytale. The location in TST was fantastic, right next to all the high end shops and a stones throw from the star ferry pier. If you are happy to stay in TST then this is the hotel for you. As first visitors to HK we realised too late that Hong Kong island may have been a better destination given its proximity to many of the main attractions, however we still had an amazing time. Specific positives of our stay at The Langham include the check in staff who personally checked us in and called us by our names the entire time, the surprise honeymoon gifts from the hotel and the delectable afternoon tea - a must! Special thanks go to Alex in the front desk team who went the extra mile to resolve an issue we had. Things that could be better include the room furnishings were a little worn in our room and could definitely do with a refurb and the hard sell on he langham club package on check in was not particularly appreciated after a long flight. However I would highly recommend a stay at the wonderfully and throughput enchanting hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decadence & romance throughout”
Reviews.Author: eternalgringo
Reviews.Content: Walking through the opulent foyer, the beautiful aroma of fresh lillies and roses welcomes you. Staff were pleasant and attentive and the room was well presented. The location is fantastic - right in the heart of Kowloon, close to excellent shopping, restaurants and transport. The concierge staff were particularly helpful as this was our first trip to Hong Kong, so they offered tips and advice to help us get around. The breakfast buffet had plenty of variety and T'ang restaurant made for a convenient and yummy dinner option. Whilst you're there, make sure you try the High Tea... we compared with high tea at The Peninsula and preferred The Langham option. Would definitely stay again when next we visit Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and service”
Reviews.Author: pcd1967
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in this beautiful hotel. Check-in was a breeze. The bathroom was very clean and had luxurious towels and robes. The room was very comfortable, as was the bed. It was the perfect haven after a day of walking. The housekeeping staff kept the room clean everyday. They even gave a card on the weather forecast for the next day. Room service was fast. The food came in a beautiful silver tray complete with after dinner mint. A bit expensive but well worth the price if you are looking for a real vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Allround Experience”
Reviews.Author: DJando
Reviews.Content: We spent an amazing 6 nights at the Langham, from the moment we arrived the service was impeccable. The check in experience was very efficient and they were very busy. Our room was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff were very accommodating. We had some great meals in the Main St. Deli and the service was great. Also found breakfast (included) to one of the most enjoyable we have experienced in our travels. We also ate in the L'Eclipse Restaurant for dinner which was also a very pleasant experience. The assistance provided by the concierge was very helpful and we would like to commend Noel on her advice and the efficient and speedy mannner in which she dealt with our queries. The location of the hotel is very central to the Star Ferry Terminal and also Nathan Rd and the train. Also a big thank you to Jonathon who assisted us with a late checkout .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenQ1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on honeymoon last year and it is the most opulent luxury you can get - the reception was hugely impressive and you wouldn't be surprised to find yourself standing in awe admiring every bit of it. Beautifully stocked with huge displays of fresh flowers - and I mean huge! Very comfortable rooms we're the perfect recuperation retreat when the shopping or exploring became too much - room service was great too. We ate at the in house restaurant a couple of times which provided a foods of the world theme on an all you can eat basis. Each section had its own chef ready to create pretty much whatever you wanted - cant remember the exact price but do recall being impressed with the price. If you want to go top end it even has its own Michelin starred restaurant. Great little touches like a card under the door each evening with the following days forecast may only be small but it all adds up. Of course it's an expensive hotel to stay in - its 5 star in the best location Hong Kong has to offer, but it's worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the third time and the hotel failed to disappoint. I had a Langham Club room. I've stayed in many Hong Kong hotels and this is the best: staff, service, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and business acquaintances. Thanks to The Langham!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jenineg
Reviews.Content: The staff here are so friendly. We stayed in a basic suite and it has everything. Very comfortable, great super king comfortable bed. Amazing restaurants to eat in and fabulous breakfast. We would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kimberleycaldwell
Reviews.Content: The Langham in Hong Kong does not disappoint. Great location in Kowloon, excellent service and lovely rooms. Have chosen to stay her twice before on business and this will be my only choice of hotel when in Hong Kong again, excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: The Langham makes your experience from start to finish a memorable stay. Highest service, food (plus excellent variety) and quality room. We highly recommend Langham and it is also in a great location in Hong Kong. High Tea is a must do!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury plus 'je ne sais quoi'”
Reviews.Author: SEASIAtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: Living just across the border in China, I decided to spend a couple of nights of pampering in Hong Kong and The Langham certainly lived up to the description. It's not just the excellent and friendly service, the comfortable clean rooms and the wonderful food in the Langham Club but there is something else about The Langham which made me think of some of the top hotels in London. I couldn't put my finger on it but there was just something special about the place. When I asked the concierge where I could find a barber shop he immediately directed me to the perfect place where I was greeted with a drink and hot towel followed by an expert haircut and shave. It was almost like travelling back in time. Maybe it was the Early Grey tea and scones for afternoon tea but I just felt as though I was at Claridges or the Mayfair in London. I adored it and I intend to treat myself to a few nights at The Langham as frequently as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: dbtgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my wife from July 30 to Aug 1 after staying 2 nights at Marco Polo Hong Kong. The check in process was superb and very efficient, though we arrived before the hotel's designated check in time they gladly gave the room to us. We also requested for a late check out and again they granted our request. The room is just the right size, for a couple like us but the bathroom looks a bit cramp but what I like about the bathroom is that it has a separate shower, an aspect the Hong Kong Marco Polo didn't have. The room also looked a bit old but the bed was very comfortable, I love the pillows specially and I had the most comfortable sleep throughout my stay in Hong Kong. The hotel also has a rooftop gym and swimming pool but we were not able to use them due to a very busy shopping schedule. The location is also very ideal, it is a very short walk to the Harbor City and Ocean Terminal, iSquare and Nathan Road shopping areas a well as to the subway and star ferry. This is my first time staying here and I believe this will not be the last time. Looking forward to my wonderful stay at the Langham the next time I come back to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, out of their way. Thanks again!”
Reviews.Author: Jose Manuel I
Reviews.Content: We were staying for a weekend last July 27-29, 2012. Everything went very smoothly during check in time, the hotel lobby is very nice and elegant and the rooms are quite spacious. We even got upgraded to a Club Floor. The hotel is very well located and we could go around Kowloon and also Central on Friday and Saturday. Then something happened that made our weekend trip ending as a nightmare. My wife got really sick on the last day from when a cold got complicated due to the flight. She suffered from severe vertigo and nausea. It all started Sunday early morning and we had to stay the whole day in the hotel until the evening. I have to say everyone was very helpful starting with Mr. Larry, the Assistant Manager. They even went out of their way. They arranged for a doctor to visit us, he was there in less than 30 minutes. We got extended and checked out at 7.00 pm with no extra charge. The driver was so gentle and we got to the airport smoothly. Upon arrival to HKIA someone from their staff was waiting to assist us check in the luggage, etc. In summary the hotel staff made this terrible time much lighter for us. We are very thankful, partly because of them we were able to catch our flight back home. Mr. Palmer, congratulations for the excellent staff you have in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself”
Reviews.Author: Gene L
Reviews.Content: From stepping out of my cab to leaving the staff here were exceptional. The Langham is a beautiful hotel and I did not have time to explore it all but would love to go back. Location is excellent with the main areas in Kowloon on the doorstep. Room was exceptional with a very comfy bed and superb fittings. Spoil yourselves,

Reviews.Title: “Looking tired and service slipping”
Reviews.Author: LondonCooke
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller to hong kong I have stayed in the langham many times as it 5 minutes walk from my office. The location is great for the shopping of canton road and the mtr at TST station. Over the years the one thing that has made me keep staying at the langham was the Quiet relaxed atmosphere and the impeccable service that is so welcome whilst working crazy hours in the madness that is hong kong. I came away this time thinking that it was a hotel on the slide, problems with the booking, not a great resolution and apart from the restaurant at breakfast who somehow always remember how I like my coffee service standards that didn't deliver to the standard you would expect of a 5 star hotel and not as good as they used to be

Reviews.Title: “Great room large for Hong Kong hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie K
Reviews.Content: Situated in a good position close to transport and everything you want to do and see.Large bedroom huge bed,very comfortable.Staff are very nice and helpful.Very clean and nicely decorated throughout.Our room was very quiet considering the area of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Pauline0570
Reviews.Content: We had 7 nights in Hong Kong and we wanted to stay centrally, close to great restaurants, shopping and of course the Harbour. The Langham was perfect. The staff were amazing, the rooms magnificent, the concierge, Paul, absolutely wonderful. I think it will be the Langham for us on all our next trips. The staff in the dining room for Breakfast were unbelievable, remembering our preferences for coffee, tea, the morning paper. Attention to detail was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Elegant & Sensational Service”
Reviews.Author: carinaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Langham Hotel in July 2012. From the moment we walked in the lobby was stunning & had the biggest display of pink roses in the middle of the foyer Ive ever seen. The staff (we had Alice check us in & show us to our room) were all exceptional. The room was very clean, roomy (for Hong Kong) and had great air con, very necessary at this time of year. It is also in a great location, the subway is just 20 metres across the road & the harbour is about 1 block, an easy 4-5 min stroll. Its also surrounded by the usual high end stores. Have absolutely nothing negative to say about the Langham-it was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Tingfei
Reviews.Content: Looking for a conveniently located, best value for money hotel at the heart of Kowloon? Look no further.The Langham is an excellent hotel with elegant decor, clean spacious rooms, great amenities, nice little touches in the room, super friendly, efficient and attentive staff who anticipate what you want before you ask for it (e.g. hotel even offers guests to use their health club for a bath and wash after you check out and return a few hours later to pick up your luggage) At the price I paid, it is hard to find a better match for The Langham anywhere in HK or even in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aemaz_2000
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Good health club. Near almost everything in Kowloon. 7 eleven and McDonald are around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ashleytang
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Langham purely for the location. If you're in Hong Kong to do some designer brand shopping as well as high street shopping, nothing beats The Langham location wise. Right on Peking Road and you wake up with views of Miu Miu, Dior, Gucci, Prada and the like. The hotel itself is pretty amazing, the lobby is gorgeous and the service top-notch. It is a bit on the expensive side but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NZJacksons
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Langham Hong Kong for 4 nights last week. The service was second to none and the location of the hotel was excellent. However we were a little disappointed after paying for an expensive hotel to have mold in the shower. We got over that and enjoyed out stay in Hong Kong. The amazing smell of the Langham Hotels lobby was so nice to come back to after a long hot day of sigh seeing, I know that sounds strange, but the lobby really does smell amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Anne N
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Langham Hong Kong. We stayed for 6 days and had a Club room which is a must. The staff in the club area were fantastic, nothing was to much trouble especially Rachel and Ben they went above and beyond to help us. The staff in the foyer the ladies dressed in pink were also exceptional. The hotel was very clean. We would go back there anytime and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: dingyadi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of May and was really impressed by the Langham Hong Kong (distinct from the other Langham which is a bit further out). It's high Tripadvisor rating is well deserved. Last time I went to HK I stayed at the Shangri La Kowloon, which was lovely but I'd give the Langham the edge, not for room size, but instead for location and well above the norm service. If you want a view, this is not your hotel as it is surrounded by buildings but the location is terrific - in the heart of the Kowloon shopping area, just near Pacific Plaza and Silvercord shopping centres and the Star Ferry and near the Peninsula Hotel. And if you need a restaurant or bar with a view, walk to the One Peking Building right across the road and try the Hutong or Aqua Roma/Tokyo. The room and hotel facilities are very nice although it is the service that won me over. Really friendly and very attentive and helpful. I had a birthday when I was there and came back to the room and there was a birthday cake from the hotel waiting for me; wow, I've never had that happen before. And if you find that your booking includes breakky (as we discovered ours did when we checked in) - enjoy. I've never seen such an extensive breakfast buffet. Overall, one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: missingscrew
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Langham with my wife and friends and I have to say that this hotel is one of the best I have stayed at. The staff are brilliant, so attentive to every request and the housekeeping is the best I have seen and especially the turn down service of a night. From the time we arrived we have felt like royalty I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Location good not be better a 5 minute walk to the star ferry and the MTR, shops are everywhere even Cartier across the road not that I will ever go in it, but 7 eleven is not far. Well done to all staff and the management. We have not tried a restaurant yet will update when we do.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class Hotel in all it offers”
Reviews.Author: grant c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Langham for one week at the beginning of July. The hotel offered supurb facilities and all the staff spoke fluent English. The room was beautiful and the hotel maids could not do enough to ensure that your stay in the room was carefree and enjoyable, nothing was too much trouble. We found all the staff throughout the hotel were more than available to help with any enquiry or request. The reception and hall staff were outstanding making themselves available to cater to your every need. The hotel is situated in a perfect position for both city and market shopping. The hotel is also in easy reach for the train and ferry services which are both within easy walking distance. I would strongly recommend the langam it far exceeded all our expectations. We stayed at the Langham for 1 week in July 2012, we could not find any faults with the Langham. The hotel is in a great location to all the shopping and in easy reach to all public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayner4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Langham for 8 nights at the end of June and didn't really want to leave. The service was of the highest standard and we had no communication issues at all. A part of our nightly rate included buffet breakfast. The breakfast was simply amazing everything you could ever want and the staff couldn't have been more helpful, especially a man called Joseph who talked with us every morning that he was in the restaurant. The room was fine too and the evening chocolate on the pillow was a nice touch. We welcomed the bottles of water left for us everyday as it was very hot outside when we were sight seeing. The location was perfect, close to the Star Ferry, The Harbour Shopping Mall and Nathan Road. There is also a stop outside of the hotel for the free Airport Shuttle bus. We dined at two of the hotels restaurants and enjoyed both. Looking forward to our next trip to Hong Kong and would look to stay at The Langham again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to return to after all the fun in HK”
Reviews.Author: AlvinTSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in this hotel recently. Can't fault the location as it is near to the harbour, luxurious harbour city, China Ferry Terminal (for outbound to Macau), MTR and small local shops. All staff in the hotel were so polite. Especially impressed with housekeeping. What happened was that I left tips meant for the house-keeper onto a calling call. When I came back to the room, the tip was still there but the room nicely made up. I guessed its because the house-keeper thought I meant to give the tips to the house-keeper whose name was written on the calling card instead of her. Such honesty! The only complaint I would have (but probably also my mistake) would be the pillows being too soft for my liking. I am not sure if they offer a choice of pillow selection, but I did not see any mention of being able to select choice. Otherwise, bed is comfy and bathroom comes with full set and ample supply of toiletries. Also, breakfast was a nice spread of oriental and western. Fulfilling breakfast to keep you till lunch time. Everything was fairly efficient from check-in to check-out and grabbing a taxi to the airport on my last day. Will recommend this hotel as a choice accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “A very professional hotel - very highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Obderver
Reviews.Content: The service levels at this hotel are unbelievably high. There always seemed to be staff around to assist, if needed and their approach and attitude were pitched just right. What is more, staff in the restaurants even remember your name the next time around after just one visit. The rooms are as you would expect. A very professional hotel. Very highly recommended. If I return to Kowloon, will definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Hong Kong stay”
Reviews.Author: Goodtotravel08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and found it was an excellent choice for our family of two parents and three young adults. We were central to all transport and the location was perfect for our daughters to go off shopping at any spare moment.There was an abundance of restaurants close by and the hotel dining was also fantastic. Langham hotels have a certain charm and this hotel is no exception. After a long day of sightseeing it was always a pleasure to walk back into the sanctuary of the main lobby. We would stay here again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “THEY KNOW SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Geelong255100
Reviews.Content: Great on service, rooms are elgant with a good amount of space. Too much pink for my liking as all of the stationery is in pink, shopping bags,etc it is not the best colour choice for business needs. They do need to improve on the quality of product used in the bathroom, cheap quality soap and tissues , more of a two star hotel quality. Right through out the hotel all of the staff are attentaive and very friendly, highly recommend the lobby bar. The other good thing about this hotel is the location, close to transport, shopping and all dining needs. Excellent hotel to stay at for either business or whilst on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2525
Reviews.Content: The Langham is so well located..easy access to shopping Harbour city, stations, star ferry etc etc The staff are more than fabulous in the restaurants lobby bar concierge housekeeping and gym The front desk staff vary some just ok. We were given an incorrect room on our first night. It was one of the older rooms...dark musty and not as described It was on the 16th floor which you access by stairs!!!! This was not told to us at checkin . The next day we went to the room we booked..deluxe refurbished. these rooms are more what you expect at the langham and more in line with other hotels of the same level. The buffet breakfast was deliciously fresh and well presented. Cindy the lobby manager is such an asset to the Langham so helpful and accomodating...nothing was an effort! The pool and gym really good enhanced by enthusiastic professional staff. Tip.dont waste your money on the Langham candles absolutely NO scent...very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: paolacohen
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Langham Hotel in Hong Kong every time I visit Hong Kong; the service is great first class and the hotel staff is very helpful and always smiling and addressing you by your name Rooms are quite spacious by Hong kong standard and the beds are super comfortable They have a small pool on the roof top and gym which helps in hot days if you want to relax a bit On week ends it gets a bit crowded because the hotel it is next to a major shopping mall and attracts many tourists from China

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: fossie52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Langham Hotell Hong Kong where the service and attention to detail was excellent. We stayed in a club room with access to the Club Loung where the service and selection of food and drink was one of the best we have had. This is one of the very few hotels where we have stayed where we had no complaints. We had a small problem in the bathroom and it was fixed almost immediately (waited 10 minutes for an engineer to arrive). It is an excellent location for shopping and access to the ferries. We travelled to Macau for a one day trip and the terminal was 10 to 15 minute walk from the hotel. When we visit Hong Kong again we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: applebox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our way home from Europe. The hotel is well positioned in Kowloons shopping precinct. It is also a short walk to the end of the street to view the nightly light show of buildings on the harbour. The hotel is ultra clean and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are a little on the small side but apart from that the place has vey few faults if any. We ate at the buffet one might which was excellent and room service was punctual and well prepared. For anyone looking for a hotel that is not in the thick of Hong Kong but in close enough proximity to shopping and night life I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. It's all about location!”
Reviews.Author: trip_momma5
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Langham for several years now - every time we visit hong kong we make sure that it's here we stay. Location is tops! Central to everything. All modes of transportation are right around the corner, from the ferry to the mtr (subway). Rooms are elegant, a little on the small side though but spacious enough knowing how precious that is in hk. Lobby is beautiful, luxe to say the least. Their breakfast buffet is tops. Well worth it as their selection is diverse. Try their homemade yogurt..to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 hotels on this trip to HK. Read my review on the Prince Hotel in the same neighbourhood! I was there for 2 nights, in a room with no view. The entire hotel uses pink a lot, even the stationery and pens are in pink, I wonder what the guys think about this color scheme! :-) My room was newly renovated, the Front Desk said. It was nice in a traditional kind of way, still carpeted with full amenities including ironing board, iron, umbrella and shopping bags. Occasionally, you will get a bell hop that's not so courteous; other than that, everyone is polite and prompt with service. The location of the hotel is not all that great but there's short cut from the driveway that takes you straight to the Harbour City in one minute. Make sure you watch out for cars though... I tried the hotel's lunch buffet, it was tasty and reasonably priced. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on its quality. Locals seem to like the food in this hotel and at lunch, it was full on the day I was there. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: blacky67
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel lived up to its reputation after several recommendations. The Langham Club is worth the extra $, will return to this hotel on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A Treat in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: TwoHams
Reviews.Content: The Langham offers visitors to Hong Kong a wonderful retreat. Beautiful rooms of a high quality, attentive and highly professional staff and we would not hesitate to stay there on our next visit to HK. We ate at their Bostonian Restaurant and the New York Deli and both are also highy recommended. Hotel ambience is a pure delight and will keep the Langham at the top of the list of Hong Kong hotels for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Lboro
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a delight to stay at. We were there for 5 nights and so qualified for an automatic upgrade to a Grand Langham Room. Perhaps not quite as spacious as we were expecting, but otherwise very good in all respects. Afternoon Tea is very well done, and you should try to fit one in – but don’t plan on a big dinner later that evening, unless your appetite is a lot more massive than ours! The location is excellent, and the staff are friendly, professional and very helpful. We booked through Trailfinders (also excellent) and paid £167 per night (without breakfast) for a twin room, which we thought was good value.

Reviews.Title: “An old classic revisited”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiJululu
Reviews.Content: It's been about three years since my last stay at the Langham's TST property and I though it deserved another review. Happily while Tsim Sha Tsui has slid downhill the Langham is as solid as ever. Lacking the high-priced views and architectural stylings of its posh neighbor the Langham concentrates on staying true to its values and providing unparallelled service. In fact, the Langham seems to have upped its game recently with a slight makeover of its decor and livery. Where this place really shines is in its ability to provide hospitality at an absurdely high level and with genuine style. The concierges and front line staff are old-school Hong Kong pros. You know... HK guys in their 50s with names like Jack or Bill, who can produce absolutely anything and everything on command. You need a weird medicinal plant at 4:00am? Solved? Directions to an underground club? A last minute outfit that includes a rare Scottish tartan not produced outside of the Hebrides? They've got it covered and take great satisfaction in doing it well. Everyone remembers your name even three years later. Impressive. It's also a nice touch that they stock the hotel with so much original art without making a big deal about it and trumpeting themselves as an "Art Hotel" whatever that is. The hotel's art collection is current, tastefully curated and appropriate. How many hotels would bother to properly mount and hang original oil paintings in the gym? Instead of filling the rooms with corporate reproductions and boring prints they decided to go with mosaics and photography. A smart move by a smartly run outfit. In the end that's what this hotel is all about. A place that polishes the bits of metal under the stairs that nobody will ever see. Because that's the standard. That's how it's done. A level of luxury that's impossible these days outside of Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Very customer focused & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Leong Y
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 3 nights here recently in June 12. We chose Langham because of the very good comments in Trip advisor. Being in the service industry, I naturally paid attention to the way the staff go about doing their business. I am impressed by the level of professionalism & sincerity shown by them. The food at the Chinese restaurant is good, the room, nice & clean & the towels, like "snow white"...we really like it. We will be back next time we come to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_RSA
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a great pleasure of being hosted by this fantastic hotel in June 2012 for six nights. From the moment you arrive in their check-in desk to when you enter the room - you are made to feel like royalty. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly - a special thanks to Steven Wong for taking time to escort us to our room and diligently answering all our questions. The hotel finishes are exquisite; attention to details is outstanding. The views outside our room were not that great, but the hotel location made up for that. The hotel is located less than a kilometer from the Star Ferry Pier - great tourist attraction and deservedly so. Internet is free through out the hotel and is fast enough to make video calls - contrary to the hotel's broacher which recommends that one upgrades to their premium, faster connection to make video calls. The hotel health gym is beautiful and well equipped - pity, I only used it once. Breakfast and dinner are truly out of this world, however, a bit pricey for my ZAR (almost at parity to the Hong Kong Dollar). We paid more than HKD 1000 for buffet dinner / two adults. All in all, I will book to this hotel again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Doing it right for over a 100 years”
Reviews.Author: Cathandchris
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the langham for a couple of years and last weekend had the benefit of 3 nights over a weekend here. Rooms are excellent , service so sharp and it still has a personal feel due to its size and profile. Location wise it. Is on the Kowloon side , which for me is great, normally I only have a couple of hours to shop for myself and partner and you are within spitting distance of the ocean terminal monolith of shopping centers. ( probably one of the most confusing shopping centers of all time been doing it for years and still get lost). The tea room is a touch twee but the food is good , normal 5 * pricing. What blows my hair back is the furnishing but more important the crockery and cutlery. The coffee cups of the finest bone china, the cutlery heavy silver and if you have breakfast in you room I swear the tray was from the initial opening in 186 something. Real class. Very close to the airport express 40 hkd cost. Excellent gym facilities , nicely lit with rooftop pool. Did I mention the service, they literally snap to attention at all points of contact.conceirge most helpfull. To get to hk ferry there and if you are out past 11 30 which is de rigor in hk taxi ride back form the night spots +_ 100hkd. All in all great value

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: It is such a pleasure to know that there a still things in this world one can rely on. The Langham is one of those things. A sublime hotel that's for sure, but the pleople who work there and the company culture of the Langham Hospitality Group make the difference in every sense. You can ask for everything and nothing is too much for the staff. The management and the staff that work at the Langham deserve all the compliments!

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Langham Hotels traveler
Reviews.Content: I travel for business at least once a month and this is probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Thank you excellent in every aspect

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for price -- just one caveat.”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a three-night stay at the Langham on this, my first trip to Hong Kong. On almost every count, the hotel was terrific: comfortable, extremely attentive staff, very quiet room, wonderful rooftop fitness center and outdoor pool, great central location (if you choose to stay in Kowloon rather than over in HK). My only caveats (which I knew and accepted ahead of time, btw) were as follows. 1. The rooms did not have free wifi, but since the lobby area did, this was not a big deal. 2. My room (and indeed most all the rooms, I believe) did not offer much of a view. I ended up spending more time in the room than I had anticipated or usually do in hotels. I thus came to wish that I had opted for a hotel with a good Harbor view, although that would have certainly cost more money. With that said, I would rate the Langham very highly, offering tremendous value for the money, provided that you can accept the absence of a view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, pay for the Club Lounge Upgrade, it's worth it.”
Reviews.Author: bazcalUk
Reviews.Content: After touring China for two weeks we were ready for a bit of a rest, NO CHANCE in Hong Kong, we love the vibrancy and colour of HK. The Langham was an indulgence, quite expensive, but worth it. We stayed 3 nights and ate in all of the restaurants in the hotel, they were all good but the New York Deli was a bit over air conditioned for our liking. The Bostonian was a bit of a dissapointment as the staff were preoccupied with Mothers Day preparations the following day, the food was okay but not as good as the price charged , and we did feel the need to have a little complain. The rooms were as you would expect at a 5* hotel and we enjoyed the relaxed and friendly atmosphere in the Club Lounge. The free loan iPad was a nice touch. Within a couple of visits the staff new us by name. Saw some of the sights we missed last time we were in HK, Kowloon Park, Zoological gardens, laser light show etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 79sgrif
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we have ever stayed in. Our room was fabulous, the service was excellent, and location is amazing. This is very central and makes getting weary sight seeing feet back to the hotel soo much easier. There is a window from bathroom to bedroom and speakers in the bathroom so you can watch tv while having a soak! Little things made all the difference, a bottle of complimentary water each day, turndown service, knew of problems by thorough checking (i.e. I said to hubby 'remote will need new batteries soon' and after next room service it had new batteries!!!!) Also they saw we had shopping and left us scissors to cut labels off new clothes. I have to say it was more than 10/10. The pool was lovely and the American diner. When we return to Hong Kong we will definitely look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: 325JohnC325
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our recent trip to the Far East and were delighted with the outstanding level of service from all the staff. Our first visit was for 6 nights and the package offered included the buffet breakfast which was excellent. In particular the warm, personal welcome from the restaurant staff every morning (they always remembered our names) was something to look forward to. The hotel is in a great location and only 5 minutes walk from the Star Ferry. Also, a short taxi ride to Kowloon Station for the Airport Express made transfer to and from the airport very easy. All round great experience!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pommiekiwi
Reviews.Content: Well worth spending a little more for the experience. Very clean and rooms were well thought out. We were talked into the Langham club. This is worth it even if you do it only once. You get the treatment in this with breakfast and afternoon tea and cocktail hour. The only thing that gets me is that not all the facilities are open to you unless you join. However the food and service are worth the extra. We stayed in a grand langham room and it was all we wanted and more. We went to of the many restaurants. The Tang Court was worth the star it has but we felt the Bostonian was just as good. A little expensive for some but there were plenty of options available. The chicken Pei dish at the Bostonian was outstanding. Would we stay again, you bet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelerFoodie
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Langham Hotel for a weekend stop over in Hong Kong - we have a good corporate rate and the location looked great for my first visit there. Overall it was a nice stay. The hotel is in a great location - probably it's biggest asset. It's located just a block or two from the Star Ferry terminal and a couple of short blocks from the MTR station. Inside it's 5-star service all the way. The lobby and public areas are very nice - lots of sculpture, gilt, mirrors, oriental area rugs, etc - your standard 5-star palace wannabe decor. The guest rooms were comfortable - a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate nonetheless. But that's just the problem. In an exciting and dynamic city like Hong Kong, I expected more than just perfectly adequate. There are no surprises here. Nothing unexpected, no "Wows" or other outstanding customer experiences. It's more of a place to take your grandmother for afternoon tea than a homebase for a fun and exciting weekend in this oh so fun and exciting city. Oh, and what is it with 5-star luxury properties that think their guests don't have the need to use electricity?!? I am so fed-up with crawling under the desk or pulling out furniture to find an electrical outlet. Don't hotels understand that it's the 21st century and most of us travel with some form of electrical devices (laptops, phones, tablets, cameras, etc.) that need to be recharged?!? At the Langham, I had to pull out and then crawl under the desk to find the only electrical outlet in the entire room! And then I could only plug in one item at a time (thank God I've started traveling with a small power cord!). So overall, yes, a nice hotel. Service and location are excellent. But be prepared to be a little bored, or else find somewhere else to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Keentravell
Reviews.Content: Mum and I decided to visit hong kong for a girly shopping trip... We took advantage of the linger for longer deal. Overall, the package was good value for money. The staff are attentive and helpful. The housekeeping were great! The only thing was that I would have liked to have tried the buffet breakfast, but its quite pricey and the hotel did not offer any specials for breakfast to be included even though we stayed for quite a while. The location was extremely convenient and the concierge would recommend places for dining where necessary. We were happy with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good at superb location”
Reviews.Author: FPFTVP
Reviews.Content: Everything you need for a nice stay in Hong Kong : location and location ! Rooms well appointed, luxury installations, nice full breakfast, large public areas and a top class gym. Stayed at the club level, but without club access. Pros : Location, Gym and Public Areas Cons : Staff very "robotic" at check in and room smelled a little damp. Check prices before you go, but I found them to have real good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a few niggles.”
Reviews.Author: Paul1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for two nights, although we were booked in for three nights we missed the first night due to flight delays. I had asked the hotel to arrange a car to pick us up at the airport which they did and it was all fine if a little expensive. We arrived at the hotel to be greeted at the car by name and taken to our room to check in which we thought would save us time, unfortunately the man checking us in had to come back three times for various reasons which was annoying after a long flight. He was also trying to sell us the club lounge which we took, but felt like he was on commission. We had a Grand Langham room which was great, couldn't fault it. The hotel is lovely and is a good example of 5 star service generally. The concierge was good and quick. The club lounge was excellent and included breakfast, afternoon tea, evening canapés and drinks all day. We drank a lot of champagne in the club lounge and the afternoon tea was effectively lunch with soup, bread, canapés, crisps and cakes. The pool is fine for a quick dip and the gym looked good. Location is great, close to star ferry and a lot of smart shops right outside. Checkout took longer than I would have liked but wasn't too bad. I would stay here again if I was in Hong Kong, a few niggles but nothing major and overall a really good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old and needs of Update!”
Reviews.Author: db190382
Reviews.Content: Staying in the deluxe rooms on the 11th and 12th floor but gotten the old room and dated. Not only that, I was greeted by the snobbish receptionist - quite disappointing with the attitude on a 5 star hotel! Rooms need updated. lack of power-points, some light bulbs were off and soapy color bathroom floor. Only the bright side the hotel has grand foyer and the perfect location - but don't expect any harbour views

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: CurryAndCaviar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here and were supposed to move to Langham Place for another 4 nights. After the 1st night at Langham Place, we checked out and moved back here as everything except the view was better at The Langham. Enough said!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super nice services”
Reviews.Author: H_Jen_Jen
Reviews.Content: Langham was highly recommended by my travel agent that I have good relationship for many years and arranged all my international trips to many parts of the world. She used to book me at Marco polo hong kong and gateway since many favorite shops are located in harbor city including toyrus and varieties of shops with children items. Almost two years ago, she suggested langham because she had a visit for inspection and found the room and service were impressive. I was not regret at all to follow her recommendation to stay at LangHam. The hotel is in Perfect location for shopping. Only a few step to duty free shop with varieties of goods, many shopping malls including ocean terminal, the one, etc, and all brand name shops are nearby. Efficient hotel room with decent space (I stayed there two times in deluxe grand room and grand room, but i could not tell the difference in term of space and other amenities except the glass window of the bathroom). Nice staffs with full service mind I experienced In all touch point. I will definitely stay at langham again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: HOLSAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at The Langham, and we cannot fault this hotel. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, plenty of drawers and hanging space and the bathrooms have large separate shower and excellent amenities. The extras include, talcum powder, shaver, comb, sizeable sewing kit and more. The staff are so attentive and will attend to any need quickly. We have checked out and having a drink in the lounge, and I needed to charge my ipad. They promptly brought me an extension cord and adaptor to do so. We will definitely stay here on our visits to Hong Kong. The position of the hotel is also excellent, close to MRT, Star Ferries, Ocean Terminal an Nathan Road...

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Y
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Langham in less than 12 months both times we stayed in the Club which gives you lots of extras, if you go on to there site you will see what I mean, to many extra's to list. This hotel is just outstanding in every way, the food the service,the staff everything is just perfect. The hotel is central in Tsim Sha Tsui only a few minutes from the star ferry and Nathan Road. We have stayed in many hotels in Hong Kong over the years and I have to say the Langham has got to be the best one yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: Convenient location just few minutes walk to MTR, Star Ferry, Nathan Rd and Harbour City. Room was very clean and comfortable and the staff at the hotel were always happy to help with any request. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Paolo_Yle
Reviews.Content: The location,mthe service quality, the rooms and service. Everything was excellent during my stay at langham hotel. The hotel is in the middle of hk downtown and you can easily reach all the hk attractions. Rooms are large, full of features and absolutelly cleaned. Staff gentle and never invasive. Food very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, perfect service.”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to Hong Kong for many years. We have stayed at more modern hotels, but we have never had a more satisfying and pleasurable stay than our recent 5 nights at the Langham. The location is perfect, less than 5 minutes walk to the Star Ferry or Harbour City. The service is unsurpassed. All the staff we came into contact with provided friendly, helpful service. The room, while not state of the art, had all the facilities we needed. Spacious, plenty of storage, comfortable bed, user friendly shower, complimentary Wi-Fi, water, fruit etc.. One minor niggle. The TV had plenty of channels but very low definition. I think the problem was the internet like interface rather than the TV itself.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for the discerning Traveller”
Reviews.Author: paulegsy
Reviews.Content: This is another hotel which surpasses all expectations. What makes it so special is the quality and friendliness of the staff. Each staff member will go out of their way to help and assist you. We tried each restaurant, our favourite was the Bostonian,special thanks to Joe. The rooms are a little on the bijou side, but they have everything you need for a perfect stay, I was more than happy with our stay here, especially how the staff made the children feel at home, this IS a top hotel but without the snobbery !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Rawya H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham for a week, the hotel staff were very helpful, the rooms were nice and spacious, i loved the aroma of the whole building.. However some of the views might not be great, the price was good.. Although an incident happen, with the bed side chocolate that they place every day, the chocolate was actually old and rotten from the inside one of my friends unfortunately ate it The compensated the chocolate and we refused and we took pictures, after that they offered us a VIP ride to the airport... but i would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant suprise, our new regular hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: globalfoody
Reviews.Content: We travel to Hong Kong pretty often and it's the first time we tried Langham. We normally stay at TST area as I like checking out the shops nearby after all my meetings though I find they've really evolved into the more expensive brands over time. Langham was really great! It was excellent service very unusual for me to find in Hong Kong. The price delivers excellent value. Even the house cleaners take the time to greet and smile. The room was very very clean and comfortable. The towels were fresh, clean and big enough. There was enough water in the room and they would restock as requested. At the end of our stay, we were assisted even to get on the airport van which all the other hotels we ever stayed at never did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and memorable”
Reviews.Author: AnNyDe
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review whilst in the "Grand" langham room. Staying for two nights between 1-3 June 2012. Arrive at 3pm but the room was not ready and have been moved few times when checking in However Langham still not fail to impress with the cleanliness of the room, combination of classic and trendy style with fruits and complimentary drinks provided in the room. The room appear have been updated! Hoping when I return tomorrow for second leg of stay check in Langham will still to impress me...!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: CooperSJCW
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit at the Langham Hotel at Tsim Sha Tsui. I'll try not be very biased since at arrival to my room, I found a dirty towel on the floor, a shoe and personal higiene garbage. Not very pleasing at all. I immeditaly complained and they upgraded me to a new and better room. So, a thumbs up for the management. Now, I understand this could be an isolated event but overall, the cleaninless of the new room was not very good. Water spots everywhere on the tables, full of dust, etc.. Rooms look dated and need a refurbishment asap. And the restaurantes are just OK including the buffest which the food is just average. On the other hand, staff are very friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect if you want to stay in Kowloon and nearby the ferries. Not a bad a hotel but nor a good one either. If you have a good rate, it could well be a choice, on the other hand, there are PLENTY better options.

Reviews.Title: “PRETTY NICE OPTION TO STAY IN KOWLOON..”
Reviews.Author: rohit_patni
Reviews.Content: If your agenda is to stay in Kowloon and look for high street fashion shopping The Langham is your right choice for stay!!! Very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Service quite good, room & location OK, gym & food disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travel12370
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business. I appreciated the personal attention with attendants recalling your name and preferences at breakfast. When the room wasn't cleaned by 5pm it was looked after quickly. The location and room were OK, forget having nice views like you do in some of the rooms in other places. I was not that happy with the gym, relatively small and quite run downn. The michelin restaurant was rather disappointing and I hope it was just an off day as the food wasn't even close to some better restaurant in the main land.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable hotel, service, enchanting, warmth, cleanliness, I am sad to leave!”
Reviews.Author: mtc888
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel off the net, I had no idea I would enter an enchanting world. The flowers/roses and scents throughout the hotel are amazing, The service is genuine and there is nothing they won't do. I was sitting in the lounge with a laptop and feel a bit overheated. They turned up with a fan to plug into my USB drive to have a nice breeze on me. Its unbelievable, I am actually depressed to leave and even after I went to the Penisular, it was cold, let me be blunt 'crap' service and I just wanted to come home. I have stayed in all sorts of hotels and some of the best 6 stars and this beats those of Dubai that I have stayed in as a business traveller. I can't wait to return on my next visit and I have something to look forward to. it's also affordable!! Food incredible weather you want a burger or gourmet meal. From restaurant to room, I can't say enough. A must visit on the bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for quality and service this hotel will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: mandeeqld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April for one night prior to a cruise. At the airport my transfer was not present when I completed arrival formalities and I was directed to the Langham counter. The welcome there was an indicator of the efficiency which I was to encounter during my stay at this hotel. A bottle of water and a refresher towel were provided immediately and steps were taken to locate my transfer vehicle (not provided by the Langham). On arrival at the hotel the check in was painless and very efficient as was the check out when I left. My luggage was taken straight to my room by the porters. There was no shortage of staff and no waiting. I had a room on the 11th. floor. The room was well appointed with good quality furnishings. The bed was king size and very comfortable. The bathroom had a shower and a bath. The water pressure was excellent and the supplied toiletries were more than adequate. I had breakfast in the hotel dining room situated to the left of reception. The selection of food was good and included western and asian dishes. I would recommend getting breakfast included when booking the hotel as my only criticism is the price of the breakfast. All in all I fully enjoyed my stay at the Langham and have no reservation in recommending this hotel to other travellers. I will certainly stay there again on my next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “"Enchanting & Delightful" with fantastic service & attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Tbuzzi
Reviews.Content: This trip was to celebrate my parents 60th wedding anniversary in Hong Kong where they met, fell in love and married in a time when interracial marriages were not acceptable, so a very important trip for them and myself. When I travel I would say I am a very discerning consumer, focussed on comfort, location and service. I stay at what the travel sites say are the 5 star luxury accommodations, and often find myself trying to figure out how they came to that conclusion and frequently feel let down or disappointed and as I spend a good 3rd of my year in hotel rooms this is not a good feeling to have! The Langham Hotel have exceeded and more than that surpassed my expectations in every way ! Overall first Impressions Concierge and Porter, extremely helpful and knowledgeable, genuinely warm and friendly Reception staff were efficient, smiled, sincere and customer focussed. Entrance to the hotel is very luxurious and feels like a modern day version of the once grander hotels in London. The theme/branding throughout the hotel is consistent and effective starting at the front desk with their signature pink pens with gold accents !. Our rooms We had one bedroom suite rooms, giving access to The Langham Club ( I am already a member of the 1865 club) which serves breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapés in what can only be described as a decadent hideaway surrounded in stunningly luxuriant upholstery with a modern twist of colours. The suites had both a living room and bedroom. The living room was equipped with surround sound system and Dvd player with an house lending library. The furnishings were not contemporary more traditional cohesive with their "enchanting" branding. The bathroom had separate shower cubicle which was very large and a huge corner spa bath, with the thoughtful addition of a pillow for making you even more comfortable while lounging in the tub ! Now ladies, I know you will be happy to learn that bathroom amenities box was filled with the most charming and luxurious shampoos , and accessories including loofah, bath salts, sewing kit, razor kit, dental kit and the other normal items you would expect to find. All again with the Langham PInk & Gold branding on all the boxes ! The bed was super comfortable and the pillows were wonderful. Turn-down service was superb where they replenished any bathroom items, added complimentary water bottles and a deliciously tasty truffle treat was left in the signature pink box on your pillow! The location is right in the heart of the Kowloon shopping areas with plenty to choose from all around, easy to get to and easy to get around. We had limo service from the airport provided by the hotel and when we arrived we were already checked in, greeted by Crystal curbside and whisked to our rooms. OUTSTANDING SERVICE. All I can say is that the Langham has set the new bar for me restored faith in service and detail orientated branding. Watch out watch out watch out ! IF YOU GET A CHANCE TO STAY HERE DO IT ! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT

Reviews.Title: “Central and very, very good.”
Reviews.Author: TheCameleer
Reviews.Content: Loved the Langham. From the lobby to the rooms, it all felt very opulent! The staff were always polite, pleasant and helpful, and as expected, the rooms had very comfortable beds. Once we figured out how convenient and efficent the MTR was, we decided we had made the right decision location wise. Very easy getting across to Hong Kong Island/Wan Chai from TST station and the Macau ferry was also close-by. We enjoyed the shopping around Peking Road as well, plus there's a really, really good bakery in the i Square if you feel like getting out and about for a stroll and something to eat. It's called Panash bakery - on the 3rd floor. At the hotel, we particuarly enjoyed eating in the Main Street Deli. The food was very retro (as is the decor) and it's quite laid back, although the service was still outstanding. We had no complaints about the langham at all, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: kevin h
Reviews.Content: I travel between shanghai and Hong Kong for business and when i arrive in Hong Kong i always look forward to staying at the Langham. It's location, staff, facilities all make for a great trip. From the pool roof, to the breakfast in the lounge they ensure your stay runs totally smoothly. The rooms are well thought out with good A/C which is needed in HK. Its location is also good with easy access to the metro, ferries, shopping and bars. I will continue to stay at the Langham when visiting HK as no hotel matches it and i should know as i have stayed at a lot of them. Only negative would be I have to leave and go home instead of staying longer. I hope you enjoy the hotel as much as i do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights earlier this month. Staff was so friendly. Rooms were nicely laid out and pretty big comparing to other HK hotels I have stayed at (I was in a Grand Langham room). The bed was so comfortable. Hotel was close to everything, the shopping, the food, and the ferry wharf. The roof top pool was great - a nice little oasis in the concrete jungle and again they really provide excellent service. Little things such as fresh dry towels after your swim, bottle of water when you arrive, relaxing music. Would love to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Langham for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. Its in an excellent location, the Tang Court is a must and the attention to detail is fantastic. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a busy location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Grand room which was new and trendy with fabulous bed and air conditioning. There was no view but we were not bothered as we kept going to Aqua Tokyo directly across the road for food with fab views. The hotel was next to the metro and various shopping malls and we enjoyed Ned Kellys a few steps away from the hotel. We didnt eat in the hotel. The smell in lobby of ginger lilies was beautiful. We would stay here again and we are hard to please. Would get a taxi next time as similar price to the bus provided by hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: VK5AKE
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the one of the better hotels I have ever stayed in. I have experienced some good hotels and some not so good ones all over the world but this one would definitely take some beating. By the way, I am talking about the Langham Hong Kong in Tsim Sha Tsui down near the Star Ferry terminal in Kowloon, not the one up in Langham Place in Mong Kok. I should also declare that my stay was complimentary as part of a prize which I won but I have not allowed that to sway my opinion at all. Everything was just perfect and the staff were really on the ball. Not only were the main things well done but all of the little things were well covered too. Just a few instances to give you an idea of what I am talking about, 1.
