Most of the better hotels have dressing gowns supplied of course but this one also has slippers provided and they are laid out alongside your bed as part of the bed "turn down" service each evening, 2. Internet is free in rooms both by WiFi and Ethernet cable and the speed was 512K or better speed when I checked it, not some slow unusable overpriced rubbish. Other "5 star" hotels take note. 3. Free bottled water is provided in rooms, no limit as far as I could tell. 4. When we went to the pool we were given a towel as usual by pool staff but were also given more bottles of water and personally escorted to a sun lounge. 5. Bath towels in rooms are changed twice a day if required. 6. All tap handles were tight, no annoying drips during the night, the TV actually worked with a good picture, no flickering lights or blown light globes, etc. And everything was spotlessly clean, yes even down in the corners behind the doors and normally out of sight. Get the idea??? This hotel not only does the standard things expected of a 5 star hotel but is always adding that little something extra to set it apart. Of course it is mainly down to good staff supported by good management. Just one further example which shows that the staff are really on the ball and cant do enough to ensure that you have a pleasant stay. On our second day we went down to breakfast and there was a family with really loud and obnoxious children disrupting the restaurant. On the next day the staff had set up a table for this family just out of the main area of the restaurant so that they were not annoying other guests but not so isolated as to make this family feel uncomfortable. A good clever compromise. As I said in the title, this hotel is just brilliant. I am looking forward to trying Langhams in other cities some time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kmstpete
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Langham. Rooms are nicely appointed, clean and comfortable...great AC which is important in hong kong. Beware of additional expenses that can quickly drive your bill up: Internet, breakfast (good, but very spendy) etc. Staff was great. If you want a hip, trendy place, this may not be your first choice, but all told, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but no views or much daylight”
Reviews.Author: 100daysperyear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May this Year and my overall impresion was very good. Attentive staff, nice decor, just refurbished it appears, etc.. Rooms are slightly small in comparison to other properties in the area and there is very little daylight in the rooms. Also this hotel has no real views of the city or harbor. Location is very good if you want to go shopping. Value for money was OK. Style is rather traditional. Breakfast was OK but nothing special for HK standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Kelvincasing
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Langham Hong Kong was good, but not without a few niggling issues. I arrived at 2.40pm after a long haul flight and was told that my room would not be ready until 3pm, the official check-in time. However, a free drink at the bar more than compensated for the wait! Location is convenient. The room was good, although a few small issues: the plug control in the bath was broken, requiring minutes of fiddling to drain the tub, the kettle was also twitchy, and had to be placed just so to work, finally I was on the top floor next to the hot water boilers, which made an annoying noise from around 6am. This probably would not have woken me, except that I was jetlagged so 6am was actually when I was trying to fall asleep. None of these are major issues, and I only mention them because this is a very high end 5* hotel. The room service was good, but not exceptional (which it should have been for the price, e.g. 200+ hk$ for breakfast). Also watch out for the bar drinks costs which are very high, 75 hk$ for an orange juice. In short, this is a well oiled machine, that will give you excellent service and comfort. Definitely would recommend if you can find a good, cut price for a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent biz and leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: applepieurs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in langham for two weeks while on a business trip to hongkong.. It is located few meters from nearest metro station and has plenty of shopping arcades nearby. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The restaurant is nice but once has more options to choose from other areas in hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a Timeless Charm”
Reviews.Author: natashakhm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in Hong Kong and this is definitely in my top 3. Firstly, the location is superb. It's close to the Tsimshatsui MRT station, Star Ferry, waterfront, food district, and few minutes walk to Nathan Road. Besides all the designer shops are located just along the same road, all within a stone's throw away. The hotel's interior has a timeless, luxurious charm about it that gives a sense of exclusivity when you step inside. Generally, the size of the room is small (typical of most HKG city hotel rooms) but the room is so comfy and cozy that we would just wanna stay in all day. After a late dinner at The Jade Restaurant just around the area (near the clock tower), we just took a leisurely walk along the waterfront, catch the symphony of lights show and retreated back to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: joyouslife
Reviews.Content: We travelled on business and really enjoyed the impecable, efficient and friendly service. Location is perfect. We booked a Grand Roomwhich was spotlessly clean (haven't experienced such a clean room for a while), attention to detail(s) in room and bathroom - just perfect. You also dont get the feel the hotel visibly saves on all ends and corners, ample of amenities and of good quality. The only thing which did not meet the rest of the 5star feel of the hotel was in my opinion the breakfast restaurant (forgot the name). A bit too touristystyle you would get in a lower category of hotel, however the service was fabolous and everything on the buffet you would wish for. All in all a hotel we seriously can recommend for any kind of trip. We will book this hotel again at our next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Thekkemadom
Reviews.Content: We chose The Langham for this our first visit to Hong Kong and we must say it was a good decision. We stayed for 5 days and would have been happy to stay for a few more. We had booked the hotel's limousine service for the trip from the airport to the hotel and the whole thing was very efficient and pleasant. We felt at home and very comfortable from the moment we stepped into the arrivals area of the airport. The Langham has an excellent location – many of the attractions and the public transport system are within walking distance. Our room was spacious, well equipped and clean (we had booked a Grand Langham Executive room) - and it was serviced regularly and well. We particularly appreciated the housekeeping staff’s attention to many small details. Food at the lobby level restaurant (l’eclipse) and at the Bar was good (we did not patronise any of the other restaurants). In spite of being vegetarians, we did not face any serious difficulty with food. The staff were uniformly friendly, courteous and helpful. What I particularly liked was the consistency in the quality of service during our entire 5 day stay. I would add that, in my opinion, this is one of the major differentiators between a merely good hotel and a great hotel. We would gladly return to The Langham on our next visit to Hong Kong, assuming of course that everything about the Hotel stays at least as good as during our recent visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury & Magnificent Service”
Reviews.Author: GDSPerth
Reviews.Content: The best service I have ever encountered in a hotel! The staff at this amazing hotel make your stay, they are so attentive to your every need and nothing is a problem or too difficult. The Lobby is Magnificent. The Main Street Deli is fabulous and service also wonderful, try the Reuben Sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: BobandAnnie
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the Star Ferry, the MTR, two shopping malls (one with an M&S) and all the designer shops within a a few minutes walk. The hotel itself is quite grand and our room had just about everything you could want - and a few things like a stapler that you probably wouldn't want.. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice of Western and Asian dishes. Our only problem was with the hotel's other restaurants. We found the service in the Ming Court far too attentive. We felt like exhibits as three staff watched us pick our way through the dishes. And the food had all the hallmarks of a one-Michelin-star chef trying too hard for his second star. The downstairs steakhouse was disappointing but the concierge redeemed the hotel's reputation by suggesting The Jade restaurant in Star House, close to the Star Ferry for our best meal of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: mallen29
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed one week at The Langham Hotel. Received very courteous and polite reception. Thank you to all the staff we met. Very professional, friendly, happy and hospitable. Wonderful customer service. And a great location for sightseeing and 'shopping'. One of the best international hotel experiences we've had. Look forward to returning soon. M & H Qld.

Reviews.Title: “my new favorite hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Filmguy7
Reviews.Content: I was there last week for a trade show, stayed in a deluxe room, the room was spacious and clean, with some really nice touches, like the swans on the towels. The the staff were really attentive, We ate in Ming Court on the first night, and that was a wonderful introductory meal to Hong Kong. As for location, it was great the Star ferry is a three minute walk. and eight minutes latter your downtown. If you stay here do not miss a splash in the pool! Now I am looking forward to returning in October for a week there with the wife.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Inviting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarkRevan
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 7 night stay in a deluxe room which was surprisingly spacious (even by Hong Kong standards) and comfortable. All staff were very friendly & helpful, there just seemed to be a good vibe amongst them which felt great because you knew you were being taken care of. Buffet breakfast at L'Eclipse had a good variety of Eastern and Western selections although it got fairly busy on the weekend. Didn't try any of the other hotel restaurants though I'll regret not having a drink or finding the time for afternoon tea at the lobby lounge. The rooftop pool is heated to a lukewarm temperature but the hotel itself is low in height and with One Peking looming over it the pool area is almost fully encircled by a wall so no vistas of the Hong Kong skyline should be expected. The gym/fitness centre is split into two small levels, top level contained a decent array of treadmills, bikes, stepping machines, a rowing machine whilst the lower level had a small selection of free weights, weight machines, punching bag, speed bag and stretching area. Room were relatively plush, decor was perhaps a bit dated but generally in good nick. We noticed that some floors had more modern rooms than ours (renovated?) but I'm not sure what type of rooms they were. Room service kept the rooms clean and tidy but importantly maintained a plentiful amount of complimentary mineral water. Hotel resides in the same complex as a DFS Galleria, literally flanked by designer stores, there are also several other shopping complexes close by Ocean Terminal, Harbour City, Sun Plaza, iSquare. Noted a few decent bars round the block down Ahsley Rd and one off Salisbury Rd (Busy Suzie?). The Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station is about 5-10 minutes walk via the street and 10-15 minutes via the underground walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Excellent service. Comfortable beds. Good room lighting.”
Reviews.Author: Mei_C
Reviews.Content: Okay, I chose this due to the ranking in tripadvisor and also because of the branding. My first time in a Langham and I really appreciated the service. Reasons: We booked a 7 seater mini van via email. The staff greeted us at arrival with complimentary drinks (orange juice, mineral water etc). Escorted us to the comfortable van. And the driver handed me a welcome note which explained the route we would take to the hotel. Check-in - I requested for a room with a shower so that my dad would not have difficulty climbing in and out of bathtubs to bathe. Peggy offered to put a non-slip mat in the shower for his safety. When we re-checked in 2 days later after a weekend in Macau, she remembered me and asked how was our 1st night stay. We had no reservation for Tang Court so we were told to wait 15min. They suggested we wait in our rooms till there was a vacant table or wait at the lobby downstairs. We waited downstairs and a waitress personally came down to escort us up when the table was available. I asked for recommendations for dinner. Allen at concierge suggested Nobu nearby and managed to get us a table. THAT was an excellent choice and definitely the highlight of our holiday. He also got us a table the next night at Yung Kee in Central where we had very good roast goose. Rooms: Comfortable, cozy, not a home away from home BUT better. There was sufficient lighting for reading, packing. But we could also lessen the brightness with bedside lamps etc. I liked the warmth of the bathroom after stepping out of the shower. No cold breeze. The bed was wide enough for probably 3. So for the 2 of us, it was very spacious. Good reading armchair. Would have been good if there was an ottoman for me to sit on so that I would not have to bend each time I re-packed my luggage at the luggage "shelf cupboard". Food: Tang Court served excellent suckling pig. Main St Deli has very good burgers, milkshakes, buffalo wings (you can ask for spicy sauce to be served separate), excellent cheese curly fries, good brioche french toast. Location: Great. 5 minutes walk from Harbour City mall. 10-15 min walk from Tsui Wah Restaurant (good pork chop bun) - use Haiphong Road. 10 min slow walk to Sweet Dynasty for soya bean curd in a tub. 15 min walk to China Ferry Terminal to take the CotaiJet to Macau. Business Centre: Free internet but if you need to print, that'll cost you. Coffee and tea are available free. The bad: Not much. The water doesn't drain quickly in the shower area so it can get slippery for older folks. The room doors slam fast and hard. That's about it! In short: I look forward to staying here again. And eating here too. Next time, I'll factor in time just for afternoon high tea in the lounge. Looks good. Note: If you find that my review has been informative, DO vote for me. Thanks in advance. Have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “After shopping and eating all day, it feels so good to come home to Langham”
Reviews.Author: gggoesplaces
Reviews.Content: Great location, shopping galore right outside your doorstop. It's also just a stone-throw away from the metro so moving around the city is a cinch. Service was excellent, the rooms were comfortable, furnishing was classic and elegant, we had lovely chocolates on the pillows at night and great smiles each morning when we went off to start the day. Though I didn't feel it was so luxurious or opulent for a five star, overall it's a great place to stay in Hong Kong. I traveled to Hong Kong with my family (senior citizens included!) during the first week of April and booked three standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “an Opulent Hotel in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: BirdPinoTrollFin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham Hong Kong in April for one night. I used to stay at another Langham property in Hong Kong, the Langham Place. There are two Langham properties in Hong Kong so not to be confused. The Langham Hong Kong is an opulent hotel, with elegant and grandeur European decoration and furnishing. The location is excellent, situated in the heart of Tsim Sar Tsue district, surrounded by many shops and restaurants. It takes only 5 minutes to walk to TST underground train station and TST ferry pier. The hotel has a very nice rooftop swimming pool and gym. I was upgraded to a suite but its standard rooms are also very spacious and bright. The services provided throughout the property are simply outstanding. The room rates certainly towards the upper scale but it is worth every cent, if you want to indulge yourself or loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrent
Reviews.Content: 6 of us in Hong Kong on a girls shopping week. We stayed here for 4 nights, 2 nights in Shenzhen and then returned for a final night here again. The hotel very kindly allow us all to leave a bag each at the hotel whilst we were in China. My room was on the 16th floor with a minor view of the harbour. The rooms were lovely, clean, quiet, and spacious by Hong Kong standards with the bath separate from the shower. We had twin beds - very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location - very close to Canton Rd and Harbour City, the MTR and the Star Ferry. A couple more minutes walk and you are at Nathan Rd. The staff were very polite and helpful; nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was fabulous. Drinks in the lounge bar also wonderful (Moet is the "house" Champange- lovely). I accidentally left my spare credit card behind in the safe, when we first left after the first 4 nights, and realising immediately what I had done cancelled it. Within 10 minutes of checking back in for our last night the assistant manager came to the room to return it to me! I have been to Hong Kong more times than I can count and will definitely come back and stay here and would recommend it to my friends and family. BTW the lobby smells divine, so much so we bought home an oil diffuser of the scent to remember the fabulous time we had there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Aytan B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. Subway is across the road, as is Nathan Rd. The ferry terminal is less then a 5 minute walk. The staff were extremely knowledgable and helpful. Also free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in HK! Best Service in Town!”
Reviews.Author: CC6983
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for anything better than Langham Hong Kong... our stay as it is every year for the last 4 years is always amazing. The service is spectacular - especially in the Langham Club, definitely well worth the upcharge. Amenities are to die for... everything you need! Also, a great combination of hotel and resident restaurants. Superb selection of local and western cuisine - hard to find in hotels sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, rooms feel dated”
Reviews.Author: Zebanuck
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful, grand hotel in a fabulous location right in the heart of Kowloon. The staff, especially concierge staff, are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Trying to find an obscure place, the concierge not only knew it but knew exactly the best way to get there to minimise hassle. Breakfasts are truly delicious with huge variety, even by Hong Kong hotel standards. The rooms however are a bit of a let down. I stayed in a deluxe room and it feels tired, dated and poorly thought out. From having to crawl under the desk to plug in my laptop (and the plug constantly falling out the socket), to the alarm clock that you can't see in the night to tell the time to the light switches that confuse and don't make any sense, these are rooms that need to be better thought out. When I travel I just want a room that works, that you don't have to fight with. However, this is still a good hotel with friendly and well-trained staff. I'd stay here again if I needed to be in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “5* Service and Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: papauniformindia
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Park Lane, Causeway Bay annually as we visit family. But because we were getting a little bored with Causeway Bay a few years in a row, we decided to try something on the Kowloon Side. The Langham Hong Kong is situated in Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. It's about a block away from Canton Road where all the designer stores are. The closest exit for the hotel is on the TST L5 exit. This is great for us, although it's quite a walk from when you get off the MTR, but on wet evenings it's great. As soon as you enter the hotel you are greeted with this gorgeous aroma which makes you feel so welcome. The Check in was smooth and quick. We had arranged the hotel back in Sept 2011 so we obtained a good rate for 2 adults and 1 child, deluxe room with breakfast, daily paper and Wifi internet. The Child bed and child breakfast came free of charge with the offer. We stayed for 8 nights. The deluxe room is actually bigger in size compared to the Park Lane even after the child bed was put in which was lovely and roomy. There was a two seater sofa and desk, TV all the iPod speakers etc which meant you could charge your ipod or iphone. Housekeeping were excellent, they recharged all your bathroom amenities and towels twice a day, in the morning and once again at turndown which meant you were never low on anything. The toiletries you get were amazingly good quality and did not have a strong odour which was good for men or ladies. There is plenty of bottled water and teabag, coffee top ups. Plenty of storage space for clothing with big double wardrobe and lots of drawers. Also you could fit two suitcases on the suitcase stand which is always helpful. Turndown was lovely and chocolates by your bed every evening, they even tucked my daughter's cuddlies every evening which was so lovely. Inclusive Buffet Breakfast was always plentiful with International selection. Don't bother with their Breakfast tea, that was the only downside, it was weak and not worth the bother. We British like it strong. I am sure The Langham in London would have better tea!!! We would have loved to try the restaurants, but because we were always invited out to dinner over the Hong Kong island we didnt get a chance. We will definitely want to try it next time. Because we have many family members in Hong Kong that we needed to contact, we would of preferred to have local calls included in our room rate, but we were told that it would be charged, but still not many hotels offer Free Wifi access and to get that included in our room rate it was a bonus. Ask for a higher floor, we stayed on the 14th floor and the swimming pool and leisure centre were on the 15th which was great as my daughter visited the swimming pool several times and loved it, right in the centre of TST what more could you ask for!!! We requested a King Size and it was like a Super King!! Lovely... To really make the stay even more memorable was that they had a lovely cake delivered to the room for my husband's birthday on a lovely silver tray with a candle and matches ready. Oh and also they had fresh fruit in the room daily..... I could go on all day about the benefits of the hotel as it is never ending..... Just the best stay ever...

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer68
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel however it is the staff that make it exceptional

Reviews.Title: “hong kong happiness”
Reviews.Author: havivaled
Reviews.Content: The Langham hotel has a great location, situated opposite train station, close to ferry, very centrally positioned. Great service, delicious breakfasts, great help from concierge and hotel staff. The rooms are smallish compared to other hong kong hotels. I would highly recommend the grand langham rooms. We had a fabulous break staying at then langham!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkhailey4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Langham Hotel in April 2012. It was our first stay in this terrific hotel and it will not be our last! Everything about the Hotel was excellent; the position, staff, food, rooms, internet access, even the bathroom amenities. We will not stay anywhere else when next in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: JWGT1957
Reviews.Content: The Langham has a great location, no argument there, service is good, but I was not that impressed with the room. I had a Grand Langham room and my first impression was how much smaller it was compared to rooms of the same class at other hotels, it just seemed cramped even for a single occupant guest so I'm glad I didn't have to share it. Rates are good and frankly considering the size of the room they need to be, BUT its still a really good hotel. I couldn't fault the service, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean and well appointed, check in was quick and efficient and the location is an easy walk to Nathan road and the Star Ferry. There are a lot of pluses, but for me it just fell short of being an excellent hotel. There are hotels that really tick all the boxes, they leave you wanting more and wanting to go back to, sorry to say for me the Langham just isn't one of those hotels. Overall a good hotel, not great but good. Personally I think there are better options in Kowloon so I wont be rushing to return to the Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in Kowloon”
Reviews.Content: I did want to stay on the island but nothing offered the same combination of location, price and reputation than this place. I had also stayed here four years ago and really couldn't complain much. My highlights this time were: transfer from airport - seamles and professional from the Langham airport desk to my room. Check-in wasn't as polished and warm or friendly as you may expect but it was efficient and they made an effort to use my name. Room was great; bed amazing - having slept in many new fangled comfort hotel beds I think this was somehow the right balance of firm and pillowy. Pool, gym and associated facilities fine but not amazing. T'ang Court fantastic, including the service. Breakfast very good, as was the dinner buffet, but this is Hong Kong and there are so many other options so try some other options if you can be bothered after a day of shopping and pounding the pavement.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: CanberraGoggles
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights in April and found the service was great. The rooms didn't quite live up to the fabulous foyer but were perfectly OK. We upgraded to the Grand Langham rooms for the first four nights, on the promise of extra space: the older Deluxe room we had for the other four nights seemed basically the same size but with slightly dated fittings. The location was sensational for the ferry and the MTR and also for cocktails at the Aqua bar at One Peking Road! Breakfast was included in our rate and was a great selection freshly cooked.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good location”
Reviews.Author: thebung
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey overall for what you can get in HK relatively speaking and not overly huge rooms unless you get a suite. Eg. room service does not allow two people to sit and eat in room very comfortably. Our Executive Suite was a bit dated but good enough. The location is the best thing for shopping in TST, fabulous foyer and restaurants. It has a good vibe overall. Aircon is very very loud, bit like a jet engine. No views at all as its surrounded by other buildings and an uninteresting main road. We've also stayed in both renovated and unrenovated rooms so def go for a new room as its a lot funkier and up to date. Club lounge is pretty good. Staff are friendly and service is excellent. Pool is nice. Buffet is great. Very nice bathroom products. Comfy beds. Clean. A good solid option.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tui shopping strip”
Reviews.Author: schia48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully designed - contemporary, but with right amount of classical touches. Located right in the shopping district of Tsim Sha Tui, Kowloon... "the new Rodeo Drive of HongKong" All the international high end shopping brands are on the strip, and across the street is the 1881 HERITAGE shopping mall housing wonderful restaurants and the across the hotel are restaurants with wonderful views of HongKong Island and harbor. It is also walking distance to the Star Ferry and walking distance to the subway. And one subway stop away is the street and night markets of Tsim Tsa Tui. Free shuttle to/from HongKong airport is located right across from the hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed and very comfortable rooms. iPhone charing / bedside radio. Very nicely appointed furniture, and especially for the business person, a nice work desk and comfortable chair. Special and beautifully designed room stationery, with pink victorian design, exquisite! The meeting rooms and function halls are very well designed and comfortable. Swimming pool is located on the rooftop of the hotel - rare to find in HongKong. Service overall the hotel is excellent. While the breakfast area is rather small, so breakfast is crowded. But food is excellent, and the service staff make an extra effort to remember how you like your eggs done - a nice service touch.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Pauline Y
Reviews.Content: My family and I usually fly down to Hong Kong annually for Easter weekend and we normally stay at The Marco Polo Hotel. Have done so for the last 10 years or so. So glad we chose to stay at the Langham this year as my family and I really enjoyed our stay there. From the moment that you enter, the bellboys and doorman are extremely accommodating. Love that there are fresh flowers in the middle of the lobby and the smell is very enticing and relaxing. The concierge were also very polite and respectful. It was my dad's birthday and they greeted him and even sent up a birthday cake for him. Housekeeping was impeccable, love all the amenities that come with the room like the flat screen, stereo, and all the little trinkets like the chocolate and the rubber ducky. Room service and luggage assistance was speedy as well. Will definitely be back. It is very clear to me that the management is exceptional and that a lot of love is put into their work. Blessings!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at the Langham for a holday over Easter for five days. The are a lot of positives about the hotel so I hope I don't come across as being too negative. Its a beautiful hotel done in the style of Langhams internationally. The suite was quite roomy and very comfortable (as you would expect), it was well-furnished and really well-maintained by housekeeping who were excellent through the stay. The Langham Club was very nice and the staff there were also excellent. Very well-trained and friendly service. So what wasn't so good. Well, just a couple of incidents which I found particularly annoying. The first was a mix-up with my booking when ai was checking in regarding my rate. That simply too too long to resolve and the fact hat there was anothe customer arguing about the same issue didn't exactly leave a great first impression about the hotel. What I have found even more anoying subsequently is that I have been advised by the person who responded to my guest questionnaire that they can't see any issue with my booking to have caused that in the first instance. The other incident was the one I found most annoying. I needed an umbrella one evening and the concierge made me wait and wait and wait. He was on the phone but rather than acknowledging my presence, he actually turned away so he didn't have to acknowledge me. That one really hit the button on the "grrrr" factor. Overall, the incidents contributed to an average experience, clearly below the standards of what I expected and no doubt, what management expects. I procrastinated between three and four star but decided on four in the end seeing the issues were isolated and not pervasive. I have had mangement in touch with me post my feedback which I appreciated and I don't doubt their sincerity regarding their disappointment with how I found my stay. I will try the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good five star hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: FabioDaGenova
Reviews.Content: We spent a few day holidays in HK. The Hotel is an average five stars hotel. The service is good and the room price is acceptable. The location is simply perfect, just few steps from the tube station. As a negative notes: the size of the rooms, the cost of extras ( we were charged about 100 usd per person for a dinner in the buffet restaurant), but especially we were annoyed by very long queues in front of the breackfast room (15/20 minutes at least). All in is anyway a good option in HK if you want to stay in a 5 stars reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Barbara A
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat myself to an Easter break at the Langham in HK. As a woman travelling alone it can be daunting at times, however the staff at the Langham made me feel so welcome I looked forward to returning everyday after my day trips. The concierge arranged my train ticket to China in a most enthusiastic manner and nothing was a problem to him. His colleagues were also aware of my plans in case he was not available. The Langham Club was a pleasure to attend for breakfast and afternoon teas. Once again the staff were superb. Staying at the Langham and being in HK/China really highlighted what service and friendliness is all about and I am sorry to say, lacking in Australia. So if you go enjoy and absorb the wonderful surrounds as well as the people. Barbara A of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Ashley x
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel ,so convenient and so close to everything .The Star Ferry , metro and shopping mall are all very close . But the best part of this hotel is the service , the staff are all very friendly and professional . We like to stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city hotel”
Reviews.Author: jskiba55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 2 nights and then again for 4 nights (spent 1 night in Macau in bewteen). I spent the first 2 nights in a classic room and was given a complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe room when I returned for the 4 night stay which was very much appreciated. Rooms: This is Hong Kong so obviously the rooms won't be huge. The classic room was fairly small but didn't feel cramped at all and there was more then enough space for 2 people. The bathroom was a little strange as the shower was quite large but the rest of the bathroom was small and any smaller would have been a problem. The Deluxe room which was also on the club level was on the larger size compared to other large city hotels. Again, the bathroom was still small. Rooms were decorated beautifully and were quite luxurious. Beds were firm but still comfortable. The rooms is packed full of fantasic small amenties which really show the attention to detail by the Langham e.g. a box full of a lot of toiletries, pads and pens, magazines and even a small stationery kit. Rooms were also kept spotlessly clean. Housekeeping were very good. Public spaces: Lobby was really beautiful. The smell was great and it was a real pleasure returning to the hotel at the end of a busy day shopping and exploring. Service: Amazing. All staff members went out of their way to help in any way they could. All doormen greeted us warmly every time, reception were professional but also friendly and concierge was very helpful in giving directions and explaing how to get around on the MTR. Turn down service was done every night including a chocolate on the bed, slippers set out as well as a card stating the next days weather together with a nice quote from previous famous Langham guests. Location: Perfect. Even if I wasn't 100% satisfied with the hotel itself, I would return simply because of the location. 1 minute walk to Canton Street (luxury shopping), 2 minute walk to Nathan Road, 2 minute walk to TST MTR Station which takes you any where easily and 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry Terminal. Food: We had room service a couple times. It was very good but not amazing. We also ate at the buffet. It wasn't cheap by Hong Kong standards but it was good value. There were many types of food and really good quality. It is a very good option if you are tired after a long flight or after a long day out in the city. A good tip is to try Din Tai Fung at the top of the Silvercord building on Canton Strett. It has amazingly good food and is really cheap. I think it has a Michelin star. Overall: Firstly, I would also advise anyone to stay on the Kowloon side as it has a much more "real Hong Kong" feel. If you do decide to stay in Kowloon, I highly recommend the Langham. Beautiful hotel, luxurious feel, perfect location and great staff. ONE MORE TIP: While the MTR is the best option to travel around, if you do get a taxi make sure that you print off the "take me here card" (available on the hotel website although I am sure they would also give them out at the hotel) as we got in a taxi and told him Langham hotel and he almost took us to Langham Place Hotel before I realised were were in the Mongkok area and showed him the card to ensure he took us to the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location , food and service”
Reviews.Author: momscookintravel
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel ... so close to everything .The Star Ferry , metro and great shopping are all very close . But the best part of this hotel is the service , the staff are all very friendly and professional . Would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingko2
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing welcome at this hotel. We had been a few times before, but don't think that was anything to do with it. Our room was so comfortable. Complimentary wifi. Very quiet. Slept well after flight from UK. So handy for Harbour City and cruise terminal

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui area with good value”
Reviews.Author: ctashana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Sept 2011 and got a good price at the junior suite room coz we booked 3 months in advance. The hotel is in the middle of the the Tsim Sha Tsui road surrounding by shopping centers and shops. Great area indeed. The suite is perfect with all day access to the lounge. The room separates the bed room and sitting area while the bathroom has a jacuzzi in it, amazing!. The service is also excellent with the hotel staff who can speak perfect English which is rare in HK :) The Room service is also delicious as our daughter orders some kids meal and it comes with a complete meal with dessert and juice. MTR is also close by so it is very easy to go around the city. We really recommend this hotel every time you visit HK as it is very convenient, great service and we think it is the best hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui area with good value as we have stayed in other hotels in the area and none like this. with dessert and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the price of the hotel rooms and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: PPD590
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the Langham based on all the great reviews I had read online. However, when we got to the hotel (noon), we were told that a double bed we had booked was not available and only twins were available. We objected as we were also on our honeymoon. Then we were told that a room with a double bed had become available but we had to wait 3.5 hours while they cleaned it. Upon checkout, there was an extraneous charge of over $130 on our credit card as well. I had to call the hotel once I was home to reverse it. Overall, the hotel is very nice and in a good location but the staff were not friendly and our reservation was not accomodated. Since we were only in Hong Kong for two days, the hotel wasted a good part of our first day there. I do not recommend this hotel as the price is high for what you get. There is a Sheraton just down the street, which we stayed in other cities in China, with much better service. We travelled for 3 weeks in total and this was the worst place we stayed based on the value for our dollar and the poor customer service. The lobby was also very chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smr289
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel from the minute we walked in to the beautiful flower scented foyer. We arrived at around 8 am and were told our room was ready which we never expected. After an overnight flight this was very welcome news. The staff were all excellent, couldn't do enough for you. We had a suite so had club floor access too. Best club we have ever been in, food, wine, breakfast were excellent. Our suite was perfect with everything we could require for a great stay. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Hong Kong. Can't fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Retiredozy
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Langham on 3 occasions whilst visiting Hong Kong. Having spent many nights in hotels across the world, I view the Langham as one of the best. From the moment you arrive, nothing is too much trouble. There is a very clear customer focus, backed up with flawless delivery by all staff. More importantly, the rooms are incredibly quiet, well appointed, of a very high standard, and sleep comes easy. As usual, leaving the hotel was difficult but once again maintained the high and expected standard for a return visit. One of the worlds best!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ArronDain
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Langham Hotel twice now and will be staying there again for Christmas 2012 - The staff are polite, friendly and helpful, also check is was a breeze and hassle free (accept the 2nd time - they thought me and my mother were husband and wife and booked us in for a double bed - so we kindly told them we were mother and son, they upgraded our room and fix the mix up very quickly) The rooms are a pleasure to stay in, I loved having a bath and watching the widescreen TV through the open shutters (Thanks to the upgrade on the room) next trip I will be in this room again I can not downgrade, it would kill me - however the rooms a grade below were very nice as well. There is a tailor shop in the hotel called Tak Tak Tailor the service in there is superb and the quality of shirts made is sublime - Looking forward to choosing fabric for my next few shirts. My mother say the food was really good - sadly I can not comment I was not to well the day we actually ate at the hotel, so I was not in the mood to eat. Oh and the Lobby Lounge serves kopi luwak - which is my favorite coffee. I recommend this hotel everyone - if you are going to HK for the firs time, you will be please to know that The Langham is located very nicely and makes getting around the rest of HK easy. I Stayed at the Langham in May 2006 and Oct/Sep 2009 (I put May 2011 on selection - as it would not let me date back to when I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Langham Hotel. The location is excellent - close to Star Ferry, Nathan Road, a five minute taxi ride from the Airport Express station. The staff is attentive. The rooms are a reasonable size, and if you have travelled in Hong Kong you know that sometimes the rooms can be small in hotels. The gym is good, if a bit cramped. Beds comfortable, really a good place to stay. Pricey, but that's Hong Kong. My one complaint was that the room was not ready for us when we checked in at 4 pm. This seems a bit much, and I certainly didn't feel like the free drink in the bar they offered as a consolation. After a long day of international travel, not what you are expecting. However in all other respects the stay in the hotel was good. The free wi-fi, allowing three devices on a room connection, is a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: ben s
Reviews.Content: Was a great hotel, excellent location, rooms were top notch! service was brilliant a first class experience!

Reviews.Title: “Langham is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: CezCLee
Reviews.Content: We travel yearly to Hongkong for the past 20 years for shopping, pleasure and business. We bring our 5 kids along or at times just one of them. Our stay in Langham was so far one of the most awesome experiences especially in their club floor. My husband prefers the executive or club floor whenever we travel- for the high tea and cocktail, since enjoy drinking wine before dinner. The room we got was so Victorian just like the amenities and the set of toiletries they give their guests. It is so classy and nice. The price you pay is worth it. And an added bonus is the accessibility to the shopping centers and MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Simply divine!”
Reviews.Author: redwinegum
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best places I have ever stayed. From the second you walk into the stunning lobby, you are in a tranquil hideaway. So many thoughtful little touches that other hotels do not even compare. Was there anything I thought I needed? It was already provided. I could not think of one thing to make it better. An umbrella for when it rains - in the wardrobe. A power adapter for my laptop - on the desk. An office kit with stapler, paper clips & scissors - in the desk drawer. I had a wonderful stay (with the best pillows) and cannot wait to go again. Also, excellent advice from Edward (concierge) for helping me to plan a one day adventure in HK on my day off. A beautiful hotel with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Of Any 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KD1556
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at some pretty great hotels before...The Lodge at Koele (Lanai, HI), The Oriental (Bangkok, Thailand), The Four Seasons (Maui, HI), Pertiwi Villas (Ubud, Bali)....for us, the Langham Hong Kong offered 5 star service right up with the best in the world. I would say, edging them all out by a smidge. We stayed in late Feb 2012 for 6 nts. for a total deal...Linger for Less Package offered 20% off room rate, free buffet breakfast for 2, and free wireless. Also upon availability free room upgrade and late checkout. We arrived to a full hotel late that night and was told that the standard rooms were ready but the 1 upgrade rooms were all booked. With a little bit of dissapointment we showed, they must've felt bad for us, so what did they do? They offered us a Double Upgrade! We had a big room with a huge bath (soak in tub and sep shower). The room was beautiful, immaculate and tasteful. The housekeeping service was top notch...they turned down our rooms nightly and left 4 water bottles and chocolates for us daily. At the LEclipse Restaurant, the breakfast buffet was unbelievable. The selection went from Western omelet station to Chinese noodle station, even some dim sum selections, huge selection of fruits, cereals, breads, even a small salad bar, hummus and pitas...etc. Unreal! After the first 2 days, the super awesome service-oriented staff greeted us by name, and even knew our coffee and cappicionos orders in before we even sat down. They were so on top of it ! The hotel's location is the BEST. It's right in the HEART of everything - turn right and you are heading toward the largest shopping center ever Habour City. Turn left and you are headed toward Nathan Road and all it's small shops and restaurants and foot massages and ChungKing Mansions where you can get a better currency exchange rate than anywhere else. If you cross the street, you are right across the MTR station and can go anywhere you want from there. We purchased the Octopus card which we used at the convenience stores and little shops that accepted them all over the city. We rarely caught a cab (which is cheap to do by the way) because our train station was right across the hotel. We only used Star Ferry once as transportation to HK island since the MTR being right across from us made it so convenient. Our hotel connected also to DFS (Duty Free Shopping Mall) which was very awesome! Our stay revolved around sightseeing and shopping as this was our 1st time there....we visited the Big Buddah, Victoria Peak, Kowloon Park, Kowloon Walled City , All the markets....Flower- Bird- Fish-Ladies- Temple St. Markets....Mid-levels and Time Square on Hong Kong Island, more shopping ctrs. than I can remember, Disneyland , Ocean Park, Stanley Park, etc....people asked us what is there to do in Hong Kong that we stayed so many days...there's so much to do and see ....bring comfortable shoes because you will be doing an extensive amount of walking if you are not on a tour bus. Its fun to explore. We always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the gem of Asia”
Reviews.Author: Paulk0
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a top notch hotel with excellent location, service, restaurants, accommodations, and a very personal touch in Hong Kong,The Langham is the place for you. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Do take advantage of their airport transfer service, especially if this is your first trip to Hong Kong. The location is very convenient to shops, restaurants, The Star Ferry, public transportation, tours, and the bay. High end shopping, fantastic restaurants, places to just get a drink or snack are steps away, but don't overlook the Langham's own restaurants for a dining treat. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet every morning and this was one of the best buffets I have ever experienced. I cannot say enough about this fantastic hotel its staff, and dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownChris
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel is a luxury hotel situated most conveniently in the Kowloon area of Hong Kong. It is close to the MTR (tube station), the Harbour Place (shopping complex with ALL the name brands represented) and the Star Ferry which takes you to Hong Kong island. The ramp to the airport highway is literally on the doorstep. The staff rate as THE most helpful and courteous I have seen in a hotel especially the concierge crew who know your name from the time you check in and were very helpful in confirming onward flights and giving good advice. It is worth your while to join the Club at the Langham which is on the 11th floor. This costs about US$100 but is worth the cost with breakfast, afternoon tea and evening coctails as well as internet useage (throughout the hotel) included in the fee. The background 'elevator music' playing throught the hotel irritated me a bit by being intrusive and you just can't escape it. Other than this, it was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rdehavil
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Peking Rd Langham in Hong Kong for many years, 4 times a year. It feels like home to me. The staff are amazing and never fail to recognize me when I arrive, a big 'welcome back' always makes me feel good. Rooms I've stayed in are always good and service is incredible, so fast and reliable. Food options are many, I usually do breakfast in the ground floor restaurant, this is a buffet like you have never seen before. usually late back form the office so room service for me, lots and lots of options- all great. Every need is met here in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it would stay again - minor fault”
Reviews.Author: Reveka K
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk into the lobby it's all luxury at the langham. The staff are super friendly and everything is immaculate. We spent a week there with our 2 year old, whilst not the sort of place where your kids can run a muk accomodating for our daugher was no problem for the hotel staff. It's a great location close to shops and the Ferries. There is the most fantastic smell in the lobby and the concierge team were awesome at giving advice on local activities. The very minor fault is the quality of the shampoo/soap provided, whilst not bad everything else at the langham is superb and this was really the ONLY fault i could find after spending a week there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: DavidS19
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few days in Hong Kong at the Langham Hotel, Tsim Sha Tsui and have to tell you all what an absolutely superb experience it was from arrival to departure. Could not fault the attention to detail, the service given and general all round standard of this hotel. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Hong Kong, I would seriosuly recommend this place to make your stay even more enjoyable and if on business, a relaxing way to do it in between the cut and thrust of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Feel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gentlejourneys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Hong Kong and stayed at the Langham hotel for 8 nights. This was my first time in Hong Kong and I found the Langham to be the perfect hotel for an introduction to the city. Centrally located in Tsim sha Tsui (Kowloon) right near the Harbour City shopping mall, the Star ferry, MTR bus station, the cultural centre, Nathan Road and the subway system, we found it easy to get around the city both on foot and on public transit. (We never took a taxi except to the airport.) Shopping is great - from the major designer stores just across the street to the trendy little boutiques and open markets a little farther away. The rooms are comfortable having more of a boutique look and feel. We stayed in a standard room which was modern, upscale in decor including travertine-tiled bathrooms with walk-in showers and roll-top tubs. All the amenities ie: shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, bath salts, soaps, sewing kits, toothbrushes/paste, combs, talcum powder are wrapped in pretty pink boxes and contained in a leather box. There’s even a souvenir rubber swan for your tub. An iron, terry robes, slippers, safe, blow-dryer, scale, plug converters and flat screen TV are also standard features in the room. The lobby is spacious with a bar/lounge area (the Palm Court) to one side, complete with comfortable armchairs and love seats for drinks or high tea. On the other side of the lobby is the breakfast area/restaurant, l’Eclipse, which serves a sumptuous buffet breakfast offering Western, Middle Eastern and Chinese dishes. Speciality coffees such as lattes and cappuccinos can be ordered and once ordered, the servers seem to remember from then on. Service for breakfast is attentive and courteous. There are several restaurants on the premises, two of them featuring American cuisine - the Bostonian which serves a 16 oz steak, and the Main Street Deli (for when you just want that Reuben sandwich with fries and onion rings.) There is a roof-top pool/health club complete with all the machines you’ll need for a workout. I definitely want to return to Hong Kong and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: pauly1976
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and fantastic location. Great service and one of the nicest rooms

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: HuntleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities food & service. Club is well worth it. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Basil-Forties
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the Langham during business trips and love what it has to offer. The position is fantastically convienient, the staff are extremely helpful and welcoming, the rooms are well proportioned, the beds extremely comfortable and the lounge has a relaxed atmosphire to enjoy in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “Flawed beauty”
Reviews.Author: eaststar
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old grand dame, set in a terrific convenient location in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui and within walking distance of the luxury boutiques, shopping centres and attractions. Although it's an older property, it's well-maintained and still very beautiful. But there are some big flaws to this property that make me have second thoughts about staying here. Small as they may be, they pose real inconveniences and problems, which you shouldn't have to face at a 5-star hotel. First is that there are only two electrical plugs in each room, located at the far ends. This makes charging your devices really inconvenient, and you'll have to call for an extension cord, and even then it means you can't sit on your bed and use your laptop. There's also no outlet in the bathroom so you walk around with wet hair looking for a place to plug in the hairdryer. It's incredibly short-sighted and very clear that this hotel is not planned for business travellers or anyone who uses electrical devices. I stayed at the Crowne Plaza at Causeway Bay and that hotel, although costing much less than the Langham, was a joy, not least because it had electrical plugs around the room and at eye level, making for easy use. The hairdryer at the Crowne Plaza was conveniently kept in a drawer in the bathroom and always plugged in, ready to use and store. The Langham disappoints on this very basic facility and gets a lower rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from friendly staff in a serene environment”
Reviews.Author: LibbyLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: We were overwhelmed by this hotel. It is in a fabulous TST location - so central to everything. Can walk to many places in TST, over the road from MTR station and up the street from the Star Ferry. Also across the road from Harbour City - the biggest Mall in HK. All at what seemed like a bargain price compared to its other 5-star cousins. Not sure what I loved most - the amazing staff or the luxurious environment. Every time we returned to the lobby we felt like we were entering a sanctuary in the middle of a bustling city. It is serene, calm and quiet. Staff are everywhere but are unobtrusive. They attend to your every need - even those you don't realise you have! I looked at many of the 5-star hotels because I wanted to stay somewhere special for our romantic "without children" getaway. We are so glad we stayed at The Langham and will recommend it to everyone. If you stay there you have to speak to Noel at the concierge desk - she is a gem. She was so helpful - every day she's show us how to get to where we needed to go and she even taught us some basic cantonese. The breakfast buffet was incredible - in fact I gained 3kgs in our 10 days which I can only put down to the sumptuous array of food each morning! I also recommend using the airport limo service - fabulous way to get to and from the airport -so easy and a real treat, given HK taxis are pretty basic! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Second review for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wynn17
Reviews.Content: I used to give this hotel 4 stars last year. But now It's 4 pm already and I am sitting at the lobby unable to check in. They said I have to wait for 2 more hours. Its unacceptable since Ive reserved it for a week in advance

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Langham, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: 2penniesworth
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time considering various hotels for our 4 night stay in Hong Kong and finally picked the Langham after seeing the reviews on trip advisor. We got a very good deal, paying half the price of other 5 star hotels like the Peninsula and the Mandarin Oriental. Included was room and breakfast plus free wifi throughout the hotel. The Wifi was a huge bonus for us as we really needed to stay in touch with home for work and personal reasons. We checked in roughly an hour and a half before the official check in time. Our superior room was on the 11th floor and had a lovely view of a tower block around 20 feet away! We knew that we weren't going to get a room with a view in this hotel and so we weren't disappointed. The room, which had a very comfortable king size bed plus two seater sofa and armchair was, in our opinion, more than ample size although maybe that is because we are used to European hotels. Plenty of drawers and wardrobe space too. Maid service was very efficient, we didn't once come back to find them in our room. Upon turn down, we were given chocolates on the bed which were fabulous and a little card with a quote from a different famous 'former resident' of the Langham hotels and the weather forecast too. We were also given a newspaper of our choice every morning. Breakfast in the morning was very good, with a selection of continental, English and Chinese options. Eggs were cooked to order and a couple of days my partner ordered Eggs Benedict which he really enjoyed. Only shame was that it ended at 10.30am and with the jet lag we really struggled to be down before 10, therefore every day we got to breakfast we were warned it finished in half an hour. A small point to worry about and we were never actually rushed out the restaurant. The common areas are lovely. The hotel is scented as most seem to be these days. Not offensive at all and a welcome change from the smog and pollution of HK. We didn't eat in the hotel for lunch or dinner but had a few drinks in the Lobby Bar where service was good and efficient. Location wise, I don't think you could pick a better spot in Kowloon. Right on Canton Road and about a 10 minute walk from Victoria Harbour. 5 minutes in the other direction is the nearest MTR station which, when you are returning to the hotel, has signs for which exit to take for the Langham. All in all I'd thoroughly recommend the Langham for a short stay in Hong Kong. We felt it offered excellent value for money and was a welcome oasis from the hustle and bustle and general madness of Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back...”
Reviews.Author: Withyourightfoot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langham Hotel for 4 nights in January. Having no expectations I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel itself is gorgeous, very decadent interior. Our room was very nicely decorated; the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom lovely. The staff were more than helpful and extremely friendly. We had access to the Club Lounge, which if you can gain access is well worth it. Breakfast is served there, as well as canapés and drinks in the afternoon and evening. The hotel's location is very central to everything. It is a 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry, set just next door to one of the largest malls. The only down side to this hotel is it is on the more "touristy" side. From the moment you step outside the hotel, you find yourself in amongst the masses! Having said that though, we would stay there again, happily.

Reviews.Title: “two separate stops at The Langham”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were travelling to New Zealand and chose to stop in Hong Kong to break the journey. The Langham was recommended and we made a booking. It is easy to get to from the airport if you use the Airport Express and then 5 minutes in a taxi. We went for the Grand Room deluxe rooms which were great with style and comfort and space. The hotel is very near the star ferry and the views of the Mina Hong King Island from the nready Intercontinental Hotel by the sea or the viewing area by the star ferry are fantastic. WE enjoyed the stay so much the first time we chose to stay again on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryKearney
Reviews.Content: I travel the world on business, staying at many hotels, and The Langham Hotel Hong Kong is my favorite. Other hotels are as comfortable, and we are talking ultimate 5 star comfortable, but The Langham matches comfort with service. From the limousine drivers to the door openers, valets, concierges, welcoming staff, room service people etc etc, I feel relaxed, pampered and content just being at this wonderful establishment. Location is also wonderful, near shops and the Harbour. And it is just a 30 metre walk to my favorite restaurant, Aqua Hong Kong. Bliss!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet luxurious retreat in the heart of bustling HK”
Reviews.Author: Shona-Charlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Langham ending our round the world trip. Just as many have said before us everyone you meet in hotel is extremely welcoming and helpful. We had booked a Grand Double Room but on arrival were told that we were to be given a twin room. I said we had booked double and was a bit suspicious when there wasn't even the suggesting of pushing the beds together. It made me wonder if we had been 'downgraded' to a pokey little room. I was a bit concerned about that as previous Tripadvisor comments include mention of the rooms being small. However, when I showed the guy my confirmed booking form he popped away for a few minutes (presumably to get confirmation he could change our room) and when he came back he said that we would be 'upgraded'. I'm not sure what the upgrade was as it was a king size bed which is what I thought we had booked anyway. However, the room was gorgeous and luxurious and (thankfully) we will never know if the twin room would have been 'pokey'. This was our first visit to HK and not only do we intend to return but we would definitely stay again at the Langham. It was just such a treat to return (exhausted) at night to a cocktail in the lobby bar where we enjoyed listening to the pianist and beautiful singer. And then returning to our room when the bed had been turned down and a chocolate placed on our pillow. The Langham is glamorous and does have an air of European elegance. The smell of the lillies is everywhere and just wonderful (although I appreciate it might not be to everyone's liking). I, however, loved it and have returned home with the fragrance oil and room spray. We booked on room only basis but I think if we were going back we would make sure to eat in one of the 4 (I think) restaurants. The front desk at check-in told us the hotel was full two days of our stay but I can honestly say that we never had a sense of that - either in the public areas or from noise in the corridors or rooms. The concierge desk were extremely helpful when we needed to see a doctor / hospital (long story which i won't bother with here) and even asked if we wished the personal assistance of the Duty Manager. One odd thing however which I don't think was the fault of the hotel but could have found us in a pickle, was that both the front desk and the concierge desk had told us on several occasions that the cost of the taxi to the airport would be approx 250 Hong Kong dollars and no more than 260. When we got to the airport (after a near death experience of being driven at breakneck spead) the taxi meter showed 180 dollars. Then the driver pushed a button and the screen jumped to 365 and he said that was the fare. I queried that and said the hotel had said 260 and he opened the door and pointed to the 'additional charges' which he said were for using the airport expressway and the luggage ! Now, either he was just at it and we were ripped off or the Langham don't quite understand the pricing policy. Either way, we were lucky to have had that bit extra cash on us. We did think, however, that the Langham offer a limousine service at about 700 dollars I think, and had we realised the cost of the taxi at 360 then we may well just have opted to end the stay in the same luxury as the hotel and taken the limousine. It's worth thinking about if, like us, your early morning flight means the airport shuttle/MTR/bus is not an option. Overall, a wonderful hotel and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The experience at the Langham made out trip”
Reviews.Author: Genelle01
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted at the door, the Langham staff could not have made us more welcome, a brilliant location lovely lounge after a hard day shopping and the best concierge experience, the breakfast was top notch and dinner at Tiang Court superb, it was my first time in Hong Kong and cannot wait to return and I'll be staying at the Langham

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Perth0990
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights 6 days. From the moment we walked in to the fantastic foyer, to the time we left the staff were absolutely brilliant. Nothing was too much for them, always lots of staff on hand to help everyone. We stayed in a suit for my wife's 50th, the hotel asked was there any special occasion for our visit, which my wife explained it was her birthday. So after returning from an afternoon of shopping (not my idea) there was a birthday cake from the hotel. We had lounge access and every time we visited the lounge, we were met by the friendly staff calling us by our surname. The food from breakfast to so called canapes (more like small buffet) was excellent, along with the drinks they provided. Tea and coffee in silver pots and served on a sliver platter. The breakfast buffer (stayed her before) has some thing for every one, the best I have ever had any where. To appreciate it two night is a minimum. We cannot fault our stay and would not hesitate to return on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel In Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at both The Langham & Langham Place hotels (they are sister hotels) in February 2012, staying at The Langham for one night courtesy of a botched flight itinerary on my return to Australia. It was at Hong Kong Airport that I found out there was a vacancy at The Langham, so I had an unexpected extra day at Hong Kong, and stayed this extra night at The Langham. I thought that the rate was quite reasonable, and I had a room that was of reasonable size, that was very nicely decorated (The Langham is more "classic" style, while Langham Place Hotel is more "modern"). I found the wifi signal a little more steady at The Langham than it was at it's sister, as I found myself constantly having to re-login with my password if I went out of range at LPH. The breakfast was of a reasonable price, not exactly bargain price, but not ridiculous either. It was very nice, with croissants and scrambled egg + toast. I was leaving in the evening, and had dinner out, so I didn't get a chance to look at the lunch/dinner menu. The porters were very helpful with my luggage, and very swift in arranging a taxi for me. I would certainly pick The Langham if you want to stay central to both HK island or Kowloon, but you want a quieter district. Her sister, LPH, is located around the hectic Mong Kok MTR district, whereas Tsim Sha Tsui seems just a little quieter. Right across the road from the hotel is a station that takes you to either Tsim Sha Tsui or East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR stations (they are interconnected underground), so it's very easy to get around HK from this location. I think it took me about 20 minutes from leaving the hotel to get to Statue Park/Cenotaph. It's also quite easy if you are going to Lantau Island, either for the airport/cable car/Disneyland, although it should be pointed out that you need to switch trains to get onto the orange line. I would recommend The Langham - I have read on some of the reviews here that some people regard the rooms as quite small, yet I stayed in some much smaller rooms in places like London & NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but should have been somewhat better”
Reviews.Author: pandpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before leaving on a cruise in a deluxe room. It was small. Well appointed and thoughtfully set out but small. Hotel service was quite good but never exceptional. Food was fine but not memorable including dinnner in their Michelin star restaurant. The hotel is very pretty and superbly located but it lacked warmeth and intimacy. There is nothing in parituclar I fault the hotel with, simply that it was missing the key ingriedients that transends a good hotel into an exceptional one that you hate to leave and yearn to return. All in all, probably more of a business hotel and perfectly proper, but I'd go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Jazzhou
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hong Kong is a gem tucked in the bustling conspicuous consumption of west Tsim Sha Tsui. It was my first time staying at this property and I will stay there again. I usually stay at the vicinity of Nathan Road further east. What I liked the most is the deferent helpfulness of the staff in comparison to other hotels in the area. Upon entering, one senses the pride of the Langham brand in the lobby. The pride can be found in the hotel details, from the decor to the stationery. Most of all, the staff at the Langham really makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best experience ....”
Reviews.Author: Theresa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Langham, Kowloon, for three nights in Feb 2102. We chose a Langham Grand room and we were not disappointed. The standard of service and accommodation is 5 star. The team managing and servicing this hotel is well trained. The best we have experienced at any of the eight hotels we stayed at during our seven weeks trip. The room really was Grand and spotlessly clean. Daily complimentary tea and coffee is the norm in most hotels, however, complimentary bottled water and fresh fruit was an unexpected bonus. We believed that a "turn down bed" services is a thing of the past but at the Langham, it's all part of the service. The Langham's restaurants also provide the same high level of quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay again”
Reviews.Author: mandeville-travels
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel. This is a great place to stay - comfortable beds, lovely bathroom with excellent toiletries, an extensive buffet breakfast was also included in the room rate. A minor quibble - as noted by others the front desk staff and concierge service was sometimes inconsistent and needed follow up. A very small glitch in an otherwise excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and great sleep”
Reviews.Author: Dogmastervincent
Reviews.Content: The room deco was nice with European ambience. Location of hotel was great as it's conveniently located in the middle of the shopping belt. Thumbs-up for the turndown service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: basaa
Reviews.Content: it's located at the heart of Kowloon. The entrance is unattractive and the lobby is just functional, but the rooms, restaurants and staff makeup for those shortcomings. The staff really treats you royally. Our colleague was a bit demanding for not getting a room even at 1 PM (check in at 3 PM), They went out of the way to get her a room. Visited 2 restaurants and both lived up to expectations. The business and tourist district is just a street away. While those areas are noisy and full of hustle-bustle, the hotel is located in a quieter section. I would not mind staying here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and beauty.”
Reviews.Author: AMBChicago
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel with a great location. The concierge, Stephen, took care of numberous items before we arrived, including tours, ways to get in from the airport, and having all the linens changed to non-allergenic materials. Once we arrived he was even more helpful. We stayed in a standard room and the finishes were absolutely beautiful and impeccably clean. The breakfast that came with our room rate was outstanding. The choices were unbelievable. They even have a machine that makes fresh pancakes. The omelet maker is really skilled and everything was fresh and delicious. They bring you a pot of coffee and a pot of tea, so you don't have to flag down staff to get a refill. Both were yummy. The lobby is beyond beautiful as is the tea area and bar. The flowers will knock your socks off! Gorgeous and fragrant. Staff are friendly, efficient, courteous and competent. Definitely a five star +++ hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class experience”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Langham numerous times and each time it gets better! I seriously suggest you pay the extra for the Club lounge facilities as the service and facilities of the club are second to none. It is a real treat to stay there and use them! The staff around the hotel are very welcoming, courteous and helpful should you need any guidance on anything. The facilities and rooms are clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice refurbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: YewMing
Reviews.Content: My usual hotel whenever i'm in HK. Very conveniently located in TST and is walking distance to the train station & Canton road which is the Rodeo drive of Hong Kong. Good value for money and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: PALMS4EVER
Reviews.Content: The staffs in Langham shoud be awarded the most friendly and efficient staffs in HK. You can tell that they genuinely are happy to have you stay in their hotel. The little touches like chocolates and fortune cookies (we stayed during Chinese New Year) are so charming. The buffet breakfast selections were wonderful and of quality good. There were so many varieties, it was impossible to try them all, even though we had breakfast there for 5 days. We also dined at the same restuarant for dinner (ala carte) but found that the menu for room service more interesting. The ala carte menu was rather limited. However, the international buffet dinner looked interesting, unfortunately, we did not have a chance to try it. I had massage once and found the standard very good. The masseur was quite talkative initially but she was professional enough to leave me alone once she got the massage underway. The only reason why I am not rating this hotel excellent was with the flushing system in the toilet. Even though the engineers came to rectify, somehow the problem persisted. My other relatives staying in the other rooms have the same issue too so I guess it is not an isolated issue in one room. In fact, this is one of the reason why I am choosing another hotel for my next visit in April, which is such a waste as the location and everything else was so good. But I may return to try the buffet dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A2B2C2Z
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a lovely hotel and has a great location next to Harbour City in TST. As you would expect from a 5* hotel in Hong Kong the hotel has great facilities and excellent service. Unfortunately whilst we were there the pool was closed for refurbishment. However the hotel informed us of this long before our stay so it was no surprise. We did have to change rooms initially as our first grand langham room had a stale smell of smoke. Unfortunatley this was not the hotel's fault (as it is a non smoking hotel) but the fault of the previous guests who had ignored the ban. Breakfast is very good (but busy) and the main street deli (american cuisine) is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No View But good Kowloon Location”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: The Langham HK smells good, looks good and is good! make sure you go for their Grand Rooms which is their latest room incarnation as these are certainly the best; some of their rooms have not been renovated for quite a few years and the decoration is very different. This hotel has had a few name changes over the years but the owner is the same and the management the same (of course different people over the years).
