Club access is by paying a fixed amount regardless of the room type you are in and to me this is money well spent if you enjoy breakfast and also a few drinks in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel amid the shopping haven”
Reviews.Author: Astello39
Reviews.Content: The Langham was fabulous. It's situated amid the shopping haven literally - its connected to the numerous malls in Tsim Sha Tsui and a stone's throw from One Peking and Heritage 1881 building, oh the Star Ferry too. Although the train station is about 5-7mins walk, it is still very convenient. There are many eateries in that area from fine dining to the local food joints - food galore. Oh on the sidetrack I must mention this - the Steakhouse at Intercontinental is outta this world! The service, food and ambience is impeccable..stunning restaurant. Anyway, the room - big, well kept & furnished and very comfortable. Large bathroom with pretty pink toiletries. Staff were friendly and holds good service standards. Overall, faultless. :) I'm in love with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Osloboy
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hong Kong has had many names up through, but as the Langham it has found back to the elegance of its opening days. The lobby and public areas are quiet and elegant, The restaurants offer great food and service the rooms are comfortable and large. The staff really goes out of their way to make sure you are having a great stay. The pool and gym on the top floor is good. This time the pool was closed for maintennance, but have tried this area before and it is nice. The rooms are large with a good working area and a large very comfortable bed. The bathroom is large and the shower is separate from the bath tub. Location, close to all transportation, MTR, KCR, busses and Star ferry. Shopping, dining and bars are all in the area. Still once you are in the hotel it is a quiet oasis. This is not a cheap hotel, but if you can handle this on your budget, I would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: chinabased
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham for a long weekend with my husband over Thanksgiving. Our priorities were comfort, location, and ease of access to transportation. We got all three. The Langham is easily accessible from the HK airport via the airport train to Kowloon, and then easily switching to a shuttle bus that will drop you off directly in front of the hotel. Total travel time: 30-35 minutes. Check in was efficient and welcoming, and we were pleased with the size of our room and the amenities in the room. The Langham is a hotel with a bit of history, so while comfortable, part of the hotel and the room (especially the bathroom) felt dated for my taste. Also, the room we got had no view, just of other high-rises across an alley. We ate in the hotel restaurants a couple times, both the NY Deli, and the Boston restaurant, and were pleased with the food. As a native New Yorker, I must say that the food was not quite authentic, but also not too far off. The Star Ferry to HK island is a short 10 minute walk away, as is the promenade on the bay, a great vantage place from which to view the skyline of HK island at night. If you are into shopping, this hotel is in the middle of all of the high end boutiques from Tiffany's, Chanel, etc. Also a short walk to the entertaining Nathan Rd. and hawkers around Chungking Mansions. As we spent most of our time on HK island, in the future, I would probably stay at a hotel on the island with a more modern feel than the Langham.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel at Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Lily L
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby so romatic. Exceptionl servcie from all staff. Location ...location ... location...near to everywhere. Room size medium. Enough for us ( 2 adult 1 children ). The best thing, my son enjoys free extra bed. Breakfast buffet yummy. Concierge staff really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and low bandwidth speed”
Reviews.Author: dannyrogue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham Hotel for a couple nights in October, and while everything was alright, nothing was amazing. The hotel has a pretty good location, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, and the beds are quite comfortable, but the rooms are pretty small compared to many other Hong Kong hotels. A couple frustrating points at this hotel are that 1) the swimming pool closes at 7pm, far earlier than most hotels and 2) the internet bandwidth speed is outrageously slow. The hotel does provide all guests with free internet, but the speed is so slow that you might as well just pay for higher bandwidth. Also, at checkout the front desk staff was not only really slow, but accidentally charged me twice for my phone bill. Honestly, I would only recommend staying here if you want to be right in Tsim Sha Tsui. Otherwise, I would recommend staying somewhere on Hong Kong Island for roughly the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Drinkeee”
Reviews.Author: linaimac
Reviews.Content: What a hotel, did not stay overnight here but did enjoy there hospitality and had a drink. You should too.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bob d
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Langham was exceptional.The staff were pleasant, helpful and nothing was too much trouble.The location is perfect being close to the ferry terminal,MTR and Harbour City shopping mall. A visit to Aqua restaurant in Hullett house across is a must with views over Victoria harbour and Hong Kong isand.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham is fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Lola N
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Langham Hotel in Hong Kong made us feel very special from the time we checked in until we left. It is in a great location and the advice and suggestions provided by the concierge staff was great -nothing was too much trouble from shopping malls and how to get there to tourist sites. We have stayed at other hotels in the area but we will now only stay at the Langham in Hong Kong - this was our second vist and exceeded expectations. Our room was ready when we arrived and the staff accompanied us to our room. There was the beautiful crisp linen and heavenly pillows as well as fresh fuit daily, Definitely the best service we have ever experienced - a slice of paradise where you can escape the hustle and bustle of this beautiful city and slip into an elegant era - regenerate and then take off again. We felt very safe and look forward to our next stay. The staff and management are to be congratulated on providing such exemplary service - even when it was super busy with Chinese New Year celebrations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Pudding010209
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in (9.00am) with room ready, to the time we left with all the concierge staff 'sending us off', we couldn't fault this hotel. Location was perfect, Star Ferry, Harbour City, MTR all very close. This hotel has it all but what made this stay memorable was the staff. Nothing was too much trouble, even when reception was busy and we were waiting for what seemed 30 seconds, staff from concierge ushered us away to another location to change money or whatever we wanted. Even the hotel security staff were only to happy to advise on travel plans, shopping malls, taxi fares and local restaurants etc. The concierge staff antipated our daily movements and always greeted my wife and I with our names. We have already booked in again for 7 nights, Sep 12. This hotel is great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Langham Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CraigH3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel early Jan 2012 primarily for the Kowloon location and after a great experience at Melbourne Langham last year - we were not disappointed! Very little to fault from great service from reception and concierge to turn down service and bathroom toiletries. This is a older hotel but no real issues with condition of facilities or property. We arrived by foot from Macau Ferry terminal (2 blocks away) and entrance is really only designed for vehicle arrival so did struggle with our bags up 6/7 stairs before one of the staff noticed us. The other issue that I was not 100% across was whether rooms had any views, they didn't seem to? Not really an issue for us but would have been nice! The room was great and we received an upgrade upon arrival. Bedding and pillows werevvery comfortable. All in all a very nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winston R
Reviews.Content: Grand experience at the Langham. 5 star hotel for half the price of the usual suspects in HK. The hotel has remarkable service. The rooms are excellent and I loved the in room safe box. It is very large, so you can out your entire portfolio away. Location is perfect in Kowloon next to the new Harbour City, close to grand shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Possum200
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Peking Road, convenient to the Ocean Terminal. Excellent, relaxing stay - courteous welcome, early check in readly available, very pleasant room. Luggage stored next day for seamless shuttle bus transfer to airport. All arrangements were made with a minimum of fuss - simply a superb stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: AN28
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel however the rooms seem a little small. The staff were friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bigstar77
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, amazing rooms and great service, really cool lobby and lovely ambience!

Reviews.Title: “Service is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: lactancia
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. Every employee we met had a smile, asked if they could help and even walked with you to make sure you were satisfied. Special mention goes to Marco who works in the business centre and sometimes at the front desk. He was professional, helpful and when our room wasn't ready immediately, he arrived for us to have a drink in the bar. Also, the concierge staff were excellent, they even arranged for a late checkout. We stayed two nights and could not be more pleased with the quality of the rooms, the food in the two restaurants we tried, and the overall ambience of this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICALLY FABULOUSLY ENJOYABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: eatshopbemerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Langham for 4 nights in mid-dec. I had initially wanted to book Langham Place, but there were no available rooms for the days we wanted. Decided to book The Langham instead. What a wise choice it turned out to be! This was supposed to be a shopping trip, so The Langham's proximity ( i meant really close proximity ) to Harbour City Shopping Centre was a huge plus for us. Harbour City is just 1 street away! my HK friend warned me that this is an old hotel but seriously folks, I couldn't tell its age, for it was well-maintained from the lobby to the rooms. The small lobby's deco was tastefully done in the Old European Style without being overtly pompous. I had booked 2 Grand Rooms but upon check-in, we were upgraded to their Grand Langham Rooms! The cosy and spacious rooms simply blew us away. Each day when we returned to the hotel, there will be 2 pink boxes of complimentary dark chocs + an update of tomorrow's weather, all placed on our bed. SWEET. At 5.30pm, a chambermaid will come by and ask us if we needed anything. Each day, a bucket of ice would be placed on the table w/o us asking. Thank you The Langham for the memorable stay. The staff ( from doorman, chambermaids, the manager/wait staff at The Eclipse ) of The Langham makes this hotel standout from the rest. I will stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Melb_77
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Langham recently. Excellent hotel to stay at. Perfect location - close to MTR and Ocean Terminal shopping centre is located right next door. Stayed in a deluxe room with king bed (very comfortable!) - and had a rollaway bed included for stepson. Still enough room to get a around, but a little tight with the rollaway. Only criticism of the room is that the shower is very small. Which is incredibly surprising given the overall bathroom is very large! With two access doors to the bathroom my suggestion would be (if they ever refurbish it) to close off one bathroom door and use that additional space to expand the size of the shower cubicle. Breakfast buffet is absolutely fantastic. Eastern and western options. Great selection/range and all packed with flavour. Wonderful way to start each morning. Staff very helpful and polite. No issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular entrance with stunning flower arrangement”
Reviews.Author: Jasminette
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room with club benefits. When we arrived at 7am we expected to have to wait till around 2pm or a bit earlier before checking into our room. Instead they apologised for our room not being ready yet, took us up to the club lounge and insisted we have breakfast while they finished preparing our room. This obviously was a fantastic start to our holiday, especially after a long tiring flight. Our room was ready within minutes but we had a leisurely breakfast and then were taken to our room where our luggage was waiting. The room and ensuite were absolutely gorgeous, we had a spa bath and lovely shower and could open louvre windows into the bedroom. The beautiful pink stationary is just exquisite. The bed was so inviting and comfortable, just like sleeping on a cloud. Our windows just looked out over a street, but that didn't matter, we didn't have time to notice, and we had got an extremely good price for this gorgeous hotel. The club lounge offer drinks and a large variety of very tasty snacks every evening, which we enjoyed. One of the hotel restaurants has a buffet dinner each night. The variety of food is absolutely astounding, and the huge variety of seafood is all freshly prepared just before you select it. The staff throughout the hotel are very professional, friendly and very lovely. The space in the entrance/reception area is huge, the decor is very luxurious and the huge flower display on the table was just breathtaking, it all feels very opulent. The hotel is in the perfect location, minutes from the Star Ferry Terminal, and minutes in the other direction from the train station. The train station is an experience in itself. Its very easy to get around, not the usual crowding etc and extremely fast. The train arrives behind a clear screen, and the doors don't open till the train has actually stopped and the train doors open. So no chance of accidently being pushed or falling on to the rail tracks etc . We took the ferry over to HongKong Island most days, and did different trips. The queues for some attractions are extremely LONG, expect to be in a queue for an hour maybe longer. We also took a couple of bus trips on the local buses, to the other side of the island. This was a really fantastic and cheap way to have a look around. Especially upstairs at the front, on the double decker buses. We also took local ferrys to different islands to have a look around. Local brochures show the ferrys and buses to take to the different attractions, which cost barely a fraction of the tour price, and you can enjoy the things you like, and leave when you want. We found this a fantastic way to have a good look around. We had a week in Hongkong, and really loved it. We'll definitely stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bumpy but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: YYoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the holiday break and the hotel was full.I don't think that is an excuse for the inconsistent staff but it makes it more understandable. The rooms are lovely, comfortable and of a high standard.The desk staff are clumsy & slow but very nice.Overall I wouldn't bother again but none of the problems spoilt my holiday but I did feel it wasn't value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Domenic C
Reviews.Content: We staid in Langham for Christmas and new Year this year and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel personal really did everything possible for the stay to be perfect. The room was ready upon arrival we did not need to wait for it, but in case you do, you can be provided with a invitation for a free drink at the bar, which is nice, I think. I was very impressed with the concierge convince. The guys called a restaurant for us for two days (!) to book a table, which they eventually did, they booked us a trip on a duckling boat and also provided loads of helpful advice, on restaurants and shopping. The room was good, albeit a bit small and the bathroom was rather old. But I really like the design in pastel colors and the room had everything you could expect from a 5 star hotel. But the greatest thing about it is that we managed to get a partial view of the fireworks on the new years eve which was unexpected and very pleasant!!! The hotel is also very nicely located, just 5 minutes from star ferry and very close to Nathan road and TST MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality”
Reviews.Author: Treve B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Langham Hotel in Hong Kong 3 times and will again in March 2012. Their club rooms are fantastic as are their suites. The service from the time you step in the door to being whisked up to the club floor to register is wonderful. All the staff are very very helpful, polite, friendly and able to answer most questions. The club lounge is great and there is no need to go out for dinner at night as their canapes are quite sufficient. I prefer to stay there rather than try different hotels now as I have been to HK 14 times and this is the best hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice beautiful hotel - but rooms could do with more love”
Reviews.Author: rarchy
Reviews.Content: When you enter the hotel, you get the impression it is very luxurious and you are somewhere special. There is a lovely smell wafting through the air and lots of attention to detail everywhere. Staff are friendly and helpful. However, I do not rate the bedrooms very highly for a 5 star. I have stayed here twice, the first time (Oct 2010) was in the old rooms - they felt like a 4 star at best, so in 2011 I stayed in the new re-furbished rooms (the most basic ones). Although a lot nicer than the old ones, they still weren't as luxurious as some other 5 stars competitors, such as the Shangri-La (but maybe I am being harsh comparing it to them) On the plus side: - The bed is very big - Bathroom has a bathtub - although there is a window (with an optional blind!), so you can lie in the bath watching the tv, BUT they should have put the taps on the other side as you can't really lie back because of the taps! - On arrival I had a large pink chocolate shoe, filled with more chocolates! A very nice touch. Although this might have been because I was managing an event there and sometimes hotels leave little extras to say thanks for the business. - There is a really large selection of food for room service, and it comes pretty quick, food was tasty too - Nice big tv, with decent enough channels - Love the pens! (I took loads) However: - The overall decor wasn't luxurious like the rest of the hotel and other 5 stars - For a 5 star, I always hope for top quality toileteries like L'Occitane (which they give in Shangri-La and Four Seasons), Molton Brown etc, but it was some generic brand which wasn't the best quality. - I thought the bed was quite hard but that is probably because I like soft mattresses Overall I do think the Langham has great attention to detail but sometimes misses the big picture. I am lucky enough to have stayed in a lot of the top brands for work, and I think they dont quite reach the same level, however it is still a beautiful hotel, with great service and in a good location so I would most definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a classic hotel w a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Christina G
Reviews.Content: Try this hotel which has a very good location. Its architecture is old but grand. However the rooms are not as hip as the other hotels. You have to add more money to get a more modern room. The classic room is good enough as long as you ask for a non smoking floor. You are near the harbor city shopping center and the ferry terminal to hongkong. The rooms are clean and try the silver city food court for great goose or duck for lunch at very reasonal price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: madamSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Langham and it was faultless. The rooms are still beautiful, the service exceptional and the location great - close to the MTR, the ferry, Nathan Road, Harbour City, Pizza Hut, Starbucks and MacDonalds. Breakfast was fantastic too. On our very last day, my sister sprained her foot whilst we were in Central. The hotel went out of their way to help us. They made us very comfortable that afternoon whilst we waited for our transfer back to the airport for a midnight departure flight. They arranged for their representative at the airport to organise a wheelchair and for us to be assisted right through to the plane. To Henry (the deputy manager) and his team at Concierge (Marco), a big thank you for all your help. It is really appreciated. I have stayed at other hotels in Hong Kong, and I must say that this is still my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KandS2009
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Langham. The location was perfect for us. We were near an MTR but walking distance to most of the areas we wanted to visit. When we arrived our room was upgraded to the grand room which had a great view of Canton Street. The staff was always helpful and friendly. They answered many of questions about getting around. I would stay here again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Wynn17
Reviews.Content: The Langham place located within a five minutes walking distance for the Harbour center, one of the biggest shopping centres in Hong Kong. The avenue of stars is also within a short distance from the hotel. Thus the location is very convenient for people who want to shop at the Harbor centre and also to stroll around at the Avenue of star at night. About the service, The hotel staffs here were very attentive and filled me with positive attitudes. The room was very clean compared with others hotels in Hong Kong with the same price range. I will definitely come back to the Langham again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ssdive
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong in October for 6 days of touring. We picked the Langham Hong Kong on-line for it's great location and were pleasantly surprised at how lovely the hotel was inside. It was an easy walk to the metro and the harbor (and ferries). English signage is everywhere so it was easy to navigate all around town. We had a club suite which was lovely and the use of the club facilities was especially nice--for breakfast, tea, and cocktails. We loved the big lobby seating area with a full bar and light meal menu. We didn't use the spa or pool but I assume they were all first rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Have to stay at The Langham”
Reviews.Author: CosmoKitty24
Reviews.Content: This was my second and third stay at The Langham Hong Kong, and with each stay I love it even more. Checked in for a two night stay and was upgraded to a Grand Langham room, which was lovely, as it is a bit bigger than the standard room, and has a bathroom with a nice soaker tub. I checked out after two nights to head into China for a few days, but then came back to The Langham for 6 more nights. Again room was great, service was outstanding. If you order room service they tell you it will be there in 25 minutes and its usually less than that, if you choose to go to one of the 5 restaurants in the hotel, they are all consistently excellent. I love that this hotel is not huge like some of the hotels in HK or any big city, I feel the service is much better, and you never feel lost in this hotel. I also love the location of this hotel, MTR entrance just across the street from the lobby, and just close enough, walking distance, to everything you want to do and see in TST. I had some free time on the weekend and after a very long and hot day of sightseeing, I booked an hour long Chinese Accupressure Massage in the Spa, I highly recommend taking advantage of the spa as the prices are very reasonable, and there services are again excellent. Great massage! I will be heading back to Hong Kong in 2012 and will most certainly be booking stay number 4 at The Langham Hong Kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tots238
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December 2011 for a birthday and it was really good. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel and the greeters were really nice. We booked 2 rooms and one of them was a twin bed. The receptionist said they didn't have a spare twin bed room until the day after. So the day after we tried again but they said the only room they had was 4 floors below and we needed rooms close together. We finally got a room together and then it was great. The pool and the breakfast was really nice and when it was a birthday they gave us complementary cake without us asking and that was a nice touch.A great end to a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for business and tourists”
Reviews.Author: AlbeeTheOne
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel is close to the Pier. Though, it is a bit pricey as compared to the other HK hotel options, it is definitely value for money. The hotel is well located in Kowloon, and offers a shuttle to the Kowloon airport express. The hotel offers a comfy bed, a huge flat screen tv, mini fridge, and a comparatively large bathroom. Bathrobes and slip-ons were provided for in the room. The wifi at the hotel was decent. The breakfast buffet generally gets crowded during peak time, so you may wanna reach there before 8 AM. The hotel is attached to a big shopping mall, with many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Langham HK is associated with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Oracle68
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Hong Kong in December for 5 days. We chose the Langham because I am a 1865 member. There we re a couple of initial problems (eg we had booked an extra bed in one of the rooms which wasn't there when we arrived at 1am - However by the time I called reception to check, the night Manager had already verified our booking info, contacted room service and the bed was outside the room being made). What a service!!! Cannot fault the Hotel. As a 1865 member, we were put on high floor, had our chocolates and newspapers delivered daily and free internet in the room. Only one comment to beware: the hotel often various WIFI in room packages. There is a free one, but the others are charged. I wasn't aware of this, but my fault - should have checked with reception first rather than using the expensive HKD360 wifi package. Absolutely no issues, the hotel staff were plenty and friendly, concierge was excellent, the hotel location is just 3 mins away from the Pier, plenty of good shops around and the MRT just 2 mins away. What more do you want? Will definitely choose the Langham again in HK. And I recommend you all to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “SMASHING HOTEL. GREAT SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: PipYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November 2011 in a Grand Room with access to the Club Lounge. This is a gorgeous hotel in a sumptuous oriental style. Our room was very spacious with a beautiful bathroom with spa bath and seperate shower. It was beautifully decorated in the oriental style but not over done and the bed and pillows were superb. It lacked for nothing - every little thing was anticipated and provided for and it was the best hotel we have stayed in for a long time. True, there is no outside space, except, of course, for the rooftop pool, so no where to sit out with a coffee or a beer but the service and comfort more than made up for that. It is situated right in the middle of downtown Kowloon, just a short stroll from the Star Ferry terminal and the many shopping opportunities that Hong Kong offers. The Club Lounge was great and provided a stylish breakfast, afternoon tea and early evening cocktails etc. The staff were very attentive but they didn't overdo it. A very pleasing experience. The fitness club was very sleek and modern and the outdoor rooftop pool was warm and inviting. Once again, the staff were eager and happy to help in any way. We would definitely stay here again and can recommend it to anyone who appreciates staff who genuinely believe in good service and accommodation with that little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service as expected but definitely delivered”
Reviews.Author: MDFern
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the experience was enjoyable and first class, we were on a stopover on route to New Zealand and needed to get over the flight with minimal fuss. We had a Grand Langham room with club floor facilities and at HK pricing definitely an option to take. Nothing was too much trouble and very tentative service made it most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at The Langham”
Reviews.Author: Norman C
Reviews.Content: As you would expect at a hotel in this price range the room standard and hotel facilities generally are excellent. The service from all the staff in all parts of the hotel at all times is utterly wonderful, they can not do enough for you. But, extras are grossly expensive, two sandwiches (magnificent) and two small drinks in the bar cost 680 HKD (about 62 pounds or 100 USD). Great luxury place to stay but unless you are a millionaire - eat and drink out. Lots of good and reasonably priced restaurants & bars within a few minutes walk. The guest information book provided in the room is poor, basically only covers room service. Anything else you want to know about you must contact the concierge - very very helpful but a nuisance to have to do it. For example the Wi-Fi Internet service (free once you work it out, you must select 'first time user' each time!) is not mentioned in the guide - the concierge will provide the password when asked. The breakfast room is too small for the number of guests and gets VERY crowded (and noisy) at peak times. The wide range of European and Asian food is all very good - even the scrambled eggs (my test of a good breakfast kitchen) are perfect. Very good location, Star Ferry to the Island and the MTR are each about 5 min walk - in opposite directions). 30 min in taxi from the airport (price about 250 HKD) or 45 min in the Airport-Hotel shuttle bus (cost 140 HKD each). Very busy shopping area with lots of expensive fashion type shops in the area. Go north about 1 mile to Jordan for cheaper shopping and eating. If the opportunity ever arrises I would happily stay there again - please!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: hairy_haggis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham on the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in November this year. We were upgraded to a Grand Langham Room based on an offer we were given, which was always a bonus. As part of this upgrade, we were able to be part of the Club Lounge, which meant that we were whisked away at check-in to be processed up on the 11th floor. And with this, came a lovely drink while we waited! Our room was absolutely beautiful and we had a spa bathroom, which was just lovely - every amenity you could think of was in the room, which was a real surprise. As part of access to the Club Lounge, we were able to get breakfast, which was gorgeous, afternoon tea and canapes. It was lovely just to be able to pop in for a quick bite to eat and a lovely drink when we wanted it. The staff were excellent and looked after our every needs. The hotel is perfectly placed in Kowloon - it is walking distance to the MTR station and Star Ferry so you can travel about really easily. Also, it is close to the Kowloon station for the Airport Express, with a complimentary bus, so just a hop, skip and a jump to get there and away. We didn't use the other restaurants in the hotel, as there are so many other places just on your doorstep. This was a lovely stress-free visit and found it a perfect place to explore Hong Kong and Kowloon in earnest!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel, but still have something to improve”
Reviews.Author: claracs
Reviews.Content: General speaking, this hotel is good. But we were very unhappy on the day we checked in. We had a tiresome flight and were really looking forward to take a rest before our dinner appointment. We were there around 3 pm and were told that our room was not ready due to the hotel was fully booked on the previous day and the housekeeping was busy at cleaning the rooms. We went out and came back after 1 hour. The room was still not ready. It was really unbelievable that until 4pm we were still not able to get in our room. We were very very disappointed on it. Finally we had the room. Although we were very unhappy to get in the room so late, the room itself was nice and comfortable. In addition, the location of the hotel is good. It is close to the MRT and ferry wharf. And it is also very close to the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased for first stay in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: SandyTO
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor and from the hotel's rates posted on their website. We were able to take advantage of their "Linger Longer for Less" rate for a Grand Langham room that included free Internet access and breakfast. We did not pre-book their limo/taxi service from the airport to the hotel but that was not a problem. Our flight was late arriving in Hong Kong around midnight. I was not feeling well so we headed for the hotel's booth at the airport for a limo or taxi to the hotel. The two men at the booth were very friendly and assisted with getting a taxi to the hotel. They welcomed us with a wet wash cloth and cold drinks. We had to wait about 30 minutes for our ride so they assisted my husband with purchasing Octopus cards. They made a very good impression on us and the hotel. The front desk service was also excellent upon our early morning arrival. They quickly booked us into our room. I forgot to ask for a room on a higher level so our room was on the 6th floor. This meant that we could hear the traffic all night. We fixed that problem by turning on our sound machine to drown out the noise. The room was large enough for two people with two large pieces of luggage. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean throughout our stay. The bathroom was nicely decorated but we did not like the inconsistant water pressure in the shower and had to be very careful with the water going from cold to very hot. We enjoyed the spa bathrobes and slippers provided with the room. We had a view of the street in front of the hotel. Room service was great and they returned to the room during the early evening to see if we needed additional services. We found the breakfast buffet to be tasty and have a variety of foods available. My husband enjoyed having eggs fixed in any style he wished. It was often crowded at breakfast but service was fairly good. I learned to take a sweater with me to breakfast because the room was so cold with cold air blowing on all the tables. Many people complained about the cold air but it was never changed. We were late by 2-3 minutes arriving at breakfast on Saturday but they seated us. The manager came by our table as we were finishing and made a comment about our late arrival. We assumed they would have later hours on the weekend mornings but they had the same hours all week. We ate at the New York Deli restaurant on the property. The service was good but you needed to make a reservation to get a table before 9:30 pm. The manager was very nice and really tries to provide service to patrons. We ate here twice during our stay. The desserts are very good as an added plus! The location of the hotel is excellent for tourists! You are across the street from the metro station, bus stops are nearby, taxis are always out front waiting for customers, and the star ferry is about three blocks away. The only caution is that tour buses drop off passengers just down the side street by the hotel. Getting down the sidewalk at night is a challenge with the people getting on and off the tour buses with their shopping bags. There are many restaurants near the hotel but you need to make reservations or you will be in for a long wait for a table. This really came as a surprise to us. The real treasure of this hotel is the friendly, courteous staff. They answered all our questions and offered better suggestions to us. They were always ready to meet our needs and make our stay pleasant. I told the manager as we left that his hotel has one of the best hotel staffs that we have found in Southeast Asia. I highly recommend this hotel to all first time visitors to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “as you would expect from a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on my last trip back to hong kong. I am a seasoned traveller with very picky taste and a rule for staying in 5 star and the best hotels only. This hotel lives up to its reputation. its level of service is excellent. The food, restaurants are amazing especially at Tang Court. Location is excellent and near the tourist hubs and shops and good food. We had the Grand Langham room and that was a very good sized room with an exceptionally large bed which comfortably fitted my wife and daughter and myself with room to spare for another adult. The bathroom is beautiful and very classic and elegant. Over all i found my stay at the Langham excellent. Not quite up to par with the Peninsula around the corner... but an excellent choice for the picky who demand the best but doesnt want to pay through through the nose!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional introduction to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: I visited here on a business trip for 6 nights, and I am now in awe of this hotel. The lobby is magnificient, I found myself just sitting in the lobby occasionally in the evenings with a book. The staff are incredibly friendly which was a bonus. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable, and the bathroom had a beautiful old style finish. The restaurants had plenty of choice as well, and all food was very fresh. I loved the chocolate fountain at the dessert area! I ordered room service one of the evenings, and it was very prompt to arrive to the room. Location wise, it is exceptionally placed! It is very close to the Ferry, and taxi's (which are cheap), are easily accessible and can bring you to the night markets a bit further away. I am very pleased with this hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Update, one year later...much improved!”
Reviews.Author: oreostuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel management has obviously taken great pains to justify their $300 a night price tag. The overall experience of this hotel has improved from its pick-up limo service, front desk,  in-room dining and concierge services. Everyone seems to finally be on board that the customer is always first (and right) and the one or two missteps that we encountered were forgivable and minor. I have never left a hotel feeling as though I wanted to tip everyone! We did what we could in that vain, and if we were paying for the stay ourselves, we would have felt that the service matched the price tags. The restaurants in the Langham have all improved with cleanliness and consistent service EXCEPT, getting breakfast Saturday morning at the L'Eclipse (buffet breakfast). I wish they would require reservations as the 25 minute wait caused us to walk over to the Holiday Inn for their breakfast (set menu or buffet available). The Langham Hotel is ideally located for the tourist or business traveler (MTR, Ferry within walking distance) and cabs are plentiful at the hotel or on Canton Road, around the corner. Harbor City and Gateway are across the street and to find local fare and knock offs,  just walk two blocks to Nathan Road! At this point, I can't imagine staying anywhere else when visiting Hong Kong! Except maybe out at Stanley or Repulse Bay...with the ex pats and HK wealth...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Crazynavywife
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff is wonderful, the property beautiful and the rooms are clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old school glamour”
Reviews.Author: picturesque08
Reviews.Content: We actually selected this hotel because I was using up my frequent flyer points, so the choice of hotels I had was actually limited. It was for a quick getaway for me & my husband after a big family gathering in another country nearby. I chose this hotel from the listing mainly because of the location. The pictures of the hotel looked too "old", too grand and gaudy for our usual liking so we had quite low expectation of how we'd like it. However we were pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. The Lobby, while it has large chandeliers and opulent decor, it wasn't overly large so it feels intimate and welcoming. The service at Reception was very friendly and again very welcoming. The room had a lovely feel and warmth. Again while the decor is not what we normally go for (we tend to go for something more modern), we actually really like it as it was still tastefully done. The bathroom was probably the only slight let down, because of the lighting and lack of space to put your toiletries. But the size of the bathroom was large. The location was fantastic, close to shops and the MRT stations. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Langham. It was a really homely comfortable old school glamour. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shanewarren88
Reviews.Content: I enjoy it every time I travel to Hong Kong and get to stay at The Langham - the staff are friendly and helpful the rooms are just right and the location is fantastic! I have also hosted a number of meetings and training events in their conference centre and have found them an absolute joy to work with... already looking forward to more work there in 2012! This is a great place to stay if you like me will take the entire family when you can on business travel - my partner and children enjoy the pool, food and shopping while I have a worry free day working from the business centre or conference rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Justin4974
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this hotel, pure luxury. We stayed in the Club suite which awas a great room, good sixe and no issues to report. The club lounge is an essential, this gives you breakfast and dinner and cocktails from 7-11pm in a great surrounding. We met some interesting people here from all over the world. We will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge staff I have dealt with”
Reviews.Author: Rhett88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both very impressed with the Langham Hotel in Hong Kong. The service was fantastic, and the concierge staff went above and beyond in helping us with little things like recommendations, to big issues like helping us navigate the China border crossing translating over the phone through a very confusing situation. It's a long story, but the bottom line is they spent a lot of time helping us and we felt genuinely cared for... Service was great throughout all other aspects of the hotel as well, and it is the service which really sets this hotel apart. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Bathrooms were updated and quite nice. Our room did not have the best view, but the location of the hotel is very convenient. There is premium shopping right outside the door, a metro station across the street, and a very short walk to the star ferry which will take you directly to the convention center or central HK. The main restaurant has a great breakfast and lunch buffet with foods from all over the world. (Don't miss the fresh baked croissants). New York Deli downstairs could use some work and should be skipped. Overall we were very, very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham Hong Kong - Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Cal_TheHotelLover
Reviews.Content: Stay here for my recent birthday trip in Hong Kong. We choose The Langham Hong Kong for it's conveniency and location, but never expecting flawless service with amazing room. We were direct to take the bus (HKD130 per person) from Hong Kong International Airport to the hotel. The bus ride was okay, comfy seats. I guess my only complain for my entire stay is the driver who droves us (probably not hired by The Langham). When we arrive to hotel, he (the driver) did not direct us to hotel where as he was actually on the phone with somebody else using a bluetooth headset. Also he shouted at us saying that the hotel is at the other side, which is kinda rude as i understand their language (cantonese). But then, from what i experienced in Hong Kong, most of the Hong Kong born are rude in conversation. (I'm sorry) We were welcome with a small but grand lobby at The Langham. Check in was okay. Compliments to (Bo Bo) for her good english and able to check us in at 12pm. As we step into our room, i was glad this is one of those hotel which welcome you with no foul smell of an old room. What you see in the photos from website are exactly the same as what you will book for, probably better :) We book "Grand Langham Room" for 3 nights stay there. From luxurious leather finish furniture, to spacious marble bathroom complete with SPA like amenities, to great full in-room amenities, "Grand Langham Room" no doubt is what i didn't expect to stay in. I've stay in many luxury 5 star hotels and this is one of the best room i've ever encounter. As told by many friends, Hong Kong hotels room are usually small in size, this one consider it's the highest categories in terms of rooms (Grand Langham Room) it's consider small, but comfy. Love the bed, love the feeling being inside the room all the time. Also to mentioned they do have free wi-fi which is great. Kudos to housekeeping who keep our room tidy and clean always whenever we were out. Not to mentioned their great turndown service which is really the best turndown service i've experienced (attached photo). Also to compliment is their tasty birthday cake complimentary by hotel. If i'm not filled with my birthday dinner at "The Bostonian Steakhouse & Seafood" (which is also in the hotel) i think i would finish the whole cake myself. Yummy :) I am yet to try their room service from the hotel but we have tried the chinese restaurant at level 1 (T'ang Court) for their famous dim sum. A must try dim sum when you stay in this hotel or if you're in Hong Kong. The Bostonian was okay... great service, but "so so" food. Conclusion, we really enjoy our stay over here in The Langham Hong Kong. Service were impeccable, rooms were amazing, and experience are unforgettable. We were check into The Venetian (Macau) after we check out and honestly, The Langham Hong Kong were far more better than The Venetian (as many has mentioned about the great Venetian Macau). I will definitely coming back here to The Langham Hong Kong, thank you The Langham. xxx Mr.Sin stay for 10th Nov - 13th Nov

Reviews.Title: “Quality Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rajendra k
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, hotel staff are very good. Hotel location is good but they don't have see view rooms. Only few have. Breakfast have a great choice and variety. food have a great taste. Rooms are very good.

Reviews.Title: “10 days with Langham”
Reviews.Author: Pete325
Reviews.Content: Good value for money on some of their special promotional packages. Overall, I am mostly impressed with the quality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Third time in HK”
Reviews.Author: Dermot C
Reviews.Content: Our arrival into HK was a disaster. My wife and I were seperated at the airport after losing part of our luggage. I arrived at the hotel and within minutes the Langam staff had located my wife at the airport and had her safely transported to the hotel. Their help and concern was first class. Their care and service was terrific the whole stay. The restaurant manager even suggested the things we could do in the terrible weather to make our stay more enjoyable. These are small things but they set the hotel apart from others I have stayed at in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TonyB_au
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice in the last couple of weeks for 1-night stopovers in HK. First time I got a handcapped room which was pretty run down and needs some refurbshment. The tap in the shower was held together with tape! Next time I went I got upgraded because my room wasn't ready and it was much better. Newish room with nice bed and everything was in working order. Internet from the room was wireless, good speed and Free! The location is excellent - within walking distance to the subway, Shopping area and the Star Ferry. Great place for access to night life, shopping and restaurants. Be aware that there are 2 Langham Hotels in HK. This one is on Peking Road, Kowloon. I'm not sure where the other place is. The staff were excellent - friendly and helpful. Best part of my stay was after my checkout. I had a late night flight so I went sightseeing. When I came back for my bag the guy told me that I could use the change room and shower in the gym. This was a great bonus so Thank You to the hotel for this. I'd stay here again next time I'm in HK.

Reviews.Title: “classic”
Reviews.Author: Gogogaijingirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in Oct/November. Great location - really easy to travel around Hong Kong as the underground and Star Ferry are really close by, as is the ferry to get to Macau. it's right next to a number of malls so no shortgae of shops/food outlets nearby. Hotel was lovely - had quite an old style charm about it that felt classic rather than outdated. Our room was spacious with a large bathroom. Service was excellent - staff very helpful (our TV stopped working at about 11-30pm one night and someone came and fixed it within a few minutes) and housekeeping kept the room immaculate. There was plenty of complimentary bottled water and fresh fruit. The roof top pool was an added bonus and again staff in the fitness centre were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Avios
Reviews.Content: This really is an oasis of calm just a step off the Peking Road and all the staff are there to make you feel welcome. I can only rate the food by the breakfast that is first class and enough to keep you going for the rest of the day. The rooms are comfortable and possibly the cleanest I have stayed in. Well done to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Honk Kong Interlude”
Reviews.Author: dreamcatcherholiday
Reviews.Content: We often travel from Cairns to Frankfurt using the only direct flight out with Cathay Pacific. It saves us having to go south 3 or 4 hours changing flights and then heading back north the same amount of hours. It does mean that on our return flight we have an 18 hour stop over in Hong Kong. Certain occassions we stay a few days longer after being in europe to help adjust time zones and aviod the jet lag when we get home. On this occasion we chose to stay at the Langham Hotel. We found the staff very friendly and willing to assist. The hotels decor is really stunning and the location is great. Being close by all the tourist destinations and shopping made it easy to spend a few quick days enjoying the destination.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JonasCh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been my favourite hotel since 15 years back, it is a luxurious hotel and the staff is really great. We stayed in the club floor suite and it is always a treat. The club has been renovated and is now the best thing with the hotel (at least for me) , it´s a solitude place with food, drinks and just an atmosphere... The hotel is close to Nathan Road, Star Ferry and Ocean Terminal, so if wanting to live on the Kowloon side in center this is a great hotel, for me this is the only downside since I love the Hong Kong side and spend most of my time there...

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad spot”
Reviews.Author: culverwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham on two occasions in October when travelling to and from Australia and stopping-over. On the first we arrived very early in the day and they found us a room without any quibble and did not charge any extra. The staff are very helpful. We stayed in a Grand room which was very nice and well provisioned in a business hotel way but had no view at all. The location is very central and good for sightseeing and business. If you are using the Airport Express K2 bus the hotel is annoyingly their last stop having passed it at least once on the way to the other hotel stops, on the other hand this works in your favour when returning to the station. The buffet we had on Sunday was very good quality and very good value with plenty of locals using it which is always a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: yorkie1961
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong & China 3-4 times a year and always make an effort to stay at the Langham as it is my favourite hotel. The rooms are beautifully designed and furnished and the bathrooms are exceptional. Overall though its the quality of the service and the ambience of the hotel that makes it a special place. The Head Concierge Edward is very welcoming and knowledgeable and service is slick and friendly. There is a very good loyalty scheme which is worth joining. If I had a minor criticism it would be that it could do with a pub or brasseries type bar where you could have a more informal drink but apart from that its great. The location is also excellent being right in the centre of the shopping action. You may pay a little more to stay here but it's well worth the extra

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone at the Langham we had a great time, unbelievable location, faultless service. The Langham Club was excellent, food, service & ambience. Thanks Rita. We were at the hotel for 5 days & would go back again. Recommend it for family & business.

Reviews.Title: “A good property with very good location”
Reviews.Author: Rhea S
Reviews.Content: so this was our second visit to the city..n " The langham" hotel it was n my husband treated me to " the Suite"..we checked in early morning and did not have to wait much..the staff was helpful..n gave us a room with a good view overlooking the skyscrappers of hongkong...this was the best available out of all the " suites"..so wow were our words as soon as we entered in our room..one big drawing with a big LCD, a kitchen which was loaded with stuff like the digital cooking range, microwave, utensils, fruits, coffee maker, Referigerator( which had Ben & Jerry ice-creams with a caption that said." You've found me, Now i'm Yours), a make belief bar et al..the bed room was also big enough with a small washroom with bath tub..the rooms were spick clean n so was the furniture..the whole decor was brilliant...Moving over to service..we didn't njoy the food as we were strict vegetarians..so once or twice got food from outside n cooked in the kitchen. Okay..now the best part of the hotel was its " bang on" location..yeah connected to this property was a big sopping mall which had a cinema hall as well..I remember watching the movie." the green hornet" over there..For us ( the vegetarians) the shopping mall had eateries like :-Starbucks, Mos Burger which offered the Corquett Burger( made of potatoes n rice), some bakery( m forgetting the name)..n thr was this kitchen which offered Indian cuisine as well..Now moving out of the mall..was this place called Mongkok which was basically known for two things..Electronics n Gizmos + Sport Shoes..yeah..a plethora of gizmos, n sport shoes..all the latest collection by brands like adidas, nike, reebok, puma, converse n some other brands..This is generally the most crowded place becoz- there is this MRT station as well, n thr is this roadside market which sells cheap stuff as well..like the fake brands selling watches, shades, vallets,bags etc etc..so as anticipated lot of money exchanges r also here...yeah a worth visiting place for all SHOPOHOLICS...Now just near to this location was this pizza hut where we wud get to eat our vegetarian pizza..I would highly recommend this property..Cheers !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: mastiff-friend
Reviews.Content: It was not easy to choose a hotel in Hong Kong and after comparing quite a few my interest went to The Langham. We booked quite early and managed to get a wonderful offer a suite with the Club offer. The suite was very spacious and very clean. The bathroom was beautiful with shower and tub and the amenities were great, even had a nespresso machine.The Club offer is fantastic so if you have a chance add it to your package it includes a super breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails in the evening...don't miss it! The Hotel Staff is very helpful attends every need. Service excellent! In a word great! The Hotel Location is great a few minutes walking from everything. If I would go back to Hong Kong i would certainly go back to The Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WE2TOUR
Reviews.Content: Total 5 star luxury and service Couldn't wish for a better location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gshard
Reviews.Content: I stay at Langham 4 times per year as I am treated like a king the Staff in the Club Level lounge are extraordinary ,The newly renovated club lounge is the best in Asia Great breakfast and afternoon tea ,Great Location walking distance to great shopping and restaurants rooms are very comfortable one of my favourite hotels in the World

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: Dusty333
Reviews.Content: Due to poor experience at a resort hotel we booked in early to our Executive suite and were promptly taken up to the Executive lounge to check in. I had requested a suite with twin beds and an extra bed for our daughter on a high floor away from traffic noise and elevators. We were shown to a room on the 4th floor from which I could hear the traffic clearlyas the hotel is not double glazed. When I returned to the Executive lounge the Ladies were very courteous and informed me that Suites with twin beds only go up to the 4th floor but if I was prepared to take a suite with a king size bed they would move us to a higher floor. They actually moved us a couple of times until we had a room on the 12th floor were the traffic noise was acceptable. At all times the staff were very courteous, prompt in reacting to requests and greeted myself and my family by name which is a big plus. We found the room to be fine even with an extra bed in the lounge for our daughter and all the staff exceptional, particulary those in the Executive lounge. I was annoyed that I had to go out of the Hotel though to watch the Rugby World Cup as none of the three sports channels showed Rugby or any football.

Reviews.Title: “Superb display of customer-focus”
Reviews.Author: Stewsview
Reviews.Content: We were extraordinarily impressed by the Langham's staff at every turn - front desk, lounge, restaurant and even the turn down service offered. They seemed wired to do all they could to enhance our experience and stay. The room was beautiful; designed for comfort and optimum use of space - we loved the 'window' in the bathroom that offered privacy or opened up to reveal the room. The desk and chair provided a comfortable place to work and an array of outlets to re-charge - even a convertor plug was thought of. Full sized iron came in very handy after unpacking. Shower and tub were lovely, bed luxuriously comfortable and attractive; amenities galore. We found our room to be very quiet, in terms of hallway and outside noises. We'll be back, and look forward to staying at other Langham properties.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel is a wonderful place to stay , we have stayed here 3 times and i would happily stay here again when i visit HK . It is perfectly located at Tsim Sha Tsui , right in the heart of the shopping district . The Star Ferry is only a walk away and markets and restaurants are all on your doorstep . The service here is just wonderful , nothing is too much trouble and will accomodate your every need . The rooms are very comfortable , very clean and well appointed . If you upgrade and chose the executive club rooms you will also have use of the club room for breakfast , afternoon tea and evening horsdouvres and drinks ....fantastic value !!! I am sure that anyone that stays here will be extremely happy with this hotel and the service . PS : I would highly recommend " Huton " restaurant for a spectacular dinner overlooking the harbour ...only a walk away as well .

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful homeward bound stop over”
Reviews.Author: Guy D
Reviews.Content: On the way home from 30 days in Europe, back to Australia, we indulged in a short Hong Kong stop over, for a bit of a "shop fest". The Langham was brilliant, well appointed rooms, hi-tech, close to absolutely everything, (Ocean Terminal, The Penninsula, Heritage centre, etc) We upgraded our room, it was wonderful, the FOH staff were very friendly, and, the concierge, well, did he know his stuff!! Loved the business centre, The only trap, DON'T GO TO THE NY DELI!!! What a rip off. "Glass of water sir/madam?" "Thank You" Later on, HK$11 on the bill for water. The food, plastic American.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn-1210
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Langham hotel just before 8 a.m. and after a long overnight flight were delighted to be able to check in and have our room straight away. The room was beautiful, the toiletries and bath sheets luxurious. The staff were very professional and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. The location is very good very close to the ferry and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best, if not the best hotel at Home.”
Reviews.Author: PuiKan_Wu
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Selma - Guest relations on the registration desk on the day we arrived from our business flights. We were tired and very early 9am - with check in not usually until 2pm. We'd even managed to misplace our booking information - nothing was too much trouble for her. Selma was so helpful and friendly - found us an available room (a suite which we happily paid a little extra for), then guided us to the room/ showed us all the features and left us to rest. The room itself was just divine!! fantastic views/ luxuriously furnished/ spotlessly clean with huge fluffy white towels and quality toiletries! We simply cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was and how much we love this hotel. Every staff member is friendly and helpful and every part of the hotel is clean and comfortable to be in. We so look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahMosmanNSW
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a week at The Langham taking advantage of the Linger at Langham offer. Room was well appointed and clean, separate bath and shower always welcome. Plenty of food choices at breakfast, the Lobby offered great coffee, High Tea and fantastic piano player and singer. Service from the concierge to Front Desk to the Lobby Bar was always of a high standard. Whilst this hotel does not have views it certainly offers an elegant retreat after a busy day in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perverse internet pricing”
Reviews.Author: azs123
Reviews.Content: For a hotel of this quality it is odd to pay for internet access in the first place. But to provide different levels of access (complimentary being the slow one I'm on now) and then charging differential prices for higher bandwidth is just bizarre

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AdelEgypt
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this very special hotel, location is perfect walking distance to major attractions and shopping, superb service, fabulous and maintained rooms, club lounge nice but small, concierge: above standard with exceptional professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Hillstrom
Reviews.Content: Only my second time to stay in a five star hotel. The price would normally be outside our range I only stayed as it was paid as part of a business trip. Food was very good, the room comfortable and spotless and the service excellent. The area was interesting and full of life. Only downside the extra charge for internet access - can't understand the rationale for this as 4 and 3 star hotels provide this free of charge. However it seems to be something quite a few 5 star hotels do! Overall we had a very pleasant stay in a very nice hotel. One tip: There is a rear entrance where we were dropped by the shuttle bus. This was down a stairs from the main lobby, there was no lift and the area was not staffed. Best avoid this entrance – the main entrance is down the road to the right of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a holiday”
Reviews.Author: Maccas9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just completed a two week tour of China and had booked a four night stay at The Langham, mainly based on reviews in TA. We had decided to pay extra for use of the Langham Club. It turned out to be a great move because right from the time we checked in at the Club floor we were made to feel special. What a wonderful staff this hotel has. Nothing was too much trouble and the service is totally professional. The room was to die for and the food and drinks available most of the day were of the highest standard. The pool and gym were also more than adequate with again a very friendly staff. Location of the hotel is great with all of Hong Kong's attractions within easy reach. It was just the perfect end to our holiday and special thanks to Jady and the Club staff.

Reviews.Title: “A complicated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurence31
Reviews.Content: One cannot beat the great location of this hotel. I have stayed in this hotel 4-6 times over the past 2 years if only for the location. I am always baffled that this hotel seems to have 2 personalities. One updated and one outdated. Some floors have been redone and many floors not. Yet after some of the floors were redone they still call them the newly renovated rooms. After 3 years how can they still be referred to as newly. And what are they waiting for to redo the balance of the hotel. I also cannot understand how a hotel that has 5 stars can have an airconditioner system so loud in every room that is can awake the dead it is so loud. The 3 years since the renovation has started to take a toll on the rooms. They look worn down and mold is gathering in the shower. the tv in the rooms cannot be watched normally. The signal seems very poor, the screen has lines on the screen unless it was just the room I was in, I cannot hold this against them. The tech I called advised it was as good as it gets. The food in the Palm Court is sub par at best. After I mentioned the food I ordered was cold and over cooked the managers response was "sorry" I have to admit even I was surprised. Not even a can I replace it can I make it right can I warm it can I offer you a drink to make it right .... Nothing but a sorry. As for the gym it is not the most practial for anyone other than a runner. They have tried to go out of their way to make this a decent gym but it seems to be missing some basic work out equipment. There is no question the staff of this hotel are very accomadating and willing to go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The issues I have go beyond this. They claim to be a 5 star hotel but I fail to see the criteria this hotel meets for this. if this hotel was another block or two in a different location I would pass but for the location I seem to keep going back. Please fix these minor issues and if you claim to have 5 stars then these things would not be an issue at many other similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Fr3quentTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and the first 24 hours was extremely stressful. We arrived at about 1am and the check in was fast but we certainly weren't greeted with a smile. One of the staff members said "can i take you to the lift and show you where they are" which we thought was a lovely gesture, then the man pointed and said "go there" - pointing to the lift from behind the desk. We got to the room and it was a twin room. We went to reception to complain and they said "2 people can fit on one bed". Dont forget, they are single beds. When we booked with the agent we booked a queen room. I called reception to be changed to a queen room and they said they were all sold out and didn't offer to change us after others had checked out in the morning. They blamed our booking agent for the mistake, even though on our bookings it stated queen room. The langham really seemed to enjoy blaming the agents for many things that weren't right during our stay. They did not take responsibility for there being no appointment for high tea, and blamed the agent even though I actually booked that through the langham myself and had nothing to do with an agent. We went to the reception in the morning and they agreed to move our room to the 16th floor (The lift only goes to the 15th floor so you have to walk up stairs to get to the 16th floor). The room was much older, the toiletries were not as nice as the previous room and the blind in the bathroom was completely transparent when the bathroom light was on. I did not care to see my partner on the toilet so we went down to reception again. They were EXTREMELY difficult to deal with. The staff were very friendly to me when I complimented them, but as soon as I had a problem they were hostile. The staff all conversed in english to us, then spoke another language to converse with each other about our booking, which made me feel like i was not even there. I noticed someone from management looking angry and speaking in a harsh tone, then our room was changed AGAIN to the 5th floor. This room was exactly what we wanted in the first place. It was beautiful. The company used for transfers was excellent and friendly. The pool and gym were excellent. Turndown service was daily, but on 2 occasions only one side of the bed was turned down. We were missing newspapers 3 of the 6 days we were there. We went to the business centre to use the internet (As the in room charges are ridiculous) at 11:45pm and all computers were being used. We asked for the reception to call our room when a computer was free so we could urgently use the computer. The man hesitated and after asking twice more he agreed. He said to us "the business centre is open 24 hours a day". I do not think he understood the 3 times we told him we needed a computer urgently.

Reviews.Title: “glitz, glamour and great location”
Reviews.Author: TerriandTim
Reviews.Content: It's all pink at the The Langham Hotel. The pens and paper in the room, your room card. Aparently to appeal to the female traveller in particular. The pink part, plus the hotel's grandeur feeling, magical location (stone's throw from Ocean Terminal and it's incredible shopping, H & M, Star Ferries and excellent restaurants). The room's are always immaculately clean, paper delivered daily and the breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever come across on my travels. I love this hotel and would recommend it to anyone coming to HK for business or pleasure. Please send me a message if I can give you any more detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: FabulousMissM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times for business and had loved it here. The hotel staff is fantastic and always willing to help. The rooms are spacious and clean. It is my home away from home when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunloversSouthland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September with our 14 year old daughter. The service from the staff was excellent, they were all very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and a good size - even with the rollaway bed for our daughter. Breakfast was great, beautifully presented and a huge variety, something for everyone. I couldn't decide on this hotel and one in Nathan Road - I am so pleased I chose The Langham - the location is great and the whole place just had a nice feel about it. It is really handy to the ferry terminal to Hong Kong Island and Macau. We did use the pool which is not huge, but more than adequate and very clean. It is hard to find any fault with this hotel - so congratulations to The Langham on a great experience - their staff really are their greatest asset. Also it was my birthday when we visited and a lovely cake & card was left in our room which I thought was such a nice thing for them to do, so many thanks to the hotel! We will not look anywhere else when we go back to Hong Kong, we will definitely stay at The Langham again.

Reviews.Title: “recent trip to hongkong”
Reviews.Author: leon255353
Reviews.Content: on a recent trip we stayed at the langham hotel in hongkong it was first class.The staff were exellent, helpful with great tips on the best tailors and eating houses etc. The location is perfect close to transport etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Quality Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rajendra_Kumar28
Reviews.Content: I can say that its one of the good hotels in Hong Kong. restaurant, service and staff all are of great quality. The restaurant is really great, you can find variety of food for the breakfast and with great taste. Let me tell you the staff are really very well mannered and helping. Rooms are great and comfortable. One should give a try to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of Hong Kong's Best Big Hotels”
Reviews.Author: goochpg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Langham Hotel on the 13th of September on a layover returning from Africa to New Zealand. Though our stay was for only one night, the experience was superb. Starting with the car ride from the airport, our expectations were happily exceeded in every way. The staff greeted us at the door of the hotel and escorted us through the check-in process in a most gracious and welcoming manner. Our room was well appointed with a large, gleaming bathroom with big, fluffy towels and white terry robes. Perfect for washing off the dust from a month in Ethiopia. We found room service to be prompt and courteous, the food good and the wine reasonable in quality and variety. Every comfort was provided in a quiet, polished setting. The bed in our room was a king, with pillows to spare and a great, firm mattress. That night was one of the most restful we have spent in any hotel in a long time. Our room really was a coccoon of tranquility and comfort. We tried the New York Deli for lunch and found the food adequate, but not up to the standards set by the hotel itself. However, the kindness shown us by the staff on departure made it easy to forget the mediocre meal. We will certainly return to the Langham when we are next in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge staff extremely rude gesture”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne T
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived about 5pm, the porter was helpful with our luggage and ask for our passport but the Concierge staff was showing an extremely rude gesture to porter and us -should have look at his name tag. Another staff saw it and she walk over and check us in very very quickly. Management is not warm, lack of sincerity. What a disappointing, if not totally annoying experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Business meets pleasure”
Reviews.Author: oreostuff
Reviews.Content: After seven years of marriage, I was finally to accompany my husband on his business trip to Hong Kong and China. He has been traveling to Asia for the past 25years and because this would be my first trip with him to Hong Kong, he allowed me to pick the hotel. He had two parameters for me to follow:  it had to cost less then $350usd per night and it had to be four stars or higher. He told me about the previous hotels where he stayed and I went into research mode (my husband could stay in a barn if breakfast is included, I, on the other hand, am a typical New Yorker). After finding Trip Advisor and reading many, many reviews and also the Fodor's books, I decided on the Langham Hotel on Peking Road. We arrived about 11pm Sunday night. The hotel sent a car for us (it turned out to be a Bemz with a very talkative driver. He tried to play tour guide after our 18hr flight and it was just too much). We arrived to a beautiful lobby, got checked in, were escorted to our room and shortly, our bags arrived. The room had a king size bed, a desk, a flat screen TV and to our surprise, a bureau (chest of drawers) and another short bureau (a whole other set of drawers), plus closet space that actually allowed my husband room to hang his clothes for a change. The bathroom had a separate shower and bath and nice amenities that were restocked everyday. We also had a nice table for two in the room (where local fruit was offered daily) and above our mini bar, was an electric teapot where three different types of tea were available all day (replenished with turndown service). We would have liked more fridge room as the hotel's restaurants were very pricey (like a good hotel in NY!), but we soon learned to buy at Starbucks and squeeze in the few items that needed refrigeration.  Housekeeping was relentless in getting into the room, so since it was a pleasure trip for me, I simply adjusted my schedule to save frustration on either of our parts. I felt safe, welcomed and accommodated at this hotel as I had an eye infection my second day there. The hotel sent a doctor to my room (which was later covered by my health insurance) and then the manager called to see how the visit went and if I needed anything else. He directed my husband to a pharmacy for some feminine hygiene stuff for me and told him how to make the request (see the pharmacist, no one else will know what you mean!).  The various people at the concierge were either brusque or hurried. I took this as a cultural thing and when I stood my ground and insisted on better directions (I was a woman traveling alone 90% of the time), they calmed down and gave me extra assurances. Many tours were booked through the hotel and after three days of this, I was to book them myself. We also ate at every restaurant in the hotel and then ventured out, with help of my husband's business connections or the aforementioned Fodor's book. The Langham Hotel made my first impression of Hong Kong memorable, with ideal location to ferry and MTR; dining options (too tired to walk, room service was excellent); shopping everywhere you looked and Nathan Road right down the block. The only time we took taxis was to find a restaurant I had read about or a colleague recommended. I felt like I received five-star service even though it took them two days to get the DVD in the room to work.
