Our room had no view, but it was quiet at night and let in the sunlight when I was there alone in the late afternoons. I would say that if you are from a big city, you will "get" the vibe at this Langham. If you are looking for more space, pay to get upgraded, but ask to be shown the room first; or stay elsewhere where they can do more hand holding for you.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: mikemtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the langham because it was one of the few that could confirm connecting rooms for us and our kids. We took the tranportation service from the airport and we recommend it. Vey nice people were waiting for us at the airport with fresh drinks and a superb luxury van. Wehn we arrived at the hotel they greeted us perfectly and brought us directly to our room where the papers were signed and credit card taken. Very personalized and classy. No waiting at the front desk. The hotel and the rooms are splendid. There unfortunately no views on the water but the hotel is well located close to everything. The restaurants in the hotel are amazing! The chinese restaurant is highly rated by MIchelin and deserves its stars. It is the best chinese food we ever had. There is also a buffet restaurant that serves breakfast. The breakfast was absolutely delicious and they had gluten free bread for me (not common in asia). The dinner buffet was out of this world! We enjoyed this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Honeymoon to Bali and stayed in The Langham for 3 nights. The Grand Langham room was the poshest hotel room we have stayed in; bed was huge, very spacious room, fabulous bathroom with a huge bath to indulge in. The location is perfect for all the tourist visits. The breakfast was fabulous, with any combination you would choose. We ate in the New York Deli one day which was just great, I have been to New York many times and the menu and food hits the right spot! The pool is small and you need to follow the shadows round to sunbathe, but it it s rooftop facility so obviously has space challenges. In summary, I would describe this hotel as opulant and we will definitely have a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Position”
Reviews.Author: rosebudadventures
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel is very elegant, and situated in a great position for the Star Ferry and Shopping. We stayed in a Grand Deluxe Room which is spacious in Hong Kong Standards, unfortunately the only views were of ugly buildings, but that is to be expected in H.K. The staff were helpful, and as a smoker I was able to have a smoking room. The Bathroom is lovely with a Full size bath to relax in after a hard day at The Shops or Touring. I would recomend this Hotel and be happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, This is the hotel to stay in if you're in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ko_racer
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for a business trip, everyone who's been there before said this is the place to stay and I agree. They staff couldn't be more helpful, room was excellent and I slept really well even after the long flight from the UK. It's a shame there is no free wifi, but it can be purchased. The hotel is well situated for both business and shopping. Loved the place, if I ever go back I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: night_shift
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at this hotel just last week and we found that the everything was perfect except for the check in process which took some time but it was not a problem. My parents were upgraded from a deluxe room to a suite which was great! There was no free breakfast thoughso we had to have this at the nearby Mcdonalds but it was ok (i guess). Overall, we had a great 5 nights' stay here. Thanks to Camella who ssisted us in everything! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “18.65 - A rare treat”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: If you happen to be in a bar at the the Langham at 7.05 pm they have a very quaint and fun tradition. The year 1865 is when the first Langham opened and 1865 they have translated into 7.05 pm. Don't ask. But at that time they ring a gong and anyone having a drink gets a free drink and a snack./ On the night we were there we re given the minin\ burgers of the snack list, which we were thinking of buying, and they wee delicious. The house drink not so much but it was a fun thing and something to watch out for when staying in the Langham Kowloon

Reviews.Title: “If it is service you are looking for, this is where you need to be”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes_park
Reviews.Content: The staff at all levels through the whole hotel are nothing short of first class. The doorman, the concierge & even the cleaners are helpful & seem to be permanently smiling & make sure you are too. The service at the Club & the attentive staff & free flowing Moet meant we were always smiling! Nothing is too much trouble for anyone there. Great place to stay. Only complaint was the dinner in the restaurant - see separate review.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved this hotel and we will definately stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: casper009
Reviews.Content: The restaurant in this hotel are really excellent and the staff go out of their way to make it enjoyable. The position is great and the room fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “It was an enchanting stay”
Reviews.Author: BrizzyPhilbo
Reviews.Content: The Langham openly state they try and make your stay an enchanting one and they certainly succeeded. We stayed 2 separate nights either side of a trip in to mainland China. The staff were thoughtful and considerate, the rooms exquisite and the amenities comprehensive. We payed for a suite as a special event and this included access to the club facilities. Very worthwhile if it is within your budget. Included a wonderful breakfast and delightful cocktails and canapes in the evening. The hotel is located near the star ferry and the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR making it very convenient to get around. The Staff's english is very good and they are only to happy to direct you to facilities and places as you require.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OlEm
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong with our three and four-year-old children - we didn't realise what a problem this would be as far as getting a hotel room. The Langham was happy for the little ones to top-and-tail in the additional bed in our room and provided them with robes, slippers, gifts and chocolates. Along with the lovely roof-top pool, the kids loved it. Us adults were pretty happy too. A clean hotel, nice friendly, helpful staff and a good location made our stay in Hong Kong a very pleasant one. We would definitely go back. Thank you The Langham Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: HB00763
Reviews.Content: An all round great hotel. Despite a very early morning arrival (7.30am) staff found a room for us within half an hour. The room was excellent and a lot bigger than most other Hong Kong hotel rooms. The staff were friendly and the concierges extremely helpful. Rooms were quiet and the location is near all transport and shopping. The restaurants were beautiful especially the T'ang Court, a well priced two Michellin starred restaurant. Will definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service / Lackluster Property”
Reviews.Author: Luis T
Reviews.Content: Summary: Clearly a standard bearer in years past, the Langham Hotel - Hong Kong is clearly handicapped by an aging property and nearby constructions (eliminating any 'Bay Views' they once had). The staff is clearly committed to a superb level of service to continue to compete but sadly fall short of their inflated price tag. In short - a great property for business (if at a good rate) but not the choice for savy travelers looking for the iconic hotels of Hong Kong. The Good: Great Shopping Location, Easy Access to Star Ferries, Super Service, Nice Pool Area and Gym The Bad: 'Zero' Bay Views (100% Blocked by new constructions), Aging Rooms, High Price to Value

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff service, audio equipment sucks”
Reviews.Author: carmenli10
Reviews.Content: Been there 1 night stayed in deluxe suite. Nice & warm decoration and clean, especially the bathroom & Jacuzzi. something goes wrong for the in-room DVD player and the audio setting . Half-an-hour maintenance work has been carried out. My husband & I did nothing but just watching the technician doing the job. Suggest the hotel to check everytime when the last customer checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but for same money, I'd stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: maclover_it
Reviews.Content: The Langham is good hotel, I'd say 4.5*. In my opinion it is average in every aspect when compared to other comparable options in TST. Location is good but not as good as other hotels and if coming from Nathan road you have to go down an underpass all the time and it gets a bit annoying. Rooms are good in size and well appointed but not as fancy or hip as the Mira, and look a bit dated. I would stay here again but just if price is lower than comparable other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: CositaBerlin
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel is in a great location. The metro station is right in front of the hotel. It is definitely worth spending your nights here. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The interior of the room has been very stylish and comfortable. The room has been very clean. Although our view wasn't really nice we would recommend a stay here. The free airport express shuttle service stops at the hotel that is very convenient. If you step out the hotel you are right in the middle of bustling Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Viajera64
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing! It is right in the middle of everything on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. You can walk out and step right onto the subway. It is only about two blocks from the Harbor and the must-see laser light show at night. The service was outstanding. The concierge was helpful and really, everyone was. There is an amazing buffet breakfast filled with both western and Chinese foods that is included with your room, and the main host, Joseph Tai along with his helper, Brian Wong (?) were incredible. Every morning, they remembered our names and Joseph remembered even more details - again, incredible service. The hotel also has a pool on the rooftop, and because we went in July and it was extremely hot, we enjoyed using it when the sun went down.

Reviews.Title: “perfect sopover”
Reviews.Author: maggic
Reviews.Content: we stopped over at the langham on our way back to NZ. the staff were so kind and welcoming that when we stop next time we will certainly stay here. great foyer, rooms are superb and the langham club is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CosmoKitty24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Langham for 9 nights back in September of 2010, and loved my time at the hotel. The Langham is conveniently located in Tsim Sha Tsui, within walking distance to Nathan Road, the Star Ferry Terminal, and Kowloon Park. The entrance to the Metro is directly across the street from the entrance of the hotel, which is very convenient for getting to and from the office in the morning and evening. My room had a comfy queen size bed, a large bathroom with a soaker tub, and walk in shower. My room also had a large writing desk, with a power station for charging phone, ipad and laptop. Two power converters were also provided. A large closet and safe were also part of the room. The business center is located just off the lobby next to the reception desk, and has 3 or 4 computers with individual printers, handy for printing your boarding pass. There is also a Nespresso machine in the business center, which was nice to have when jet-lag set in. My room came with 60 minutes of business center use, which was more than enough. I had room service for breakfast and dinner a few times, and all meals were very good. The breakfast buffet at the main restaurant was also excellent, with many, many choices both Western and Asian. As I was in Hong Kong for 9 days, I took advantage of the pool and spa on the weekend. Despite the oppressive heat and humidity in the summer, the rooftop pool was very cool and refreshing, with views of Victoria Harbour. The spa is small, but excellent. I booked myself a facial, reflexology and Chinese acupressure massage, and after 3 hours I was as loose and relaxed as i have ever been. The massage was one of the best I have ever had! Prices are very reasonable for spa services as well, which makes it all the better. I really loved this hotel, and will be staying there again on my next trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: 3-fl-oz-com
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was gorgeous. The rooms were beyond comfortable. The staff were helpful and even solicitous. The hotel is centrally located. I would definitely want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As you would expect total luxury”
Reviews.Author: BusymumCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days. The room was enormous and the bathroom was gorgeous. The service was always excellent. It is close enough to the MTR. The breakfast was awesome - truly fabulous. Ate here once for lunch and it was lovely. We tried the (one/two/three?) Michelin star restaurant upstairs for my husband's birthday. It was okay but I advise you save your money, the service was great but the atmosphere was lacking. The decor is extremely dull and the tables looked spartan. There was no sense of occassion as I would have expected. There are many fabulous places to eat in Hong Kong (cheaper too). I recommend you use comparison sites because I managed to get this hotel for 70% off the rack rate without too much searching. Note that the ground floors are a very posh shopping centre - if you have been to HK you will understand that this is normal and the surrounding area is interesting (if you like shopping) it is probably equivalent to Bond Street as it is a 30 second walk from Dior, Chanel, Fendi, Vuitton flagship stores. I recommend the boat trip around the Harbour and the day trip to the big Buddha on the hill. Ocean Park not recommended, it's tiny and old and a waste of money! Generally HK seems to be a pointless destination unless you adore shopping (there is nothing else to do) and I'm a woman (I love shopping) and even I was fed up with it after a few days. Perfect stopover destination. The Pearl Market was brilliant. The taxi from the airport is about £60. The afternoon tea is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a grand luxury setting”
Reviews.Author: UncleDMD
Reviews.Content: The Langham was an oasis of luxury in the midst of a busy shopping district. The service at every turn was exquisite, and the hotel's Chinese restaurant provided one of the best meals we've ever had. The staff in the Langham club were extremely helpful with touring advice, restaurant suggestions and transportation. This is one of the grandest hotels in Hong Kong and a pleasure to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - more than 'a hotel'”
Reviews.Author: JC_Sydney_11
Reviews.Content: All the positive feedback about this hotel turned out to be true, and then some! Langham hotel makes the HK trip special from check in, to check out. The staff are espcially good at making you feel welcome and a special guest. If you are looking for a memorable place to stay > Langham HK fits the bill. All aspects of the stay were special - lived up to the positive reviews on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “World's BEST hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LMV003
Reviews.Content: An absolutely outstanding hotel. Every single aspect of this hotel makes you feel like royalty. The staff are exceptionally friendly and are happy and willing to help in any way possible. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The amenities are quite special. The buffet breakfast offers quit a large selection of very fresh, tasty food. Overall an amazing experience staying at the Langham Hotel and I can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous holiday great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cathystravels
Reviews.Content: After a wee problem with our booking for triple room it was revealed that they don't actually have triple rooms!! The staff worked hard to get us a larger room and ensure our comfort, we had a lovely time. Comfortable very clean and attended rooms, helpful and always so polite. A great hotel in the thick of things a wonderful stay enjoyed by all!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: euro727
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Langham 4 times over the past couple of years and it has always been very good. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Drawers for clothing are plentiful and the closets are a good size. The hotel is impeccably maintained with friendly staff. Breakfast buffet is very good, though expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Calm at the center of the posh shopping district”
Reviews.Author: sputnika
Reviews.Content: The Langham scent is associated in my mind with good memories. This Langham in Hongkong (as opposed to the modern Langham Place) feels like an old world gem, and the staff go our of their way to make your trip as smooth as possible. Excellent service + beautiful place + convenient location = wonderful vacation. It is an oasis of calm and comfort in the middle of the busy shopping district of TST, next to a Duty Free, Harbour City, and the international designer boutiques of Canton Road. One can watch shoppers patiently lining up for their turn to shop at Louis Vuitton or Hermes, visit the lovely Dior store, or the check out how modern commerce meets old world charm at the 1881 Heritage. If the shopping neighborhood is not your style, the entrance to the vast TST metro station and underground pedestrian walkway is right across the street, connecting you to the rest of the city. Also a few minutes' walk away is the Star Ferry, which must be the best and cheapest way to see the city's magnificent skyline and check out the other side of the city. Inside the beautiful and fragrant hotel, the staff make sure you are welcome and are ready to help with every need. If you arrange for the airport limousine transfers (somewhat pricey, but more comfortable than Airport Express), the pampering starts at the airport, with drinks ready to cool the traveller after a long trip. We thank all the lovely staff members who made our stay so comfortable. Separating the shower stall and tub was a nice touch, although the shower was rather small. The rooms were also compact (this is Hong Kong), but well-appointed. We slept well despite the central location, so the soundproofing must have been good. Our visit was too short to sample all the hotel could offer, and hope to be back here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Standard is high even though it's at peak season”
Reviews.Author: Luis_HK
Reviews.Content: I've got a chance to stay 3 nights here for business during Rugby sevens period. Understandably it's a peak period for HK hotels, the whole experience is fantastic. the checking in process is very quick, the room is very very well furnished and superb upkeep. The toilet is very clean and again delightfully furnished. Essential bathroom products are available. The bed is very comfortable, essential for business travelers to re-charge. The hotel itself is very well positioned - in the heart of TST shopping district, that certainly helps for me to get food as I tend to work late at night. The overall experience is excellent, I'd recommend my friends to this hotel when they travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StefanieLee
Reviews.Content: Best location to stay in Hongkong. Just a minute's walk to Harbour City and you can find many designer labels just around the corner filled with queues to go in the shops. Classic interior room deco, comfy bed. However bathtub was not clean. Breakfast in the deli was just mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: DIAOON
Reviews.Content: The Location is great. Just outside the Hotel, you will find all the luxurious brands i.e. Cartier, Dior, LV, Gucci, Prada, Tiffany. Many restaurants can be found within the surrounding area. Just a few minutes walk to the MRT station through DFS Galleria which is just next door. Walking distance to the Star Ferry & Avenue of Stars. Service is very good. Staff is very polite. Room is clean and the bathroom toiletries are adequate and nice. The Business Centre will give you half an hour's usage with 4 computers available. Nevertheless would prefer if free wifi is available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional and a scam! (the confirmation is a one way binding contract, and its not the hotel!)”
Reviews.Author: echoi
Reviews.Content: LANGHAM HOTEL LACKS PROFESSIONALISM, WE LEFT AND DID NOT STAY THE NIGHT EVEN IT WAS ALREADY PAID FOR! It is my birthday and as a birthday present, my sister got me a room at the Langham hotel to stay the night. I actually wanted to go for a weekend getaway (I live in HK, by that I mean heading to Macau), so I called Langham's reservation and see if I could reschedule the stay for another day. "Sorry sir, as written in the fine print in your email confirmation, there are no refund nor rescheduling allowed." ... so be it. Since the email confirmation said we can park overnight for a nominal fee, my fiancee and I drove and arrived at exactly 5:51pm (stamped by valet), as we get off, I told the attendant that the car will be parked overnight. He looked at me and said it will be charged by the hour. I told him its in the agreement, he said I would have to talk to reservations. There was hardly a line and as I was checking in, I mentioned the parking situation, after the Langham staff saw the confirmation letter, she showed it to her colleague, whom started serving us... by telling us its not possible and the hotel will not honor it... I explained to her that its in the agreement and its something the hotel has to deal with the agency, not the guest... She told me to wait while she calls her manager, after putting down the phone she told me that I can wait in my room while she resolves the issue, meanwhile the car will have a 2 hour free of parking. I said "NO! I am not going to wait in the room for 2 hours while you go check" (what if they come back declining it again?!?!"). She calls the manager again... this time, I told her to get the manager to come out and talk to me directly. She finally comes out, told us to show her the confirmation (it was on our mobile), then told us to send her a copy to her email, she then had her staff go back to back office, check her mail, printed it out and handed it to her, she told me that this is an error with the agency and thus it is not their responsibility to honor it.... I was like... excuses me?!?! I wanted to change the date of my stay, you said no because it states so in the terms and conditions while you have a right to refuse when you don't like it?!?! She then said that I have to go deal with the agency, its not the hotel's problem.... I asked her "is the agency not authorized by the hotel to make reservations and the terms and conditions were pre-agreed between the hotel and the agency?" She said yes. So I demanded that she honors the agreement or let me refund my sister's money or allow me to change the date on my reservations! She said she'll have to go inside to check. I said fine, stood (at the reservations desk) and waited, my fiancee got bored, she left and sat down at the lobby, (in the meantime, their staffs were busy serving other people and simply ignored me, the least they can do is to sit me down, give me a glass of water or something, but nothing!). 20 minutes later (it's 6:27pm, we've been at this for more than 30 minutes), my fiancee came back and said we should just leave and forget it. I asked a staff to let the manager knows that we are no longer waiting and will leave. The manager came back out and she said she had yet been able to resolve the problem. I immediately explained to her that this is no longer my issue. She is either to refund the money to my sister or allow us to change our reservations. She said no because it is stated in the confirmation letter. I went furious! I said "so is the parking!", and LOUD! "The problem is not me, why am I suffering from this, I am the Guest!". The floor manager quickly comes over and offers his help (he obviously knows what was going on), He explains that this is an error made by the agency, thus it is not the responsibility of the hotel to honor it. I told him that since the hotel authorized the agency to take room reservations on their behalf. The hotel must honor whatever is said on the terms and conditions. The floor manager finally gave in and agreed to offer the parking under the said terms. But I told him its too late, I don't want to stay at the hotel anymore, I didn't spend the last 45 minutes standing here to go over something that is not my fault. I am leaving and I'll let someone else stay here at another date. The floor manager disagrees and again brought up the terms and conditions... The conversations got heat up and by this time. I got so loud that the manager asked me to quiet down. I told him its not my fault that I am loud, if he has a problem with it, he should've moved me to a private room for discussion. I kept on telling him (and let people hear) how they're denying the terms and conditions they've set in the agreement and how I am standing there suffering from it. My only guess is that the floor manager finally decided that he no longer wants to deal with me he finally agrees to let me reschedule. I said "that's fine, simply give me your business card and I'll leave!" THIS IS A SCAM! For a very simple reason, when a guest tries to alter any terms and conditions set forth, the hotel will always uses the agency as an excuse to deny the alteration. But when the hotel does not want to honor the terms and conditions, they simply says they will not honor it and the guest should deal with the agency! COMPLETE LACK OF PROFESSIONALISM! First of all, Langham hotel should immediately acknowledge the agreement (and deal with the agency aside), having me stood at the reservation desk for 45 minutes is simply unprofessional. They could have at the very least sat me at a corner and deal with me. But no, the manager went back inside and had me stood there waiting for another 20 minutes. And the floor manager comes out and continues to tell me it is not their fault. This was merely a parking issue and yet I had to go through 4 staff, their entire chain of command just to acknowledge something they've written in fine print. Worst of all, not a single apology, not one! from any of the staff. For creating the hassle that should've never existed. For a mere parking issue, I had to wait in the lobby for 45 minutes, explained my situation that is set by their terms and conditions. Explained it to 4 different people, didn't even get to sit down or offered a glass of water, ON MY BIRTHDAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: jensSydney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel ideally situated near Star ferry,MTR station and Harbour City shopping centre.Gorgeous foyer and the rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious,we had a Grand room .Chose to take extra package to include the Langham club,if you can stretch your budget it is definitely worthwhile.Breakfast,traditional afternoon tea,drinks and canapes are included and served in an exclusive area on the 11th floor,there is also a business centre there as well.I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff are so helpful! They could not do enough for us,they make you feel very special.We really enjoy are stay here and look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel. Everything was just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TrumanLondon
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for travelling all over HK. We stayed in a Club Room, with Club Benefits so we got breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks, use of meeting room, use of the gym (although it was too cold to swim in the outside pool!) The room was a good size with television, iPod facilities, complimentary internet access. The bathroom was great. HUGE bed! The staff at the hotel just couldn't do enough for us. They were very helpful and polite. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Nomadickitten
Reviews.Content: Like all the other Langhams a beautiful hotel with old world charm. Her rooms are intricately decorated with amities that you didn't even think you would need making however many nights you are staying there convenient and luxurious. A trip up to the health club is a must with spectacular views from the heated pool over looking the city, and to die for massages from the masseur. A little disappointed in that I requested a queen for me and my boyfriend and non smoking only to be put in a non smoking- but stunk of cigarettes 2 single bed room. Unfortunately we were only there from two nights and it seemed to much of an effort to change. Fantastic location - close to every thing you need to be close to. Would stay again if the rooms smell as amazing as the rose smothered lobby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the great hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: downtownwestie
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed at the Langham Hotel for two nights. The service from check-in and throughout our stays was impeccable. I stayed at the grand Langham room, of which speaks luxury at every corner. Comfortable bed, classy decors, and one of the best designed bathroom. I cannot wait until my next assignment and return to the Langham hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay despite a bumpy start!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwithinfant
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Langham just after 3pm to check into our room. Prior to our holiday I had already called ahead and confirmed that the room would be available for 3pm. Upon arrival at the hotel we were told that our room wasn't ready. Initially, it would just be another half an hour, and we were happy to wait in the lobby area. We were given a complimentary soft drink, which was nice. However, by 4.30pm we were still waiting. I then spoke to the manager, who finally arranged for us to have another room. We were travelling with our young son of 4 months, and it was a relief to finally be able to unpack and get him settled in. The hotel was able to provide us with a steam steriliser for the baby bottles (something I had already confirmed when I called ahead). Though not included in our stay, we opted to have the breakfast buffet at the hotel. It was very nice with a broad selection of different foods. Throughout our stay, the staff were very courteous and helpful, however they never went above and beyond. At check-in they apologised for the delay in getting our room ready, but had I not spoken to the manager, who knows how long we would've been waiting. So all in all a nice stay in a great location, but really a minimum of what I expect from a hotel of this calibre in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: totaloff
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 4 nights at the Langham Hotel and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel represents great value with everything functioning the way you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Having booked a suite this gave as access to the club lounge which was a great place to relax and have a quite drink after a big day of sight seeing and shopping. The rooms where clean, the reception area was grand and the service provided by the staff at the hotel was second to none. Although the hotel doesn't offer harbor views its location is great. Located only a few minutes walk from the main ferry terminal which will take you to Hong Kong Island it's also just a short walk to some great shopping areas including Nathan Rd. We loved it and would more then likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific service and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RickyG48
Reviews.Content: We had four nights here celebrating a major wedding anniversary and a milestone birthday and could not fault the service and value. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Only fault was although Internet was free in business centre it was far too expensive to your room. After four weeks in Europe this was our most expensive and luxurious hotel and apart from one other the only not to supply Internet free to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stylegirl35
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to Hong Kong and China to see our niece who is living in Shenzen for her work. She ducked across the border to stay with us at The Langham in Kowloon for four days. We were a share triple room, which was OK - if a little cramped with the rollaway bed. I can't speak highly enough of the location - it was brilliant, close to shopping (but where isn't in HK?) and both the ferry terminal and subway. My thoughts: was a bit disappointed with the room size for a share triple, was also really disappointed with the bathroom for a triple - one small sink with no extra vanity or baench room to store toilette bags or make-up purses etc., one tiny mirror. In fact the smallest bathroom in any 4+ star hotel I've ever stayed in, which seemed a little 'mean' given they knew we were three of us... Breakfast for two was provided in the share triple room rate but we had to pay $300HKD for the extra breakfast each day. Niece volunteered to go without breakfast but these two aunties couldn't have that, so we paid the extra. Just seemed a bit silly when you book a triple??? I admit, I've not travelled share triple before so I don't know what is normal? Would I recommend it? Yes - but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “My Home in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: GloboImporter
Reviews.Content: For the past 3 years I have stayed at the Langham whenever I visit Hong Kong on Business. I feel that it is the best value for luxury hotels in either Kawloon or Hong Kong Island, although the prices have been going up which may require me to look for a new home. The rooms are a little small, but very well appointed and always spotless. The Fitness Center is great. At the end of a long trip, the New York style Delicatessen on the lower level is a nice, casual change from either Chinese food or expensive western style restaurants. The Staff is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NuttyNat01
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - it was very clean and spacious, has a great rooftop pool and spa - there is a sauna, steam room and hot tub in each of the men and women's changing rooms which is lovely and relaxing after a swim, and which you don't have to pay for. Couldn't comment on the quality of the spa as we didn't use it. The hotel is not too far from the airport - about 45 mins altogether. It is easy to get to, simply get on the airport express train to Mongkok (it's around £15 return each) and get a taxi from the station. Taxis are so cheap in HK and are metered, so price isn't really a problem. It cost around £3-4 to get from the train station to the hotel. The hotel itself is attached to a big shopping mall where there is shopping and lots of restaurants at much cheaper prices than the hotel. It's well worth a look if you don't want to pay hotel prices. That said the food in the hotel isn't bad - we ordered room service and although my food was ok, my husband's was cold and well below standard for the price tag of £15 they were attaching to it. That said, breakfast was fantastic - lots of choice and very fresh - couldn't fault it at all. If you want to see more of the city, I would suggest the Big Bus Tour - you can get tickets from the hotel reception (around £20 each), but it includes the tour (there are 2/3 different lines that will take you all around the city), it also includes entrance to the Tram that goes up the mountain, a boat ride out to the floating restaurant and access to the ferry - when you take into a/c the added extras, it's a bargain. However HK is a very congested city and the buses are often late and get held up in traffic, so beware! There are some great night markets and shops around the hotel, which means that you are not stuck inside the hotel and there is always something to do. Overall, I would recommend this hotel - even better if you can get a deal with breakfast included, and we would definitely stay here again if we visited HK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent with great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: like the langham near peking rd great location - excellent restaurants great hotel , only the front entrance is strange as you have to go up and no escalator/or lift new rooms good

Reviews.Title: “Location was superb!”
Reviews.Author: Denebe
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel was very pricy but location wise it was great! We were right in the heart of Peking road where all the great designer stores and food places are located. It was nice to see the packe streets ful of locals and tourists all around! Gives you a NYC vibe!! The ferry ride is nearby... like 5-6 mins away and we saw the gorgeous HK skyline just minutes walk away from the hotel. But the rooms are a bit small but the beautiful lobby is amazing! For a couple the room is ok but if you have kids you need to get a second room which can become too expensive. If you have the cash go for the Langham!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and strategic location”
Reviews.Author: BabyUm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Langham room which was very well furnished, nice bathroom and even had it's own iPod dock system. Hotel enjoys a very strategic location, and luxury boutiques in 1881 Heritage and Harbour City shopping is only 5 minutes walk away. My son was initially grumpy upon arrival to HK since we did not advise him of our traveling plans until 6am prior to leaving for the airport but upon checking in the hotel, there were no more complaints as it was just so comfortable and he didn't want to leave! Understand that the Chinese restaurant is good too although we didn't have a chance to try. Those looking for affordable luxurious rooms with very spacious bathroom without breaking the bank should really consider this this hotel. When we tried booking again in November hotel was fully booked, so to avoid disappointment, book early since Langham is a popular choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stopover”
Reviews.Author: tss
Reviews.Content: While we only stayed one night with the Langham, we were very impressed by the experience. Dinner at the Michelin starred Tang Court was very good and all of the hotel staff with whom we came into contact were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “World-class”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: Everything about the property is top-shelf and the staff are the best there are. Great location, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeliclecat
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hong Kong, although my husband visits every couple of years for the Tin Ho Dan festivals in the new territories (worth a trip if you want to explore a bit off the beaten path), so although I have no other experiences of hotels in Kowloon to compare it to, this hotel was fantastic! We had booked room only as my husband is familiar with all the 'out of the way' traditional chinese eateries and ate out for breakfast lunch and dinner most daya. The room was a smallish room but perfectly formed - very comfortable after a day out exploring. Each day our room was cleaned to perfection and each night the bed covers were turned down and slippers left out. The housekeeping staff accidentally lifted my facecloth and after a quick report to reception it was returned that evening, washed, pressed and wrapped! with a wee card from the Senior housekeeper with an apology and a large bowl of fruit - they couldn't do enough. The staff were all very knowledgable and helpful and had a weird knack of knowing what you want before you even know yourself but without being overbearing. The spa and pool areas were superb and had everything to hand that you would need from towels and shower products to cold towels from the fridge and sanitised hair brushes. On our last day we checked out at midday and we could still use the spa facilities to freshen up before heading off for our flight at 11pm. The location of the hotel would be hard to beat. It is linked directly to a shopping centre, where you get a discount for being a hotel resident, and the MTR (underground trains) are just a short trip down on the escalator through the mall - very helpful on very hot/humid days when you could save all your energy for exploring your destination rather than brave the energy sapping heat. Will definitely return to this hotel on my next tip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The most enjoyable hotel stay in 25 years of travelling”
Reviews.Author: Ramsdalen
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for a 4 night stay as the first stop on a 4 week holiday to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday. It was a great choice. The package was booked directly with the hotel and included the Langham Club. Our only regret was that we only stayed for 4 nights. The Club package was definitely worth the extra with breakfast, afternoon tea, evening snacks and drinks, complimentary internet and garment pressing on arrival. The hotel is so convenient for the Star Ferry, access to transport facilities to tourist locations -there was no need to use tour buses. Cannot comment on the hotel restaurants as we had no reason to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, thoughtful touches, well worn but still grand”
Reviews.Author: rwps
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with big windows. We were up high at the end of the corridor with a glimpse of water through buildings - a view that wasn't expected, and was nice. Staff were friendly and efficient from the start and made our stay very enjoyable. The place had a slightly well worn feel to it, but it's daggy dated "grandness" sort of worked to create a nice ambience. My daughter loved it's old style grand look & touches - particularly all the pink accessories. The complimentary little rubber duck/goose was a classy touch too. Very close to star ferry & not far from Metro so good location. The pool was a great spot to relax outdoors and was perfect for kids to enjoy within easy site too.

Reviews.Title: “Club class is worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: MinicoopersLiverpool
Reviews.Content: This was the final lap on our holiday from Australia and we wanted to treat ourselves. And what a treat this was. We arrived at 6am inthe morning, tired after a 12 hour journey. Room was not ready but they showed us to the Club room where we were served a beautiful breakfast while our room was prepared. The hotel was spectacular. Nestled in the heart of a vibrant and noisy Kowloon, we could escape into the luxury of the Langham. We got Club membership as part of the deal, it made all the difference. Here, you have private dining facilities and business facilties. Very British afternoon tea (with champagne, if you like), an early evening canapes (and substantial they were) and drinks. In fact, throughout the day you could enjoy drinks and ice cream. It was our first visit to Hong Kong and after the peace and tranquility of Australia, this was a shock to the system. The Langham allowed us to recharge and relax. Staff were incredibily helpful and gave very personal service. My only complaint, well shock really, was in the bedroom. The wall between the bathroom and bedroom had a large window. Thank goodness there was a blind to hide your modesty. But why have it, at all?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLockwood
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay here after a visit to Singapore. We arrived quite late ( 9 ish ) and has to be said the lobby was very busy. It appeared our Tour op had not requested the double beds we had wanted and there were non available at this time. The front desk apologised profusely and offered an upgrade but single beds which was fine. The rooms were a good size with good bathroom products and a very fierce shower ! It also has a nice lounge bar with a singer nightly and 2for1drinks for residents between 7and 9. Nice touch. The breakfast buffet was one of the best i had seen. All cuisines were catered for and teas/coffees were bought to the table by very efficient and polite local staff. Excellent ! The concierge were also very helpful in organising our dinner venues so no complaints there either. All in all a very pleasant stay in a good hotel and would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury that's all about service”
Reviews.Author: gerbilsontour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and well priced relative to its value. The rooms are large by HK standards with plenty of room for a king bed, chair, working desk etc. The service you receive from the minute you arrive is stand-out 5 star. All of the concierge staff are very helpful - but be aware they add a 5% service charge if they book any trips for you. The hotel itself is opulent and well fitted out. I especially enjoyed the quiet of the roof top pool. The food at breakfast is excellent and well worth the price - one of the best buffet selections anywhere. The TST location means that there are excellent hotels nearby but the hotel also has a great restaurants on site - in particular we loved the T'ang Court a 2 michelin star cantonese restaurant: we had the set monthly set menu which was well balanced with 6 well sized portions, all excellently presented. The wine list is sensational. One small negative - there are no views - the bedrooms have blinds so that you dont look out at the buildings opposite, as to the window bays near the lifts. There is a glimpse of the outside from the breakfast room and the T'ang Court, but the Palm Court is internal and other two restaurants are in the basement. And what to do in HK - we took organised trips. All could have been done much cheaper by using the efficient public transport but when time is tight and you don't know a city its sometimes easier. The trip to Lantau island to the giant buddah/monestary and TaiO fishing village is worth it as you avoid the massive queues for the cable car up to the monestary. The HK oreintation tour is less worth it - Stanley market is not really worth a vist, you only drive past the beach and are taken to Aberdeen for a sanpan tour (extra cost) and to a jewellery factory to try and sell you gifts. The trip up to the peak is worth it but you only get 20 minutes there so just time to have a look and take a photo but no time to walk around the park and area. I would recommend trying to do HK island yourself as the trains/buses are very easy to use - get an octopus card (HK$150 plus HK$50 deposit) which means you dont need change - for this money you will be able to travel on all public transport over several days. We also did a trip to see the famous "pink river dolphins" - they are really white and look pink when they blush - they are endadered and live in the very polluted waters near the airport and power plant, so whilst it was a nice trip and we saw three dolphins, the views aren't great and, together with the smog that hand over HK, it reminds you how badly the locals treat the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect-book now!”
Reviews.Author: SAL71_11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before on business and its always been great- this time i took my family for a 5 night stay. The moment you arrive you're getting great service from everyone you meet- we especially liked the warm welcome from a lady called Wimmi who check us in and took us from the front desk up to our room. We had a Grand Langham room on the 8th Floor and it was spacious, very clean and very quiet. The location of the hotel is perfect- just a 5 minue walk to TST Star Ferry Terminal and less than that to Nathan Road. The leisure facilities on the 15th floor are great- a good gym and an open air pool inlcuding a hot tub. Dont look anywhere else, get on and book this hotel right now! Thanks to the Langham fro a fab holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable well located luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandJ42
Reviews.Content: Every attention is paid to detail to make your stay in this sumptuous hotel a memorable experience. Its location in Kowloon near Victoria Harbour is ideal. The restaurant menus for the buffets both at breakfast and dinner are very varied and all the food was absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression lasts...”
Reviews.Author: girlstuckinsydney
Reviews.Content: Went through Hongkong hotels religiously for nearly 6 months to find the right hotel as I was travelling with 2 children (7 and 10 yos) and my mother who's fussy about cleanliness and a bad knee (sounds like fun already !) Shortlisted the 2 Langham hotels (Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui) and chose the TST as we're more familiar with it (from previous visits ages ago) and also the special deal if you booked more than 45 days. As we landed, we took the airport shuttle which went directly to the hotel. It was pretty good, though from the arrival hall to the bus pick up was a long walk (esp. for my mum), which we should realise would be the first lesson in a lot of walking when you visit HK. The hotel was simple from outside but the inside was magnificent. The staff were also excellent. Every requests and questions were met excellently, from the Front staff, Concierges to the Housekeeping. Do not hesitate to ask for directories from the Concierges, we did and it made the trips easier!! We were staying on the Club level for 5 nights (joint rooms) and did not regret it. The rooms were spacious, very clean. Mum and kids gave the thumbs up.Bathroom was the same. The only thing I noticed was the fittings like the taps were a bit worn down (from its original glory of gold), but they were maintained and we did not find it a bother/problem. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its location is very handy, Harbourcity is just behind it, and Nathan Road is not far away either. Food is not a problem, there's plenty to choose from. The MTR station exit is conveniently located across the road from the hotel. BUT, be aware that though one station has many exits, usually the main location of the trains will usually be quite a walk, don't expect to reach it once you enter one of the exits. It's quite a hassle, especially for my mother who has a bad knee. The distance to walk to and from, and also lack of escalators and limited elevators in some. Taxi is usually our mode of transport after a long day. When we visited Mongkok, we saw the other Langham hotel (Langham Place), it was also a magnificent hotel, but the surrounding is less impressive and the number people on the streets, unbelievable! If you really like a crowded place, this one for you but I don't regret my choice, TST surrounding is better. Can't wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Still excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hotel Harry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago and were very impressed - this trip was just as good. They even remembered us - gace us the same upgraded room and automatically provided late check-out for our evening flight to Auckland at the end of our stay. The location is brilliant, literally a few minutes walk to the Star Ferry with the harbour, loads of restaurants and a myriad of shops on all your doorstep. The rooms are beautifully presented with fab toiletries and, in fact, a fabulous bathroom. We didn't have much of a view but who cares. There's a great American style cafe downstairs for when you arrive late after an overnight flight and just want some comfort food (the Rueben sandwich was very authentic) but there's plenty of local Chinese places close at hand. We didn't pay for web access in our room but used the complimentary 30 free minutes a day in the business centre. Whenever we went there, it was empty and we were told to take our time and not hurry. The service is excellent and all the staff are very well trained. My only negative comment is that the bar is was very quiet and lacking in atmosphere. Apart from that, it's luxury with easy transfers from the airport by train and free link bus. Go on, spoil yourself, you'll love it. And remember to take a swim in the beautiful rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Strongbox
Reviews.Content: Can't really add to the previous reviews, quality hotel, quality service. Only disappointment for me was the business centre - consisted of only 1 PC and that was only available when the desk was manned.. Didn't detract however from the wonderful experience we had here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the langham and the service was impecable. Clean rooms, good facilities and very helpful staff. Be careful if you stay on the 16th floor as it is a walk up from teh 15th (no elevator). Didn't bother me but it is something to note. The food is amazing. Even the business meeting snacks and meals were wonderful althought eh quantities waere a bit much. If you have ten at a meeting you only need to order food for five. You will have enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value,Central Location,modern,clean,classic hotel,a short 30 sec walk from Harbour City Kowloon,ideal for shopping”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Great Value, Central Location, modern, clean, classic hotel, a short 30 sec walk from Harbour City Kowloon - ideal for shopping The Langham Hotel Hong kong stands out as unique in Kowloon for me due to the classic, modern minimal, trendy inspiration that is centrally located in the heart of the shopping district at a very reasonable price. Presenting spacious clean comfortable rooms, provided with quality, beds, mattress, comforter, pillows and linen with strong sun blocking curtains as standard. Making the deal here very much in the patrons favor. Located very close to the underground system, shopping action and restaurants, the Langham Hotel Hong Kong is perfectly priced and perfectly situated for all weekend breaks. The staff here are very polite, very helpful and promoting the best service and experience for their guests, assuring all patrons receive the best deal possible. Tip: Request Taxi's drop you at the back-behind the property which is the main entrance to lobby, to avoid waiting for elevator or lugging bags-luggage up stairs from Peeking road which is not manned. Very impressed. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A class of its own”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter94
Reviews.Content: If you appreciate a "Good evening sir/madam" rather than "Hi" and " Have a nice day" then the Langam Hk may be for you. The door is opened for you and you enter a spotless foyer with sumptuous carpet and a huge urn of roses and lillies. The whole air is perfumed, and the staff beautifully dressed and groomed and quietly efficient. Instead of muzac, there is classical music. Welcome to the Langham. The rooms are a delight. Every comfort has been considered, whether for work or leisure. And there is a rare, well placed light for reading in bed. You will appreciate the bathroom amenities, the linen and towels, cupboard and drawer space and the level of service. My room was absolutely quiet. The hotel is very conveniently located for upmarket shopping and restaurants, and the MTR subway entrance is across the road. Try it: it is simple to get to Central (on HK island) or any other part of HK. I found the Concierge staff to be helpful and obliging, especially as I had some unusual queries. Any negative observations? I would have liked wi fi included. However, there was half an hour of free internet per day provided in the Business Centre, using hotel computers only. The gym was well equipped, but for me, the rooftop outdoor pool too small for swimming. If you wish to treat yourself (and why not) then feel confident that at the Langham, the putlay is well worth it. It is not just another hotel. The Langham Place is also highly regarded, but after visiting Mong Kok, I realised that I would not have felt comfortable in that neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Can't find fault with this hotel plus pool is nice”
Reviews.Author: EkinsGirl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The pool is lovely and peaceful, it is open until 10.00pm each evening which is very helpful after dinner and hectic shopping. I could not find adequate photos of the pool before we booked this place but I can say it is definitely fine, it is outdoor, however there are walls around it which creates a great ambience at night. There were no children in the pool the whole week we were there which was also a bonus. We have stayed at The Langham at Mongkok previously, it is a little more attractive overall I think, but I prefer the location of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & great services !”
Reviews.Author: cfanwei
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2 nights stay at the Langham Hotel. Everything was really great from the moment we check- in to the time we check-out.Room are spotless clean, very spacious with king side bed ,modern facilities…Excellent Customers services… staff are really nice, friendly, courteous at all time, we were feeling like living in luxury at home… if wifi internet was free ( including in the hotel rate ), we would have been more happier…I mean we are so happy with what we had and enjoyed anyway. Thank you to the hotel and all member of staff. They’re doin’ a very very good job to keep us happy,enjoyable. We will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION FOR BUSINESS AND PLEASURE.”
Reviews.Author: India529
Reviews.Content: It was a very pleasant change from staying in Nathan Rd on previous trips. Very relaxing after a long day to come to your hotel where the staff are so friendly. Also welcomed the chance to swim and relax in the sauna in the evenings. Will definitely stay here again if I can on my next trip. F. Moola

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria10017
Reviews.Content: Located in Tsim Sha Tsui (TST), it is right in the middle of the high-end shopping district, close to transportation options, the Harbour, Star ferry, restaurants. The lobby is spacious, service is impeccable from the warm welcome when you come in to the room service. Check-in was quick and easy as check-out (a 6AM, by the way). Although I thought the room was relatively more expensive than other Asian hotels I have been to, it was spacious and the bathroom was luxurious with a separate tub and shower and the bathroom amenities were impressive. Rooms had ipod docking stations, huge (42") flatscreen TV. The bed was very luxurious and I slept like a baby - a great tip for someone who always has a difficult time sleeping in a new place. My only complain (not really a complain but more an observation) is that they charge HKD150 for 24 hours internet which I feel in a high-tech world should be included free as part of the room package - as some hotels do so. I would recommend to friends especially to newcomers to Hong Kong. M

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with great services”
Reviews.Author: cmice
Reviews.Content: it was my second stays within 6 months. Love the location and the room. The room is medium size with everything that i am looking for, clean, cozy...therefore no complains. Housekeepers also did a very good jobs so that i can go right to shower or bed after a busy day. One thing i do hope is the hotel can provide free internet access in the future since it is a norm in the States.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: annakol
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the Langham. Our room was spacious, clean, and modern. It felt as though it had been recently updated, had all the amenities that I would want (including electric adaptors, which was really helpful and a fruitbowl that was refilled every day), ample closet space and a generously sized full bathroom. The hotel was clean and modern, the staff helpful and efficient. We the breakfast buffet twice and enjoyed the mix of Western and Chinese options. We also ate at T'and Court located in the hotel. The food was delicious and our waitress, Joey, was helpful and gracious; dinner was lovely. The location right next to the subway made it really easy to navigate our way around Hong Kong. Would stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excuisite Langham”
Reviews.Author: SoulSisterLondon
Reviews.Content: One of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in - incredible service, great location next to Harbour city mall and Star Ferry pier and beautiful rooms! I stayed in a renovate delux room so the regular rooms might be a bit more modest. The Langham is pricey though, and I felt I was completely ripped off on the extras, such as wifi for 400 HKK. Looking back I would have preferred to stay in Hong Kong island instead, which feels a bit more authentic and real vs. the glossy and tourist-packed Tsim Tsa Shui.

Reviews.Title: “Langham does it right!!”
Reviews.Author: kyshel
Reviews.Content: We checked in thru the Club L late evening. We had superior service from the moment we arrived at the door to our departure. Even the doorman was memorable! Club L staff had it all going--beverages, food galore (every breakfast, tea time, cocktail hours--counters were loaded with goodies!!) It was almost dangerous to NOT want to leave the hotel! I don't understand the comment about location--it's only a few blocks to Star Ferry and subway?? There is an airport express bus stop right at the hotel, as well. The Harbour City Mall is 3 blocks away. hmmm, maybe that reviewer was map-challenged and went the wrong way? The room was elegant (Grand Langham) no view--street side only, but great bath and shower and that BED!! Oooooooh, comfy! We were just wowed by details and if our jet lag had been cured sooner, we might have enjoyed ourselves more!! (was that possible?) We did get a bit rowdy in the Club and it was the fault of the bubbly, which they generously pour most of the time--sparkling daily and champers evening. No lack of food (oops already mentioned) and ease to access transport and sightseeing. I would go back in a heartbeat, but I have fallen in Love with Langham Place, which was our next stay, so I may have to divorce the Langham when I retunr to Hong Kong. Keep it--highly recommended hotel. We travel the world as airline people, and it is in our TOP 20. Thanks to the staff and management!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, top notch service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is excellent. From the moment we entered the hotel exhausted from our long flight, the service was just excellent. Quick and very polite check in procedure by Vanesssa. Despite how busy they are, the Concierge was very knowldegable and helpful, especially Allen. We sttayed at the Grand Langham Room, which was spacious and had a very nice grand bathroom with nice marble decor, separete shower and bath tub. Ammenities were good. In my opinion the rooms need a second lift up. Although they have been refurbushed a few years ago there are small details that stick out as older than rest of the room. This howerver, by no means is an issue at all for the quality and comfort of the 5 star room. Live entertainment at the lobby until 23:30. Location of the hotel is to die for. Right on Peking road across the street from a range of luxury stores and a 2 minute walk to the giagantic Harbor City (5 interconnected malls) as well as the star ferry. Lots of eating options ranging from Starbucks to gourmet restraunts inside the mall. Go to the patio area around sunset and have a few drinks, it was great. MTR stop is also literally right under the hotel, entrance from Galleria Mall. The health club of the hotel is also in need of enlargement and renovation. Right now it is too small and needs worn down. Overall, pay the extra an stay at this hotel, as it will make a difference and increase the quality of your stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: bonacello
Reviews.Content: Service is dropped, Front Office staff are not all friendly, lack of training , apparently. Management is not warm, lack of sincereity. Not a honest group. Location is bad, you have to walk 20 min to both ferry or MTR, if you think how small it is of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SabonaT
Reviews.Content: The whole stay was disappointing. The rooms need a serious renovation, and front desk and management does not really care.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: EarlRosebery
Reviews.Content: Can,t be beat for style, service, location. If you are on a budget try the Salisbury next door but book well in advance. If you have money to burn you coud go to the Peninsula but the Langham is as good.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Cheezypuf
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four stopping over on the way home to Ireland from New Zealand. The Langham made a very comfortable home for us during our three days in Hong Kong. We paid extra for access to the Langham Club. This is a sort of lounge. Drinks and snacks are free and it provides a very comfortable place in which to meet up, take a drink, etc. Breakfast is served here and it’s very extensive and of a high quality. The evening canapés and champagne are also very welcome after tiring yourself out seeing the sights. The rooms were large and exceptionally well appointed. We had a massive bed that was one of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. The bathroom was like a marble palace with more goodies than I’ve ever seen before: I’ve never been provided with branded talcum powder and loofah in a hotel before. The location is very good too. It’s a short walk to the subway. It’s also a short walk to the waterfront where the Star Ferries base themselves and from where you can watch the evening light show – we found it slightly entertaining. The fact that the airport shuttle leaves you to the door is a big plus too. In summary: the Langham is quite expensive, but it offers decadent luxury. If you can afford it splash out and buy access the the Langham club too.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Christmas Eve to New Years Eve and loved every minute of our stay. Our room was on the 12th floor and though the street it overlooked was a busy one we had no problems with noise (and I am a light sleeper). The room was spotless and really spacious (we had a deluxe double) . The bathroom was spacious and had a separate bath and shower . There is a kettle in the room so you can make a cup of tea when you feel like it without leaving the room. The staff were really helpful and I really loved our stay here. We did not eat at the restaurant but we did at at their sister restaurant at Langham place and if that was anything to go by I am sure their Chinese restaurant is fantastic. The location is amazing with shops and restaurants within a 1 minute walk. The starferry was 5 minutes away and there is a subway station within 5 minutes walk. This hotel was not cheap but I felt happy that it was money well spent and a great place to spend our Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location but...”
Reviews.Author: marcho
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights just before Xmas 2010. We only have two points to make about the hotel 1. The room air conditioning unit was quite noisy, don't think it was a problem with the unit jus the type of unit which we have had occasionally in other hotels. 2. It is totally unreasonable to have to pay for internet access now a days in any hotel. OK they do offer 30 minutes free use of the Business center a day but even that isn't cumulative, use 15 minutes and that's your session for the day! WiFi should be free to residents at ALL hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Elegance!”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspector006
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel, Hong Kong is by far the best hotel we've stayed in to date. From the moment we checked in (presented with a signature pink rose! and shown to our room) staff were exceptional - professional and friendly - including everyone from cleaning staff to the managers. This was our third trip to Hong Kong and the first stay at The Langham. We stayed for 7 nights in a Grand Room including breakfast. The room was a great size and the bed was lovely and big, and comfortable (this isn't always the case and we have previously found beds in Asia to be on the firm side). We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning in L'Eclipse restaurant, which easily set us up for a day sightseeing and shopping. We also had the evening buffet in this restaurant, as well as two other delicious meals in The Bostonion and The Main Street Deli. We would highly recommend the afternoon Tiffin Tea in the Palm Lounge which, in our opinion surpasses the experience at The Peninsular. They also do a fantastic hot chocolate here. Overall, we would say that this hotel is excellent and definitely deserves five stars. We will certainly stay here again when we return to Hong Kong. To remind us of our great stay, we made sure we purchased the signature room fragrance to bring home!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: florayuen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room with a touch of victorian style (almost everything was in pink!). This hotel's got class, elegance and totally lived up to its standards. The front desk and housekeeping staff were helpful and friendly. Didn't try their f&b outlets but I've heard they serve fabulous breakfast. Only downside was that most of their rooms do not have a handheld shower which I normally prefer, and I had to request for a handicapped room. Oh and they have a nice little souvenir shop just at the lobby with all the pinkish stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, room design the best out there, great staff but very noisey”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDown
Reviews.Content: staff very happy to help and know their stuff, breakfast was pricy but good, the hotel theme is well thought through and finished to a very high standard. The quality of the hotel cannot be questioned and for tea lovers a pot was also in the room for brewing tea. This would have been a fantastic hotel if it were not for the noise that disturbed our sleep. We were in room 808 from 4-8 Jan and although we loved the hotel, the room and the staff it was the noise from the idling buses that let it down, perhaps a higher floor would help.

Reviews.Title: “surprise...”
Reviews.Author: topofthetop
Reviews.Content: for a night-stop, but surprisingly good, better than the Mongkok Langham in my view. Location just behind Heritage , perfect. The sleep quality perfect , guess because I asked for a very quiet room , not a nice view but since arrived mignight , no problem for me. This was not for honeymoon view , more for the stop-and go-event for just a good sleep. The breakfast, compliment , all you need and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “A truly perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: JY_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: First impressions are very important in every part of the trip but this one has made my trip in Hong Kong extra memorable. Even from check-in, I was amazed at the staff's professionalism and courtesy. It feels like each hotel staff has had years of experience in the hospitality industry adhering to rigorous training to adhere to high standards and are a very carefully hand picked cream of the crop group. Staff are all multilingual in Chinese and English and from looking at their pins on their suits, some are even fluent in Japanese and German. The check in process doesn't just end in the lobby. In fact, the staff escort you up to your room and show you all the amenities in the hotel room. My room was a bit on the smaller side but everything else made up for it. FYI, the decor and amenities are very pink and slightly on the feminine side.For those people with olfactory sensitivity, do note that there is a signature hotel fragrance in the air. It seems to be the trend in the last few years at the big hotels. Luckily, this one is subtle and pleasing. I did not dine at the hotel but there are top notch restaurants on site. In addition, excellent public transportation as it is situated right next to the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place to stay in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Alverda3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and had a good experience. Only glitch was the smoking room that we were put in on our first night. I didn't specify that I wanted a non-smoking room and since the hotel was completely full, the staff said they would find us a different room once people checked out in the morning. We were given a new room first thing in the morning. Service was quite good at the hotel and we found everyone to be quite friendly and accomodating. Our room was about as small of a room as I would want to stay in, but it was fine. My husband and I did not bump into each other or anything like that. I think rooms in Hong Kong are generally smaller than ones you find in the states. The bed was quite comfortable as were the pillows and the room was soundproof. We loved the location for convenience to the Starr Ferry - only a few blocks away. My advice when booking is to make sure you specify smoking or non-smoking. And if you need a ride to the airport and do NOT want limo service, make sure the concierge understands that you would like to take their shuttle or a taxi. I think they automatically assume you want a private car. The hotel is also close to the Harbour City shopping center. On Level 3 of the Gateway Arcade is a great Chinese restaurant called Crystsal Jade. We ate there several times because it was very good, convenient to our hotel, and the prices were quite reasonable. I highly recommend it. It can be crowded, but turnover seems to be quick. Overall I give this hotel high marks for quality, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chat2lynz
Reviews.Content: Great location beside everything and extremely clean and modern. Staff were very friendly, rooms very spacious and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Langham”
Reviews.Author: Marie890
Reviews.Content: 5* luxury; perfect location, great attention to every detail and the best hotel bathroom I've ever seen!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rajeswari
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip to Hong Kong, basically to visit the Disney Land on my elder daughter's b'day. I first booked the The Disney's Hollywood hotel as it would be convenient for our visit to Disney Land. But as I read the Tripadvisor's reviews again, I found out that the 4* hotel and the 5* hotel nearby didn't have any room service. As we were travelling with a toddler also, we had a real need for a kettle in the room or somebody to serve us hot water for making bottle milk for my daughter. But the to my surprise the hotel did not have any tea and coffee making facilities also in the room. We definitely could not be in a hotel which neither had room service, nor any tea and coffee making facilities inside the room. The hotel was also far away from the city. As we are vegetarians, we also got worried about the availability of food. So we had to cancel that booking. Then I found this hotel in the heart of the city, with all the facilities and access to lots of Indian restaurants nearby, which served Indian vegetarian food. It also had tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and a room service on the cards. What I loved the most, was the hotels website has menus of all the restaurants in the hotel. By checking them out I found out that the restaurants had a number of vegetarian choices on their lists. By just a few dollars more than the previous booked hotel, we could book this 5* hotel online. We booked a deluxe room. When we reached the hotel the warm and friendly staff welcomed us. We were also given an upgrade to a Grand Room. The room was very neat and tidy. Luxurious bed and clean toilet. My elder daughter was excited to find a bathrobe and slippers of her size. The smell of the toiletries was lovely. Best part of the stay was that all the three nights, after coming to the room tired, we didn't have to go out and search for a hotel outside. We ordered room service every night and children enjoyed the food. Also to our pleasant surprise, we found that there was an Indian vegetarian dish also on the room service list, which we found out was quite tasty. The b'fast too had a wide selection of dishes we could taste. Though the price was a bit on the upside, as we had to pay 160 HKD for our elder daughter who only had a croissant for b'fast. We had planned to visit the Disney Land on the first full day of our stay, as it was our daughter's b'day too. But the weather prediction card kept in our room ( I haven't seen such things in any other hotel I have stayed) said it will be rainy. We were about to drop our plan to visit Disney Land that day, but with the encouragement from the hotel staff we went there on that day itself. And luckily it didn't rain and we had good time. Overall I can say, the hotel is excellent and we had a nice stay. Only downside is that though the hotel is very near to the harbor, there is no view from most of the rooms. But as we were in the hotel only to take rest, we didn't bother much about the view. The hotel staff booked the Big Bus tour for us the next day and guided us to the ferry terminal, which was only 5 mins walk from the hotel. The hotel is situated in midst of shops with best brands in the world. It could be a brand shopper's paradise. Great hotel, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, great service!”
Reviews.Author: ArunkumarG
Reviews.Content: Before booking, we were a bit confused between Langham and Marco Polo HK as Marco Polo offered us a free breakfast + internet connection while Langham didn't offer either. We still went to Langham because it received good reviews from many others and we were so happy with our decision later. The service was absolutely delightful. They run a very efficient Concierge service so you can leave your Lonely planet or Frommer's guide at home. I had to call their emergency service at 1 o'clock in the morning and a manager arrived within minutes to our room taking care of what was needed. We felt really at home and will definitely go back to the same place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a New Zealand stop over in November, 2010 for 2 nights and we found it to be an excellent hotel. It's very well located - we took the airport train down to Kowloon and then got on the free shuttle bus that drops you over at the hotel's door. Everything about the stay was excellent from check-in through to the room itself and the public areas in the hotel.
