We didn't dine in the hotel but we did have a few drinks in the hotel bar where service was excellent and we also had breakfast in the hotel which is one thing that I'd particularly call out - this hotel has one of the best breakfast buffets that I've seen in any hotel anywhere. Amazing array of fresh food and excellent service - truly fantastic. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a Hong Kong hotel in this district.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding quality and service”
Reviews.Author: MrMarkCardiffUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40th Birthday and can honestly say this is the finest hotel I have ever visited. Location just off Canton Road is ideal both for shopping and for access to Tsim Sha Tsui promendade and Avenue of the Stars which was 5 mins walk away. MTR station a few mins walk away too, cabs plentiful and good value for money. Star Ferry terminal to HK island also 5 mins away and ridiculously cheap and a great way to travel across the harbour. Get yourself an Octopus Travel Card (HK equivalent of an Oyster Card) at the airport and travelling around on MTR, buses & ferry and access to attractions like the Peak Tram etc cheaper, easier and quicker. Travelled in on the Airport Express Fast Rail Link (15mins, £8) and then got a cab (a fiver and 5 mins) from Kowloon Station straight into the undercroft of the hotel to be met by the doormen. The fantastic service started there and continued uninterrupted until we left 4 days later. I highly recommend the Club package which gets you access to the private lounge, private check-in/ check-out, breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails & canapes. The staff in there were every bit as wonderful as those in the rest of the hotel - I even had a birthday cake sent to my room unprompted by myself or my girlfriend. Food in the restaurants was excellent and varied, if a little pricey but to be fair that's to be expected in a 5-star Hong Kong hotel. We stayed in Deluxe room which was well equiped, spacious and kept spotlessly clean and was perfect as a sight seeing base. It might have lacked a harbour view but that was no real downside in our opinion, and the price you pay elsewhere for that view is hefty. I heartily recommend this place, location is excellent, staff and service are wonderful and although it was not cheap I felt is was relatively good value for money. Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: JJ25
Reviews.Content: Just had a 3 night stay at this hotel. We got a good deal from booking.com, which saved us several hundred pound on the printed hotel prices. It's an excellent base to catch the ferries across to Hong Kong and is close to MTR stations so you can explore the area. We loved the temple street night market and the little places to eat along the street. The roof top pool is a great bonus. We didn't eat in the hotel, but the restaurant looks lovely. When we return to Hong Kong we will return to the Langham. Staff are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Charmed”
Reviews.Author: CALHL
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter were charmed, having been greated by Langham's Mr. Jonathan, upon arrival with pink roses and taken straight to our room minus the usual check in requirement, a pleasant experience which let us have time to "rush" to the avenue of stars by 8pm in time for the lighshow, which we thought we will definitely miss since we arrived at the hotel at 7+pm. The promenade is a short stroll from the hotel, - opposite the hotel is channel, a short walk to the right, is harbour city mall, another left and right turn takes you up to the star ferry, barely 5 minutes away. Fantastic location, good buffet breakfast and excellent service, though the toilet was on small side. Highly recommended. Thanks again Jonathan, you have indeed made our day ! We did have a great dinner at Peking Garden at Star House recommended by you, the kids indeed had a great experience breaking the clay wrap on the beggar's chicken, with free commemorative picture and "gold hammer" souvenir for it. Oh, there is also a 1/2 hour complimentary internet usage at the business centre per day.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sorrento70
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Langham Hotel. It was amazing. This hotel is 5 star all the way. The staff, the rooms, the location = A+. We absolutely loved the Main St Deli, what a great concept and the food is YUM. A stand out for us was Paul at the concierge desk he can arrange anything you need and it's all done with a smile, it leaves the service in Australia for dead. This hotel lives up to all the fabulous reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !! Loved it !! Loved it !! splurge and stay”
Reviews.Author: janefromcairns
Reviews.Content: very luxe hotel , great location , lovely rooms , bathrooms everything you would expect from luxury hotel , we stayed for 2 nights on way back from China for some luxe accom , very nice , great service , our flight was at midnight howevere we shopped then returned and used the roof top fitness centre for shower & rest .. very nice .. try and get good deal and stay here .. you deserve it :)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: triss84
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very spacious, we stayed at 4th floor, the lobby is beautiful with fresh flowers of purple and pink colours. Staff was very helpful including the front desk and Concierge. The hotel has a very nice ginger flower smell throughout the whole hotel, they have a souvenir shop which is worth checking. I bought a bottle of the room spray which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional experience at The Langham Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelindaB_10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have just returned from Hong Kong staying 7 nights at The Langham Hotel. What a treat!! The hotel was absolutely fantastic and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. We paid an additional fee to enjoy the Langham Club Lounge located on the 11th floor. It was the only way to go. The staff were outstanding, incredibly friendly and very obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. You could check in on that floor and breakfast, afternoon tea and evening canapes were part of the deal. It was incredible value for money and difficult to extract ourselves from. Rooms were extremely clean and well serviced. Attention to detail was obvious. The concierge staff were always on hand to answer our questions and even helped my girlfriend by collecting a coat from Zaras in Sha Tin. Everything was exemplary and the hotel foyer had the most incredible sweet smell, the flowers were stunning. Location excellent located not far from Harbour City and 5 minute walk from Nathan Road. I would highly recommend this hotel in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel in a five star location”
Reviews.Author: CPKOhio
Reviews.Content: The Langham on Peking is a fantastic location. It is located within the upscale shopping district, walking distance to many outdoor markets of old Hong Kong and close to the Bay. You cannot go wrong. The finishes and materials used within the room are first class all the way and what one would expect at a five star hote.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham is great”
Reviews.Author: ednib
Reviews.Content: The Langham in Kowloon is a great hotel. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are spacious and the food in excellent. I highly recommend the Langham!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located and expertly executed”
Reviews.Author: Project25
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a real hidden gem. Squeezed between a DFS shopping mall and an office block, the grey frontage gives little away. It is only upon venturing deep into the thick concrete facade that the extent of this hotel becomes apparant. From the opulent foyer with dripping chandeliers and perpetual live piano playing to the lavish dining rooms and high spec bedrooms, this hotel has everything to recommend itself to the guest with high expectations. Staff are highly attentive (be prepared for a 15 minute walk through your room specifications - even if you say no) and well trained, service is also exceptionally speedy for a hotel of its size. The Langham was always busy, with large parties, including one consisting of around 100 models staying on assigment (walking through them in the lobby was devastating) but never overly noisy. The rooms are well thought through if not as lavish as the reception rooms, but the beds are wonderfully large and luxurious. Being lodged between Nathan and Canton roads, the location is ideal for shoppers and sightseers alike, the TST MTR being reached via the connectde underpass. Breakfast are a little pricey at over $240HK but you dont have to eat in the restaurant, there being so many great dim sum restaurants nearby. We would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkpeonie
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Langham for 4 nights in November it is definitely one of the best and most comfortable hotels. On arrival check in was a little slow. Even though we were 2 hours before the 3pm check in time and therefore our room was not ready, we were offered a free drink and nibbles at the bar. We arrived back to the hotel at 5pm to find that our bags were still at the concierge desk. Not a big deal but just something i think that should have been a little more organised. The room was very large for Hong Kong and very clean. Also included a bath.Our room was located on the 14th floor and very very quiet. The concierge at the Langham were fantastic!!!! They were so helpful and knew everything and more of what we asked. I was so impressed! The gym is also fantastic. 2 floors, plenty of equipment and tvs as well to keep you entertained while exercising (great if you are on business) My boyfriend and i also looked at staying at the Langham Place, but thought that the location sounded better for the Langham. We decided to walk to the Langham Place one day and it took about a half hour. It was located a long way from the main part of town and the ferry to the main island. The hotel did look lovely and was connected to a shopping mall, but was definitely far from everywhere! The Langham is so close to some great shops, restaurants and also the ferry terminal to the main island (about a 5 min walk) I would have no problems recommending the Langham, i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a crazy city”
Reviews.Author: walkingheels
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely lovely hotel in the heart of a bustling TST and literally at the doorstep of any designer / high street boutique you want. One can just walk along Peking Road and not need to go anywhere else, especially with Harbour City mall just across the road. Thumbs up for location. The hotel itself, is beautiful - we paid extra for an upgrade to the Club Floor, which is great if you want to keep your spouse occupied when you go shopping. The Club Floor comes with Breakfast, Tea and pre-dinner cocktails (with free flow of champagne and other spirits). Another thumbs up for service and amenities. The Club rooms are decent in size with a luxurious feel. Classic English feel and cosy. Walk in to the hotel and you leave the hustle and hustle of Kowloon behind. Great for couples looking for a retreat in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Shop till you Drop”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_Allison
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in Hong Kong and wanted to make our trip special so decided to stay at the Langham Hotel. The hotel is brilliant. The staff are excellent and there is nothing that is too hard for them. We tried to get out as much as we could, however when we did eat at the hotel the food was great. On one occasion, when the grill restaurant was fully booked they allowed us to eat in the cocktail lounge but ordering from the grill menu. We upgraded to the Club Lounge, which was the best thing we did. It really makes a difference when you are out all day to be able to come to the lounge, have a drink and something to eat, and revive for the evening. The staff at the club lounge are lovely, and in particular Jonathon, who every morning greeted us by name and always had a smile on his face. The pool area was nice, i did expect it to be larger, but it was never packed so it did not matter. The rooms were clean. If in Hong Kong again, i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the big city”
Reviews.Author: saschlet
Reviews.Content: We stopped over for 2 nights and we almost didn't want to leave the room. Great facilities (including club lounge with afternoon tea, cocktails and canapes), such helpful staff and a fab location. I would definintely stay at this hotel again, even if it is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxurious & Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MegYap
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at the Langham Hotel, HK last year 2009. I tagged along since he had a business conference - so I had the room all to myself. The room was just right (size) but everything in the room was just luxurious! The sheets, carpet, bathroom, daily toiletries were really nice. We had a big LCD/flat screen TV on the wall. Bathrobes were really really big, though and so heavy. But very comfy cotton material =) Checking-in was a bit slow, but we met some Filipinos at the Reception and found our conversations with them warm and enjoyable. I find HK Chinese hospitality/ personality less homey and less charming. Location wise, the hotel was at the high-end part of HK so restaurants and shopping areas were mostly high-end. The nearest 7-11 was about a km (1) walk from the hotel. Food in the hotel is really expensive - but the servings and taste matched the value. The amenities - gym and pool was just amazing. I need not bring my towel and water since it was already provided in the area. Had a bit of laps and enjoyed the outside. Oh, I need to mention that their color motif is blush pink which I personally love =)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: Although check in was slow (I did get a free drink coupon though) and the room I had was pretty nice, even with a partial view of the harbour from my window, the kicker are the "other costs" but it's Hong Kong, and the Langham one of the higher starred hotels, so it goes with the turf you are staying on. The room cost (which included breakfast, not sure what that was worth) was pretty good $255USD for when I stayed and it was a good size room, but the bathroom was a bit tight. Internet was extra ($20USD a day) and the dinner buffet was in the neighbohood of $85USD per person, but I did have a Sprite in there too and I cant' say it was necessarily "worth it" but the food selection was outstanding and even with small portions and being a huge guy, I didn't come close to hitting everything available on their Saturday night buffet. Hotels in Hong Kong keep getting ridiculusly high priced and you keep gettng less and less everytime you travel there. So when you can find a rate aroudn the $250USD rate for a hotel like this and it includes a meal, it's a pretty good deal in my opinion. The location is OK, anywhere is OK if you take a taxi, but it's a short walk to the harbour, the mall and shops on Canton and to Nathan Road as you pass through the copy watch, copy handbags, and suit selling guys. But even those guys are getting less and less pushy for whatever reason, I wonder why? If I can get a decent rate, I'd stay again at the Langham. Attentive service, very clean, and OK location.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langham for 4 nights in October 2010. We had stayed at the Langham Place last year which we loved, but wanted to try something different this time. We generally like very modern hotels and we were a little skeptical of the more traditional Langham in Tsimshatsui, but boy were we not disappointed, the Langham in Tsimshatsui was AMAZING, just beautiful. The service was flawless in every part of the hotel. Location: the location of the hotel was fantastic. This trip we choose to explore Hong Kong Island more and the hotel was very convenient to the Star Ferry, plus it did not hurt having the Ocean Terminal across the road. Meals: Breakfast was not included in our package, but we did have the buffet on the last day, which was great. Fantastic selection and great service – I loved the pancake machine! We had drinks, snacks and dessert at the lobby bar, which was all delicious and the service was good. We had Dinner at the Tang Court one night and the service was wonderful and the food was excellent. We also had lunch at the New York Deli and that was good as well. Overall there was a large selection of restaurants to choose from in the hotel. Room: We stayed in the Grand Langham Room, which was just beautiful. I loved the shutter windows between the bathroom and the bedroom. The bath was a perfect size for two also. Staff: Housekeeping was just wonderful. We stayed in room 908 and our housekeeper took great care of us making sure our beds were turned down every night, that we had fresh towels and plenty of ice – fantastic attention to detail. The reception and concierge staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. We will definitely be returning to the Langham in Tsimshatsui we had such an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Don't hesitate - book now!”
Reviews.Author: WB1
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful 12 night stay with our family at The Langham in Hong Kong. We had a fantastic one bedroom suite, with access to The Langham Club and could not fault a thing. All the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and made our little girl very welcome. The Langham Club is worth every extra penny and we found it a restful place to visit for a drink or snack, check our emails and get recommendations for places to visit. The quality of the hotel throughout is excellent and, although more expensive than the Langham Place, we found it great value for money based on the quality of the hotel and its location. We tried all of the restaurants and they all served good food, with efficient, knowledgeable and friendly service. The location is great as you can walk easily to the Star Ferry without needing to use the subway, there is a direct connection to the DFS mall, and within seconds you could be in the Chanel boutique in Harbour City – shopoholics beware! Thanks very much, especially to Winnie, Christy, Michelle (our babysitter) and the staff on Langham Club level, for a brilliant stay! We are already looking forward to our return!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent......”
Reviews.Author: ChiFoodie32
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Langham (Peking Rd.) for 2 nights with my parents and sister. This is my second trip to HK and I have to rave about the wonderful service at this hotel. The entire staff was helpful with suggestions for local fare, shopping, booking transpotation etc.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: julieturnerlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an extended stopover on my way to the pacific. Lovely hotel with outstanding customer service. Each time we returned to the hotel you felt like you were being welcomed home. Love the decor and the attention to the small details, also loved the wandering magician in the lounge, I thought that was a lovely touch. We secured a good rate on tripadvisor and actually extended out stay here as we liked the hotel so much. Handy location as a base for exploring the Kowloon side of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: sunseekeraus
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in kowloon. Has exceptional staff, cleanliness, facilities, location etc etc Will definitely be saving to stay at Langham again in HK. 2 weeks was not enough. Thanks to all Langham staff, above and beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie_007
Reviews.Content: Although the service was impeccable and the room and lobby luxurious, I stopped short of giving this hotel a full five stars because it was packed full. However, you can get a great deal on this place if you book during one of their deals. In the end we really enjoyed our stay and I would recommend to a friend, I just like a little bit more intimacy at the hotel after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better service”
Reviews.Author: JenniferSAustralia
Reviews.Content: We don't travel much but when we do we stay in 5* hotels and we don't stay in any hotel more than 2-3 days. It gives us a chance to explore other hotels as well as other locations within the city which we have travelled to. So it is fair to say that we have stayed in lots of 5* hotels to be able to rate them well. The Langham Hotel in HK: WOW the moment you enter you are taken by how beautiful the lobby is. You get to the check in counter, no smile, pretty avarage greeting and they said to us our room wont be ready for the next 3-4 hrs so take a seat at the lobby! We were shocked. So not a great start at all. Service was pretty poor and the staff didn't speak english well. The water temp wasn't hot at all more like lukewarm. Great location tho. walking distance to the harbour, Cultural Centre and the Avenue of the stars. The great thing about this hotel wa its 24hr Gym and its location. Will I stay there again? hmmm for the price they charge per night? Not sure...

Reviews.Title: “The Langham”
Reviews.Author: mcdowesj
Reviews.Content: What can i say...it was just incredible. The staff everywhere are trained to the utmost standards, the food is out of this world, and the roof top pool and fitness centre could not be better. The room was immaculate and the service better.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel all round. Nice rooms and...”
Reviews.Author: Toomuchtravell
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel all round. Nice rooms and great customer service. Well located for everything. Would go again

Reviews.Title: “A+++”
Reviews.Author: akironman
Reviews.Content: We were in town for four days. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui, near the ocean terminal, star ferry, short walk to the bay to see the night scenery. located near many stores and restaurants. The service of the hotel lives up to the name. Everyone was very courteous, got a free upgrade when we checked in, lent us some umbrellas when it rained the first day. The hotel was extremely clean in all aspects. nuff said Booked the hotel about two months in advance, but the hotel price was very reasonable. I recommend directly contacting the hotel too and asking for the best available rate. The website though had the best rate after checking other outlets. The room was beautful, spaceous, and simply great. Fantastic amenities, very modern technology in the room, and everything you need for the stay. The only thing that was surprising was we were on the 16th floor, and the elevator only goes to the 15th floor...it was interesting at first but nothing that got in the way. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Langham- generally very good, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Drayster
Reviews.Content: The Langham is one of the well-established Kowloon-side luxury hotels (just up the street from the Peninsula, not to be confused as my guidebook did with Langham Place which is a sister hotel a few blocks north). The location is excellent, short walk to Star Ferry, public transport links good. The roof top swimming pool and fitness centre are very good. Staff are attentive etc. My only criticisms would be: (1) there is no concierge/ porter staff waiting to meet the shuttle which brings you from the Airport Express train [which is the quickest way in from the airport] to the hotel. I had to heft luggage up stairs with neither an elevator nor a porter there to help (2) there should be free wifi (3) the breakfasts are massively overpriced: not feeling like spending the equivalent of $100 on bk for myself and two children, I went out to McDonalds down the street. But if you can find this hotel at a good price it is a perfectly fine choice for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: filo_roll
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at on our hotel hopping adventure through HK and it was the best hotel we stayed at. I booked this hotel through Wotif and took the risk with the Mystery Deal and got the room for $AU161 per night. Check in was quick (well it was around midnight) and the porter took our luggage up to our room and gave us a tour of the room! The room was spacious for two people, the tv was flatscreen and of a reasonable size and there was heaps of cupboard space for clothes. The bathroom had a huge mirror and the shower is controlled by a thermostat. Housekeeping actually folded up our clothes on the bed and put things back in order. The bathroom was clean and you get a telephone next to the toilet just in case you need to make a call whilst on the loo. There are three phones in the room! In terms of its location it is in the ritzy area of TST near the luxury brand shops and Harbor City. It is also close to the ferry terminal to HK Island and also Macau. The airport express bus dropped us off near the driveway entry to the hotel so you don't have to walk back down the hill to Peking Rd, you can just walk up their driveway to enter the hotel. Our room was located on the inner side not facing the street so we had a good night's sleep and if you turn the air con up really high it creates white noise to block out the noise from the corridor. The rooftop pool is quite nice especially at 6am in the morning before the sun hits it directly overhead. We also ate at the New York Deli, which is a bit pricey for HK but the food was alright. I highly recommend this hotel and it made a pleasant start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TWS_10
Reviews.Content: Simply heaven. Services are top notch. Staffs are polite and very helpful. Paul from the concierge is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “one of the better hotels in tsim sha tsui area”
Reviews.Author: moodaa
Reviews.Content: we discovered langham hotel through TA and i'm glad we did. compared to the marco polo hotels in the area, this hotel was a treat - clean rooms, updated furniture, nice staff. also has great room service, good restaurants within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: NyonAdvisor10
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a wonderful experience. The accomodation was traditional and well maintained.Service was excellent. Breakfast was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug430
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong for a long weekend, and we chose the Langham Hotel, even though it was a bit pricier than some of the other hotels we found. We stayed in the Grand Room and was 100% happy with our stay. The room itself was spacious and so comfortable, and the service was top notch. More than anything, however, the location of this hotel is unbeatable. It's less than a 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry and also the MTR, so it's easy to get back and forth from Kowloon to the HK Island side. Nathan Road is also only a 5-10 minute walk away. The hotel is literally right across from Aqua Spirit, so if you want to go to a nice bar and enjoy the stunning skyline of Hong Kong (as well as the nightly lightshow!), this is the place to go! Peninsula Hotel is right around the corner as well if you want to try their afternoon high tea. The hotel also has T'ang Court, which received 2 Michelin stars. My husband and I had dim sum there and it was sooo delicious. The waiters were also so helpful and suggested a couple of dishes to order. This was our first time visiting Hong Kong, and we are so glad we made the decision to stay at this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Jewl of Asia”
Reviews.Author: Anish4ap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lanham Place for 5 nights as part of our first leg of our Honeymoon and it got off to a great staff. Location, if you love markets and hangling as my wife does, you will love this location. Once you enter this Hotel, you are greeted with very friendly staff who go out their way to make sure your experience at Lanham is a great one. Rooms are very clean and cleaned twice a day, attention to detail and the ambience of the lobby and dining areas is very fitting of a five star hotel. Did not check out the Spa which I thought was a little expensive and there are plenty of other option closeby the Langham shopping mall. Bar food is excellant and good value for money. Concierge are very helpful and know the area very well so if you have a planned trip around Hong Kong, its very good to speak to them first for any Tips. Overall, Brilliant Hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel or staying there again. For Value for Money, This is the best Hotel In Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early (6am) due to a flight change and we were given our room straight away which was really appreciated! Our room was on the 11th floor in the Langham Club. The room was great. It was clean, spacious, had a big TV, fridge, a huge wardrobe and the most comfortable bed ever! The bathroom was big - separate shower and bath. We also had a little kit in the bathroom containing everything that you could ever need/want - shower caps, cotton buds, sewing kit, shaving kit, tooth brushes, talcum powder, comb, nail file....... There was a turn-down service too, they always left a little card with the next days weather, put your slippers and a bottle of water next to your bed...... I had a great sleep every night, I was never disturbed and I found it a very quiet hotel. The staff were great, always very friendly - from the concierge who was so helpful in storing our bags to confirming tours, getting us taxis and giving us advice. The reception staff were so nice and the bellboys always opened our taxi door with a big smile and a "welcome to the langham hotel". When we left there were 3 members of staff showing us out, wishing us a great journey. This hotel always made you feel special. On the top foor there a gym, outdoor pool (small-ish), a jacuzzi and saunas. We showered and changed there on the evening that we left - staff helpful and changing rooms were spacious, clean and full of everything I needed! The lobby bar (palm court) was nice. Very relaxing and the staff were attentive. We ate in the NY deli in the hotel too, again staff great and food really nice. It wasbusy but I can see why! The lobby was very grand and it was spotless. The langham scent was also nice. We also used the business centre for the internet, it was a little expensive (70 HKD for 30 mins) but what do you expect in a hotel? I WILL stay here again and would recommned it to anyone, we made a good choice staying here! The hotel is very central, 5 mins to the star ferry, next to the TST MRT station and very close to the China Ferry Terminal and Ocean Terminal shops/restaurants. We got a taxi to the hotel when we arrved but when we left, we got the airport shuttle bus to Kowloon station. The bus stop is outside the hotel and they come ever 15 mins. The bus is free as long as you have an octoopus card/airport shuttle return ticket although the driver never asked to see them. It was 5 mins to the train station and we checked in our luggage there and then travelled into the airport on the train. You can check in 24hours-90 mins before departure. One way to the airport is 90 HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Vanessa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel from the moment we checked in. Hong Kong was part of our honeymoon trip and was the first place we flew too. The Langham provided a bottle of champange for our arrival to celebrate our honeymoon which was lovely. The staff were fantastic. The room was great except for the view but this was a very minor point. The situation of the hotel was perfect for access in terms of walking around the shops and harbour area. The breakfast buffet was the best we had seen in terms of choice and quality. The outdoor pool was very welcomed at the end of a busy day. Brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Graham2181
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at The Langham in June. Check in was fast and efficient and our room was quite spacious and spotless. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. It is in an excellent location being close to all forms of transport and quality shops. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marishcher
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Only the room is small and very expensive internet with low speed. Easily Shuttle airport-hotel, if not pre-ordered, you will need to pay 130 HKD.

Reviews.Title: “First of all, some of these reviews are misleading about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jackall123
Reviews.Content: This Hotel internet is expensive and has bad connection, will keep going offline all the time, i had no choice but to place a international call to finish my booking for my next destination, with I have to pay at check out and it was not cheap, Front desk were not too friendly but helpful anyway when asked for advise. Attitude was businesslike and no nonsense nor warmth! Generally, i think the location is what sells [close proximity to everything ]. Apart from this, nothing really stands out for this hotel; for a so call 5 star hotel, it was really a let down. I would say this hotel is no more than 4 stars. the hotel breakfast is a rip off, when I book this hotel it said that breakfast was incluted for kids under 12 years old but that never happen. Are there any hotels left that aren't catering to big groups? the hotel was packed with big groups of chinese, we wanted to try the breakfast but a big group of Chinese tourists stormed the dining room, and these people will eat the buffet so fast that there will be nothing left to eat, and this when on everyday. lobby was over crowded with unparented kids running around, very loud lobby with all this group tour people everyday, big lines to get to the front desk, no where to seat down in the lobby way to many people setting around. we were being woken up every morning about 6:30 am from noise from the room up stairs, like someone with high heels walking in the room. DOES THIS SOUNDS LIKE A 5 STAR HOTEL TO YOU? Anyway, We had a wonderful dinner at this hotel call the Harbour Grand Kowloon, is not in the center but the hotel have a bus to take you to the center, they have the best view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: dgold105
Reviews.Content: The position is good and the lobby and service are quite nice but the rooms are very small and very dated. Despite going for a larger room type we still found it very small. The pool is also small and the pool area again in need of renovation. Value-wise it isn't too bad so long as you know you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND SERVICE - EVERYTHING ABOUT THE PLACE WAS PERFECT.”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in HK we loved everything about it and the Langham capped off what was to be a very pleasant and most memorable stay. We caught the airport express into Kowloon, which takes about 20mins followed by a short bus transfer to your hotel. The train is safe, clean and easy to negotiate. Would recommend this to everyone as it's a good way to see the HK scenery before you get into the hustle and bustle of Kowloon and HK central. The return leg via the train station is also handy because you can check your bags in without having to go to the airport. You'll appreciate this when you see the long queues. It also frees your time up and allows you do other things before leaving HK without having to rush to the airport. The Langham itself is in the heart of Kowloon. Everything is within walking distance. Nathan Rd, the ferry terminal and the large shopping malls are only a 5min walk away, the MTR is across the road and the street markets are easily within walking distance if you want to take in some of the HK street life. Recommend this if this is your thing. My wife and I felt safe throughout. We were greeted by kind, friendly and helpful hotel staff. The entrance was clean and very elegant in appearance. The legendary and renowned Langham scent was ever present and very welcoming. Valerie at the front counter checked us in. She was friendly and helpful and provided us with an upgrade, without asking, from a deluxe room to a grand langham room. We were very appreciative of this kind gesture. The room was beautiful, spacious and clean. We had a large king size bed, 40inch TV, work desk and excellent lighting. Room service was twice daily, which came with complementary water and fresh fruit. There's a fridge with various food and drink in it - it's also large enough to put you own things in it . The bathroom was beautiful with it's marbled tiling. It had a separate bath and shower. You were able to open the shutters and watch TV whilst having a bath. The facilities were excellent. There's a complementary gym, outdoor pool and spa, shower facilities and sauna on the 15th floor. Again you're greeted by friendly and helpful hotel staff handing out clean fresh towels and water as you enter. We had breakfast at Hotel. The food was good and reasonably priced. We also had dinner one night at the NY deli, which is within the hotel building. Again the food was good and reasonably priced. Overall the Langham is an excellent hotel. The service and everything about it was perfect!! The room and facilities are excellent. The hotel staff are GENUINELY friendly and very helpful. I would recommend the Langham to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, the service, facilities and location were perfect”
Reviews.Author: ChipTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Langham with our two young children, it is a fantastic hotel, we booked two connecting rooms and really enjoyed the stay. The pool on the rooftop is great, especially for the kids after a long day of sightseeing. The staff were so accommodating, the rooms really luxurious and the restaurants/room service were delicious. The hotel is about 1 min from the metro station and also only a couple of minutes walk down to where the ferries leave - couldn't be a better location. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Langham is OK, but not value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Labrang66
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the Langham. Stayed on the Club floor. NOT worth the money. The "lounge" is a series of guest rooms that have been opened up into a lounge. Problem is its a rabbit warren of little rooms. Not comfortable and not a place that's very welcoming to sit down and enjoy a beer after a day of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service and location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Nev161
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on first visit to Hong Kong from the 26th -31st May. Found this hotel to be in a perfect location for what we wanted to do - 5 mins from Star Ferry, walking distance to China Ferry for Macau, very near MTR station and next door to major shops (Harbour City 700 shops). Would definately recommend upgrading to Club level, as this was money very well spent. The quality of food served at breakfast, afternoon tea and evening snacks was better than we have experienced with other major chains, and included free wi-fi. We had a Grand Langham Room which we could not fault. The staff were exceptionally welcoming and met our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Great TIme in Hong Kong at a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superman_lover
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Langham on 2nd May 2010, we stayed for 3 nights. The lobby is scented and smells absolutely gorgeous, we had a brief issue checking in however, once our rooms were ready the rest of the trip was awesome. The staff were eager to help at all times and tried their very best to be of assistance. We loved our rooms. There was the standard Ipod dock, HD Flat screen etc with the standard english speaking channels. The real plus point of the hotel is it's location, opposite the underground station and 10 minutes walk from the star ferry. Everyday we found it easier and easier to branch out further into hong kong, safe in the knowledge that we'd find it really easy to get back to the hotel. Who ever is reading this review and is thinking of booking a stay at the Langham, don't think- just book it. You wont regret it

Reviews.Title: “my first choice hotel for HK”
Reviews.Author: oggybags
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the large hotels in HK and this is my new favourite Great service and nice rooms, good breakfast buffet included - my main gripe that hey charge 150HKD for 24 hrs wifi - free at all the other hotels I stayed in during this trip and surely a must for business! Had a problem with my room on night 3 and was switched with eficiency and help from staff would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Osloboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central in Tsim Sha Tsui, close to MTR, Star ferry and KCR, so convenient. An excellent lobby with good atmosphere. The hotel has great restaurants. The fitness club and outdoor swimming pool on the roof is great, Rooms are large with great bathrooms and comfortable beds. Staff are generally courteous and service minded. The hotel can seem a little expensive, but is otherwise a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lowe10
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel. From the minute you walk into reception its so relaxing with a really fresh & fruity smell in the lobby. Check in was very smooth & i was even given a rose as a welcome! The staff were so friendly, couldnt do enough for you. They even give you a language card when you check in so if you need a taxi back to the hotel when your out then you can show then the card if they dont speak english! The rooms are fairly large, very clean, very large comfy bed with large comfy feathered pillows & duvet. The bathroom was also a really good size with good quality toiletries and large fluffy towels. The location was excellent, just 5 mins walk if that to the star ferry terminal. We didnt try any of the resteraunts in the hotel but they looked lovely. The pool was nice, really clean, fair size with a jacuzzi. I just cant find anything negative to say about the Langham at all, im very picky and always find problems with hotels!! But the Langham is perfect. well done to the Langham Hotel, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Quality, Style & Charm ...”
Reviews.Author: JS_Abroad
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and stay here 4 times a year for a min 10 days per business trip. From the delicate yet distinctive "Langham" scent which envelops you upon entering the grand foyer to the plush furnishings comprising of rich dark wood and lush fabric layers everywhere you turn, this is a hotel with all the modern conveniences yet successfully replicates Old World Charm. Subtle lighting, incredible down pillows and duvet's, super fast internet with staff trained in the art of service I can honestly say that I am yet to have a negative experience in this hotel - it has become a home away from home when in Hong Kong. I look forward to enjoying The Langham experience in other parts of the world....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. A 5 star hotel throughout. Service and rooms are impeccable. The only negative thing I have to say is the in room dining meals are on the sparce side. Other then that Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, sheer luxury everywhere with really great food”
Reviews.Author: Londonkids
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best luxury hotels we have ever been to. The service was amazing, the room and all the common areas were immaculate. The food from breakfast to dinner in the restaurant was amazing. The concierge service was incredibly helpful. The roof top swimming pool was a real bonus

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Smells Aamazing!”
Reviews.Author: sfdgsdf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a fantastic time. The staff are knowledgable and friendly and speak great English. The hotel is in a great location, there is also a great choice of restaurants within the hotel itself - the Main Street Deli within the hotel is definitely worth a visit. The pool area is lovely and the gym is well equipped. Rooms are excellent and you can get a really good nights sleep here! The hotel lobby smells amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Langham”
Reviews.Author: dezwart
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Langham for four nights and had the most wonderful time there. The hotel is very elegant and situated within a short walking distance to the Star Ferry and other attractions, including the many shopping malls and designer shops if you fancy a bit of retail therapy. We had a reasonable sized bedroom with a huge bed and really nice furniture. The bathroom was a good size and you wanted for nothing regarding toiletries. The hotel has a swimming pool which we didn't get to use but it is good to have that option, along with use of the well equipped fitness centre. Another added bonus was opting for the Club Lounge access. We enjoyed a lovely hot and cold buffet breakfast in very pleasant surroundings each morning , along with a delightful afternoon tea which we certainly looked forward to if we had been out for the day. Also in the evenings drinks and a buffet of hot and cold nibbles were served which really was absolutely wonderful - all with waiter/waitress service. It certainly made our stay more than we could have wished for.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mandymoo32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a stopover to Australia. The hotel is lovely, the smell when you walk through the doors just hits you, it's so unique and is lovely to get away from the hong kong street smell (if you've been, you'll know what I mean). The room was beautiful, had everything you could possibly need.. the toiletries etc are really nicely packaged. The breakfast was 'ok'.. we stayed at shangri-la singapore before and were kind of expecting something similar at The Langham, but no such luck! Hong Kong is an amazing place, there is so much to see and do. We went up to the Giant Budha at Po-Lin monastry and this was a good day out, the cable car ride up through the hills is breath-taking, we paid extra for the 'crystal' cabin and it was well worth it. We had dinner at the 2* restaurant at The Langham one night, but if I'm being honest ... we weren't impressed. We have dined at many 1* restaurants, which were in my opinion far better quality, maybe we just ordered the wrong things but at a 2* restaurant, and at those prices, you would expect everything to be outstanding! (try Talk of the Town restaurant in the Excelsior hotel... it was fantastic). Overall, a top quality hotel and if we ever return to HK, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Barbiebunny
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel to the day i left all i can say is this was absolute luxury. The staff were very polite and helpful at all times. The room was so clean and the bed was so comfortable. If it hadnt been for a work trip i would have slept in the bed all day. I think arriving home and finding my duvet turned down with slippers at the edge so cute! The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels regularly. Felt like i was treated like royalty! Hong Kong people are very polite and i cant fault anything on this hotel. We were lucky to have our first day off so went and lay by the pool which was lovely! The gym was nice and quiet so i managed to get on all of the machines. We only ate the food for breakfast and it was lovely although i was ill most of the trip i only got to try this on my first day. My colleagues loved the food. Have to say even though i was ill it was a nice hotel to come back to and rest! LOcation was perfect to get to the harbour for ferry to Hong Kong side and if you have time there are some lovely shops nearby. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Entire stay was perfect at this beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMC42
Reviews.Content: We spent eight days at the Langham Hotel and every aspect of our stay was delightful. The ginger flower fragrance that greets you as you enter the fantastic lobby,the check in was swift and professional,all the staff were smiling and so friendly,food was fantastic and the housekeeping staff efficient and obliging.We will certainly stay at the Langham whenever we visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “not up to my expectation”
Reviews.Author: bishay
Reviews.Content: I staid at that hotel for 11 nights cause i had my mum with me and we wanted to take it easy . from the first hour i was upset i arrived to the club lounge and it was after 2 afternnon and the kept us waiting for almost 2 hours cause the room wasn't ready even i called before i arrived and assured the arrival time at the end i got really upset then i think the head of the lounge i think the manger she came to ask what is the problem she got us to the room finally . after couple of days i got a new laptop i wanted to hook on line i couldn't i thought i am the stupid one but i find out they are the once got the problem cause they sent someone to set the internet and had the same problem anyway finally worked after another couple of nights i find the turn down service didn't take place then i complained and i got a phone call from the club lounge telling me that the room services told them that my mum told them not to come in the room when i was already out then they say sorry and one night after send us wine and a apology letter and they did the services nicely for another two days with extra mineral waters but after they got the same no one came to the room afternoon that wasn't at all when i checked in i told them i will pay in $ and when i was checking out i found out that they rate the $ for 7.25 which they took almost 200 $ extra and i had no time to go and exchange at any bank plus after they calculate in $ they needed around 30 cents and insisted on them that was really cheap the food there was okay the room not up to 5 stars stander the breakfast at the lounge was poor if compare to any other 5 stars hotels maybe guys there said wows and hahhhahs for that hotel they didn't try better plus that work in front of the hotel really distributing cause going up and down the in the subway stairs i got no problem but for elder people u can imagine

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 night location”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays_1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langham for our 3 nights of our honeymoon. We loved the hotel. It was just the right amount of 'luxury' that we were after for the price, was in a great location, the service was excellent. We got a great deal through Hotels.com and got upgraded when we were there. A lovely hotel which made a lovely start to a lovely honeymoon...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: AmershamAnne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on the way home from New Zealand. Excellent shuttle bus transport to the hotel following our early morning arrival and fortunate that our room was ready. We had a Grand room which was simply stunning, beautifully decorated with huge bed, quality furniture and furnishings, lovely marble bathroom and separate shower with luxurious toiletries. The main lobby of the hotel is beautiful with chandeliers, a plush lounge area and a fresh floral smell throughout. We ate in the buffet restaurant on the ground floor which served quite simply the best breakfast and dinner buffets we have had hotels of a similar category. The staff were superb and very attentive. Enjoyed the roof top swimming pool and spa and booked a massage which was brilliant. Highly recommended. We had an early flight home and booked a taxi. Tea/coffee and muffins were served in the lobby at no charge, a nice touch for guests leaving early and missing breakfast. If you want to stay in Hong Kong in the middle of all the action in superb comfort and luxury you would be hard pressed to find anything better at such a good price. There are not many 5 star hotels in GB which would be as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel inside”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: One of the only hotels that I can say that smells great when you walk through the doors. The rooms are clean fresh and bright, the service excellent and the executive level club room is fantastic. Try the sausage rolls in the club level if you get the chance they are quite frankly gorgeous. A special thanks to Ching Xie (club level reception) who made my stay perfect and really excelled at customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Resist Falling in Love with...”
Reviews.Author: LilyBKK
Reviews.Content: I and my boyfriend stayed in the classic room on 14th fl. for 3 nights. The room may not look as modern as the deluxe one, but it truly gave us a feeling of the hotel in an old-day Hong Kong - classic and enchanting. We loved our room very much and were very happy we chose to stay at the Langham Hotel Hong Kong. Beside the room we were happy with, the hotel is located in one of the locations we love most in Hong Kong. Just crossing a street, we could conveniently arrive Harbour City (harbourcity.com.hk). During the day while my boyfriend was away for his meetings, I would enjoy doing shopping around and easily coming back to take rest at the room if I wanted to. MTR entrance is also just a couple of minutes away at the underground floor of iSquare (isquare.hk). Varieties of restaurants are there in both malls. What impressed us most during our stay was my boyfriend's birthday cake the hotel secretly arranged in our room to surprise us. And yes, we felt very pleased and surprised. Thank you very much. I feel what makes the Langham Hotel Hong Kong differs from others in the same or even higher stars is its soul. Everything seemed just right and little imperfection it might have could be magically covered up with its aromatic fragrant all over the hotel... Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: shazzbrisbane
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews on 5 star hotels in HK before settling on The Langham and were not disappointed. The smell in the lobby has to be experienced to be believed. We felt like we were coming home every day when we walked away from the hussle and bustle into the beautiful scent and luxury. The bed is amazingly comfortable and the decor of the room was pure class.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that has got it right”
Reviews.Author: LexiQueensland
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Langham for 5 nights during Chinese New Year, an event everyone should do at least once in a life - it was absolutely amazing and we felt rather privileged to be there for the celebrations. However, what really made our trip was the Langham Hotel -- from the moment we entered their grand foyer we were made to feel welcome. The staff are wonderfully courteous and efficient. Our room was a great size immaculate and extremely comfortable. We had pre-booked the Langham Club which was an added bonus as it felt like you belonged to a very exclusive club. The breakfast and daily snacks including canapes in the evening were most generous and delicious. They actually describe their breakfast as "continental" but in actual fact they also provide a cooked breakfast as well. We will certainly be returning not only to Hong Kong but also to the Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: tulip4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for 5 nights. We paid for a Grand Langham room which included access to the Club Lounge on the 11th floor. It was definately worth it! We arrived at 11am & were greeted by reception who escorted us to the Club Lounge to check in. We were offered drinks at the same time we were checking in & best of all our room was ready for us, several hours earlier than check in! The concierge then showed us to our room & explained how everything worked. The room was spacious & tastefully decorated. The bathroom was also spacious & the room was topped up with amenities twice daily. The hotel supplies bottled water for the room & a fruit bowl which is a really nice touch. The staff in the Club Lounge are fantastic. They are very polite & attentive & are able to offer advise on tourist info. We used the lounge quite a bit as it included breakfast, afternoon tea, canopes & drinks & free internet. All the food was delicious & the Club Lounge is great value for money. It is also a oasis from the rush of outside. There are several restaurants within the hotel which all serve different cuisines. The location of the hotel is also great, Canton Road (where you will find almost every shop imaginable at Harbour City) is a 1 minute walk , the Star Ferry is less than 5 minutes walk & the train station is about 2 minute walk. We expected the hotel to be nice but it exceeded all our expectations. You could really tell that they pride themselves on providing great service & they go out of their way to make it a great stay. We would not hesitate to stay at the Langham again. It really is a stand out hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful, couldn't have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: austag
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. And from the moment we stepped in the place we loved it. The staff and service is 10/10. Tho our first room we did ask to be moved only because of the outside noise was a little too noisy for us as we'd just spent 3 weeks with very little sleep we wanted to sleep like babies while there. The rooms are comfortable, luxurious, well maintained and serviced. The cocktail lounge was very relaxing, with great service. The 5 star restaurant was wonderful, absolute delight! I had a wonderful 2 hour pampering at the day spa. I cannot fault this hotel and can't wait to get back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth upgrading to club for the level of service they give.”
Reviews.Author: PeterMNorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Langham at the beginning of January. This was our first visit to Hong Kong but we certainly made the right choice of hotel. We had a club room and this made all the difference. The room was very spacious and it was good to be able to use the club lounge after a day out. Also good location within easy walk of Star Ferry. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: flipper2
Reviews.Content: Excellently situated in Kowloon, 5 minutes from the Star Ferry. Good discount obtained by paying in advance and losing cancellation rights. Open air rooftop pool; rooms luxurious and staff impeccable. Only thing to avoid is the Hotel "Executive luxury coach" from the airport as this is just the normal hotel shuttle, takes ages and for two people is only a few dollars cheaper than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Really hard not to choose this Hotel again ...”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: We had been to Hong Kong at least 15-20 times during the past 20 years. Stayed in various hotels when we were in Hong Kong but had so far stayed twice at The Langham's sister hotel, Langham Place. Being a Hotel snob, I would always want to make each trip special by staying at different hotels but both The Langham and Langham Place are exceptions to this rule. We arrived via the Airport Express train into Kowloon station. Made the mistake by taking the free K2 bus (up a level and look for the B2 exit) to The Langham as it is on the 7th stop of a total of 8 hotels. The journey was 20-25 minutes, but a short cab ride of say 5-8 minutes could have brought you to the Hotel straight away (HK$25-28). Never again! However, after our stay here in February 2010 (2nd to 5th), we are almost certain that we would be back to this Hotel for the second time! Being members of the Leading Hotels, we were upgraded to a Langham suite upon booking - a good gesture, but no surprises. Still, we are moved by a gift of a shopping bag, fruit platter, at least 6 bottles of mineral water waiting in our suite! I had asked for a higher floor, non-smoking room and all requests were fully met with. We were given room 1238, on the non-smoking 12th floor. Though the suite was not huge in size, it was certainly comfy enough for a 3 nights stay. Situated at the end of the corridor, bordering a busy expressway, the suite was blissfully quiet during the night for a good nights sleep (though during the day, slight traffic could be heard at times). There was a door separating the bedroom from the sitting hall, which has a three seater sofa, and a single armchair. These chairs are very hard to sit on, probably cos they are new (well, they certainly looked new!). A huge sized flat screen TV in the hall, and a smaller TV in the bedroom. No coffee makers nor microwave ovens here (unlike Langham Place), but there is a kettle for making coffee and tea (tea & coffee bags provided). Bathroom wise, surprisingly, it was small and rather cramp, with a corner jacuzzi tub, shower cubicle, WC and double vanity sinks. Though the bathroom is not as new as the rest of the suite, but it is still compact and very functional. Anyway, I would prefer it this way, who spends most of their time in hotel bathrooms, agree? There were lots and lots of closet space, iron and ironing board, and we brought along a PC so we serve the internet free of charge in the suite - bliss for my husband! Ah oh yes, that very very heavenly huge bed - soooo comfy that we slept till almost 8am when we normally gets up at 6.30 or 7am! Total bliss again! What really touches us and impresses us was - our fruit platter was replenished daily, so are the various types of mineral waters! I am not too sure if all rooms get this special touch or this only applies to suites, but for frequent travellers like us, we are indeed impressed! Newspapers are placed along the corridors for all to help themselves, good gesture, too. We had two breakfasts at its Club Lounge on the 11th floor, surprisingly, good range and high quality! All pastries, hams, sausages, fruits were yummy, but the two Chinese dim-sum dishes were not up to HK's high standard. Lunch at its Michelin starred Tang Court was also really good, try its signature Lobster dish (HK$600), you won't regret it. Location wise, couldn't be better! Its close to my favourite HK shopping centre, The Harbour City - huge and gigantic with lots of mid to high range clothings and accessories. Spent a fortune here, much to my husband's annoyance! Its great to walk merely minutes with your shopping bags and back into the comfort of your suite, heavenly! All staffs, including those at the Reception, at the Club Lounge and the Concierges, all speak fluent English and are very friendly and helpful with whatever questions and requests we had. The hotel also provide turn-down services, but we decline them (felt like its a waste of time and resources!). Weather cards are also placed discreetly at your doors daily. Lastly, we were really impressed by the Hotel's European decor in the lobby, with decorated ceilings and chandeliers abound. A rarity in HK, where we could enjoy some Italian charm and splendour in downtown HK. We will be back and perhaps try their larger Vogue suite the next time? Stay here and enjoy your moments of joy ...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorrisScotland
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have said, the Langham is a fantastic place to stay. We booked a club room and the rrom itself was large, spacious and very modern. We would recommend anyone to book the club room - it is more expensive, but you have afternoon tea (complete with cakes and pastries), and evening cocktails and canapes for a couple of hours in the evening. Given the price of champagne and drinks in Hong Kong, it actually turns out to be excellent value. Hotel location is excellent, just a few minutes walk from the Star Ferry and close to the MTR. A great hotel and we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay in the hotel again”
Reviews.Author: memjon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an exceptional hotel. The rooms reminded me of the Venetian in Vegas except they were better decorated and more up to date. The bed were comfortable, and clean. The food was excellent. We ate at T'ang Court one night and it definitely has earned it reputation and Michelin rating. The service there is on par with some of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at. L'Eclipse had great food as well. The room service was impeccable. Treat yourself to it at least one morning. The staff was attentive and helpful. They showed us to a room when we arrived and took care to make sure we were settled in.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: anywhere49
Reviews.Content: just come back from a few days at the langham,had a lovely time,the hotel was outstanding and would recommend to anyone,ate at one of their restaurants the tang court and found that to be excellent as well the service was first class

Reviews.Title: “Old World elegance and charm in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JoCoSi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a stop-over on the way to Perth and wanted a central hotel with a little luxury. The Langham did not disappoint, the hotel itself is the epitome of old world elegance and the staff are friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and well appointed although we did not have a particularly good view. The food selection was very good and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The lobby bar offered entertainment in the evening and had an interesting cocktail menu. It is in a good location in Kowloon, just a few streets away from the water-front, within walking distance of both the Star Ferry station and the promenade to watch the Island light-show. The metro station was also within walking distance. There is a free airport shuttle from Kowloon station which runs on a regular basis and is very convenient. We also had an excellent rate by booking online on their website and paying in advance so it was excellent value for the standard of the accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in a fantasy world”
Reviews.Author: BlinkyBillQueensland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in a grand club room and had the most amazing stay. At check in I was given a rose and led to the Club Lounge for priority check in. Our room was great with a welcome note and fruit. We did have a few hitches with our stay but the staff were so accommodating it didn't matter. Firstly, on arrival to our room the tv would not turn off- there was some type of electrical fault. Within seconds of calling reception we had two technicians in our room to fix the problem. A few minutes later the doorbell rang and we were given a complimentary bottle of Moet, a bowl of rasberries and cream, a fruit platter and a letter of apology from the manager. This more than made up for the small hassel of a broken tv. A few days later I was unwell and unable to sleep due to construction work from a restaurant near our room. The manager came up to personally apologise. We were moved to another room and given a complimenary bottle of red. A few hours later I recieved a call from the Club Lounge to see how I was feeling and an invite to afternoon tea. The fitness facilities are excellent as is the Club Lounge. I cannot fault this hotel. We have never felt so well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilites.”
Reviews.Author: Iainse
Reviews.Content: Excellent service at the hotel. The room was excellent with there being good facilities in the hotel Overall it is a nicely presented hotel in an excellent locatio

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Hong Kong multiple time. However, this was the first time we stayed at The Langham. We love this hotel. Our room was newly renovated and no little details were overlooked. The room was smaller than other 5 star hotels we have stayed in. But the room design and layout made up for the slighter smaller size. The hotel is only minutes walking distance from the Star Ferry, high end shopping and the Walk of Stars. The Langham Hotel is a great value. We will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love The Langham”
Reviews.Author: 19katy80
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels. It has everything you would expect of a 5* - excellent service, plush, comfortable rooms with all the amenities you could want and good restaurants. Get B&B if you can, the buffet in the main restaurant is so good but not very good value if not included in the room rate. There's a good choice of food for vegetarians in Hong Kong and the hotel restaurants all have vegetarian items. It's in a central location - a couple of minutes walk from star ferry and MTR and surrounded by loads of shops and restaurants. I knocked a star off location because it doesn't have harbour views. I don't normally care about views but it would be nice to wake up to hong kong harbour! There's not much they can do about this as they can't move the hotel, and they make up for it in other ways - like the amazing scent they have throughout the hotel, it is the best smell in the world! We stayed in a grand langham room, which has a shuttered window in the bathroom, which is nice to watch TV in the bath. The rooftop pool is nice too, though quite small for proper swimming. Overall, I think The Langham is good value for a luxury hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Muppet71
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the Langham Hotel at all. We arrived very late Christmas day and stayed for 8 days. The rooms are immaculate, very comfortable and of a good size. The beds are so comfortable and the servicing of the rooms by housekeeping was excellent. The other staff in the hotel were also very friendly and very helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent, just hop skip and a jump from Harbour City Mall, a 3 minute walk to the star ferry terminal and a 5 minute walk (if that) to the nearest MTR station. We also had club lounge access which was well worth it. This included breakfast, afternoon tea and access to the internet. The swimming pool and gym was also good. This hotel is a wonderful place to come back to after a busy day sightseeing/shopping and we would definitely recommend staying here - its worth every cent and more. When we return to Hong Kong we will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL! Super classy, comfy, plush hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicchy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with friendly, helpful staff (they agreed to let us check out at 5 pm instead<of 12 pm). The rooms are great: bed is super comfy, wonderfully stylish toiletries that cater to each and every need, and the glass separating the room and the bathroom is a cool feature. As honeymooners we got a bottle of Moet and Chandon at our arrival. Breakfast is great too! Plenty of fruits, pastries, and hot dishes including traditional Chinese dishes. Make sure you have an afternoon tea in the lobby! the teas are great and the cakes delicious. Just a wonderful hotel that I would love to come back to any time! Also, very close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “HEART OF SHOPPING”
Reviews.Author: INM30
Reviews.Content: i wanted a hotel to be in the center of the shopping in HONG KONG and i`ve been looking searching in the internet and what makes me likes the langham how its near the malls and in the same time the port also , about the hotel lubby was beautiful so luxury and wonderful about the room i took the classic room it was kond of too much used which i think need change it as they offer me to pay more if i want to change the type of the room for some renew rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice room, helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: I was going to book The Langham Place in Mongkok, but my wife urged me to book The Langham as it was close to the Star Ferry and shopping. To her credit, she made a fine choice. We were greeted at The Langham by a very friendly woman who presented my wife with a rose and showed us to our room. It was quite a nice room, but my wife wanted something a little larger, so we opted to move for a nominal upcharge that also included in-room internet use. I like a firm bed, so I was pleased to find out that's exactly what we had. The rooms have been recently updated, the lobby is really quite nice (marble, wood paneling) with sort of a traditional feel, but the rooms are more transitional (traditional with contemporary touches). The bath was a good size, with a separate tub and shower, and the hotel provided pretty much all the toiletries one could need. A choice of newspaper was delivered to the room each morning and the hotel served as a good home away from home. As for location, it you like to shop, there's no shortage of ridiculously high end stores in the vicinity of The Langham. Regarding transportation, taxis are readily available and extremely affordable. Also, you're a short walk to the Star Ferry and other public transportation (which costs about 30 US cents per ride). In summary, very nice hotel at a reasonable price in a great location that is accessible to all of kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: madamSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped over in Hong Kong on our way back from Malaysia. This was my second trip to Hong Kong and on my previous visit I had stayed at the Sheraton on Nathan Road. The Sheraton is a nice, big hotel however the Langham has a nicer feel to it. It is a smallish hotel but it is incredibly beautiful. It has a lovely signature scent which engulfs you as soon as you enter the hotel. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was tastefully decorated and had state-of-the-art technology insofar as the phone, light switches etc were concerned. The bathroom was nice and spacious. The concierge desk was very helpful. The breakfast was good. The hotel's location is very central. Nathan Road, Harbour City and the Star Ferry are just a stone's throw away. The service at the hotel was impeccable and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Class”
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel every step of the way. Rooms are great. Staff are helpful and polite. Food is good (Michelin Star restaraunt in the hotel ). Location is really good for a tourist. No complaints. Would love to be there again for a few days. The two words that come in to my mind when I think of it are luxury and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneFloss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. The rooms were luxurious. Brekkie was great. Staff excellent. Would stay here again. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “It was good, just wish we'd stayed at Langham Place instead...”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights early November and whilst there was nothing wrong with this hotel, after visiting the Langham Place in Mongkok, I just wish we'd stayed over there. Langham hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui is close to Nathan Road and all the fancy shops - Gucci, Prada, Tiffany etc. Not really what we wanted for an authentic HK trip. The Langham Place in Mongkok is in what feels like a really traditional full on area full of locals and fantastic local shopping, close to the subway and great food. Anyway, back to Langham hotel - our room was sufficient - lovely clean bathroom, really comfortable bed. We had no view whatsoever which was a little disappointing. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities, but the staff were lovely that we encountered. For my money though, I would def give the other Langham a go next time...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel Stunning 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: casisa
Reviews.Content: normally stay at the Four Seasons in Hong Kong. But they didnt have a room avaliable for me on this trip. So langham hotel Oriental it was. Was hoping that it was of the same s. The room amenities were truly amazing : - main control panel (TV) - lighting control - TV in the bathroom - great toiletries! - great city view - perfect quietness - room make-up twice a day! - super clean room everything just great! it's like they knew already what you needtandard as the Four Seasons and I wasnt disappointed. Car ride in was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterRay
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel throughout. I would like to highlight the most efficient check-in: speedy and friendly as well as the outstanding breakfast. It may look unpretentious but the quality and selection is second to none. Very good location though if you want to sip your cocktail watching the skyline on the other side you need to go the Interconti.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in well-located and beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: FromPlaya
Reviews.Content: While the Langham does not have the views that other 5 star hotels in HK do, it does make up for that with service and a sense of "place". Walking in the door after a day in the heat/humidity and humanity that is HK, a sense of peace and serenity envelops you, unlike most of the major hotels in the area. We took advantage of advance discounts and upgraded to an updated Grand Room with access to the Club of which we were able to take great advantage. The location was excellent, a short walk to the MTR, Star Ferry and the water front. I'm sure many would prefer HK Island over Kowloon (and we did spend a fair amount of time there), Kowloon has a lot to offer and the convenience is supreme.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Gjw76
Reviews.Content: Moved across the road to the Langham after a bad couple of days at the Kowloon hotel. Opted for one of the grand level rooms on the 7th floor, which we were told had been recently refurbished. They were extremely comfortable. Roomy, with a large tub and 'internal window' so that you can gawp at the TV from the bath. Tasteful design and plenty of touches that added to the overall comfort of the room. Service was extremely good throughout hotel. Roof top pool/jacuzzi is great. The rooms aren't 'cheap', but we definitely felt that we had got what we paid for, and the hotel made for a brilliant base for a few days of sightseeing, particularly since the star ferries are just around the corner. There is a 'stay four pay for three' promotion at the moment, which makes the rate a little more bearable as well. For our last day we upgraded to the club package so that we could use the club lounge after checkout. Staff excellent as before, but the club lounge may be a victim of its own success. It is on the small side, and appears to be three or four rooms that have been knocked through together, as it has slightly weird 'boxy' layout. Space was at a bit of a premium during the late afternoon and evening. 'Standard' drinks available (only cocktails were G/T or V/T), but there were free flowing snacks, canapes and Haagen Dazs that was very welcome. Overall, worth extending the budget for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Global Meeting for 300+”
