Reviews.Author: RayBidoli
Reviews.Content: I worked with the Langham Hotel to hold our Global Meeting there. The staff were phenomenal and the attention to detail was outstanding. Prior to the start of the meeting we had a debriefing session with all the head staff so we knew who everyone was and what their responsibilities were. Let's just say these guys and gals were extremely organised. I had no complaints throughout the event. The food was always fresh and plenty of it and diverse enough to cater for all the different cultures attending. My room was always clean and any requests were sent up promptly. The location is great for shopping and you have the ferry service 5min walk away. It took around 25-30min from the airport by taxi but you can also take the metro service which many of our delegates did. The pool area on the roof was great because you didn't have neighbouring buildings peering down at you. The spa service was very effective and welcome after a long week too. All in all, this is a great hotel for putting you in the middle of the busy shopping district in HK but is also an excellent business hotel that can handle meetings of any size. We're seriously contemplating going back there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerold-Vienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed the club deal (incl. breakfast, drinks, teatime, etc.) what is really worth the money. Also the pool area on the rooftop is very nice after exhausting sightseeing, shopping,...The hotel is centered very close to the harbour, shopping malls, nice restaurants and 5 min walk to the MTR. The staff is very helpfull an friendly!!! Definetly would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was excellent”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Traveller85
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time checking reviews on Trip Advisor before booking The Langham for our stay 24-31 October, and decided on The Langham based on the very positive reviews and the reasonable room rates which compared favourably with other options. We can only endorse all the positive comments in other reviews. The Langham was terrific, and the location is excellent. Initially we had a standard (Classic) room which was satisfactory, but on our second night we had a problem with a water leak in the room. Obviously this had the potential to put a damper on our holiday, but as they say the key to good customer service is how you recover from problems. On that count The Langham came out very well as they moved us to a recently refurbished deluxe room which was great. Overall we couldn't fault this hotel. The service was excellent and all the staff were very polite, friendly and attentive. We didn't use a lot of the facilities, but those we did use were excellent. For example, on the two occasions we had room service meals, they came beautifully presented with several unexpected extras. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, impeccable service, great location”
Reviews.Author: macneillfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for six nights at the end of october. Had booked two standard rooms, however on booking in were upgraded to executive rooms. The rooms were of excellent size, much bigger than other hotel rooms in HK. The rooms had been recently upgraded, with large bathrooms and all mod cons. The hotel has a boutique personal feel. All the staff we camne in contact with, were helpful and courteous. The hotels convenient location, near to Nathan rd, and 5 min walk to Star ferry meant we were never far away from all the main attractions of Kowloon. Next door to the hotel is Aqua 1 Peking road, the bar AquaSpirit on the 29th Fl offers the best views of HK harbour at night, the drinks are expensive, but who cares when you see the View !. You will not be disappointed if you book into the Langham, many other hotels in Kowloon charge higher prices, but cannot match the Langham in terms of service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Old glory, could be better”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night in the Langham. The welcome is a little anonymous and the room in the lower levels was nothing special, although all usual amenities for an hotel this category were available. A special mention for the nice pool on the roof and for the offer to refresh in the evening (well after check out) before going to the airport. This was the extra service that was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Langham was an enchanting, pleasurable experience...”
Reviews.Author: Perthlady4422
Reviews.Content: I really researched hotels in Hong Kong for this visit as it was to be a luxurious stopover on my way back from Paris. I cannot fault the service I received and even though I was travelling on my own I did not feel at all uncomfortable or unsafe. I was upgraded to a nicer room and that was just the beginning of a wonderful stay. I took advantage of The Langham Club which was a lovely haven for breakfast, afternoon tea or drinks. The only problem was some of the other guests who did not view The Langham Club as a haven and were particularly loud - problem solved by Glenn - complimentry tea in the lobby lounge. It was great to be able to use the PC's in The Club as I did not have my laptop. I loved the massage and facial I had by Wendy who was totally professional and well trained. Divine! The pool area was lovely and room service was speical, complete with fresh pink flowers on the tray. Loved the bar and indulged myself in some very original cocktails. The reception and concierge staff were quite outstanding in their wonderful approach and it was delightful that they made an effort to use my name. Whilst, I didn't use the restaurants in the hotel they looked very attractive and there was plenty of choice. Next time I visit Hong Kong I would definately consider The Langham (Kowloon).........it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: bevmo1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Langham after choosing it from these reviews. I was not disappointed, the hotel is beautiful and the service excellent. The room was small (although the bed was huge and the bathroom lovely) but I'm told not a bad size by Hong Kong standards plus the view was not great. The buffet dinner was amazing although pricey and very busy on weekend nights. The New York deli was great! Location is good if you want Nathan Road but in hind sight I would have stayed on Hong Kong side. When you leave the hotel you have to run the gaunlet of tailors, copy watches, copy handbags, time share etc. all trying to get you to buy. Hong Kong side would have been quieter. I also found it difficult to find "normal shops" near to the hotel - there's every designer shop you could think of here. Although within walking distance of Temple Street market where we managed to get most of the things we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star elegance”
Reviews.Author: MandaB
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed during August 08 during the time of the equestrian olympics in Hong kong which was the main reson for our visit. We stopped in Club rooms, Winnie and her team made us feel very welcome within the club. The langham is very elegant at the rooms are very well appointed, all clients are made to feel very special and welcome. It is very well situated in kowloon for many of the city sights, star ferry and all the fab food Hong Kong has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: gollWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in standard club room which was well worth any extra payment. Rooms were very comfortable and staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. This hotel is very conveniently situated for star ferries, MTR and shopping. This was our first time in Hong Kong for many years and we loved it and the hotel made it very special for us. Don't look elsewhere just book The Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: JackandHils
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham Hotel at the end of September 2009. We found the hotel to be in an excellent location - close to Nathan Road shops, the Star Ferry, MTR and the Habour City shopping Complex, and several markets. We really could not fault the Langham in any way. Everything was spotlessly clean. The room, bed, bathroom, staff and food were all excellent. The bedroom and bathroom were both quite spacious and very tastefully decorated. The staff accommodate your every need without being 'in your face'. The pool and recreation facilities were very good. It is well worth upgrading to club class, which includes your breakfast, use of the leisure facilities, afternoon tea and evening drinks and finger food. Even though the hotel is in the heart of everything, It was very quiet inside. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone. Other points to note: The MTR is VERY cheap and easy to use. Everything is very clean. The people are polite and courteous There is a big variety of food available The cable car ride to the giant buddha is well worth a trip. Whilst there visit the Poh Lin Monastery. Buy a ticket at the giant buddha for both, and it includes tasty vegetarian lunch at the Monastery.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAQ
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in a recently refurbished grand (i think thats what it was called!) room for a long weekend in may for a friends wedding and the room was lovely, and large for hong kong. The bed was lovely and big, and the perfect place to finish off dome very hectic days! The bathroom was also lovely and modern and again large. The hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes walk from the star ferry terminal and seconds away from the main shopping area of kowloon. The staff were friendly and helpful, and therewere no hidden surprises on our bill. We got a great rate, 30% off the normal price so its worth shopping around. We didnt eat in any of the hotel restaurants although they all looked good. The only negative thing about this hotel is that there are no harbour views, although we spent so much time out of the hotel we hardly noticed! The only problem with the room was when you were inside the door didnt lock, although the safety latch did and we never found this a problem - it did lock when you left the roo though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darrenlinh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, arrived early hours, stayed for 5 day's and 4 nights.. breakfast included with our room,bewared unless you have slept there the night before they will charge you for breakfast after check in.. apart from that, central location near the rodeo drive of Hong Kong. Freindly staff and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service on Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: kinwafu
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We had long discussions over whether to stay at the Langham or the Peninsula - and in the end stayed 2 nights in each. Whilst the Peninsula is special in it's own way it's probably not worth paying a third as much again as the Langham - especially when you can get afternoon tea, a cocktail, a glass of wine etc in the Club Floor Lounge at the Langham for free. Attentive staff without being "in your face" and a great location for MTR and Star Ferry. We used the limo service in from the airport which all went really well. The Club rooms were spacious and the bed hugely comfortable. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really relaxing hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Estheryu
Reviews.Content: the bathroom was really luxury and the bed was comfortable.besides,the location is just near shopping malls and subway, really convenient .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MezMoo74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location close to the Ferry to get to Macau and shopping so much shopping. Its only a quick taxi ride to the cheap ladies markets, goldfish, night markets or a bus ride or train but taxi's are cheap. The hotel had a transfer service at the airport which was soooo easy after the long wait in immigration it was awesome to walk out be greeted at the hotel stand and offered a mineral water or juice. It was just what we needed, then guided to a lounge area were we waited only minutes for a tranfer. On arrival at the hotel nothing was too much trouble our bags taken care of and the AMAZING scent in the lobby was just beautiful. Every Langham hotel has this scent in the lobby you can buy it apparently? The staff were so accommodating and two days later we bumped into the recpeption girl who checked us in she remembered our names! Unbelievable! The food in the restaurant was fantastic .....we even had the dessert buffet one night it had a great selection and a chocolate fountain that was a winner! As I am a travel agent I did get a really good rate but to be honest I would have paid the full rate for the level of service they offered and the comfort in the room. Each night our bed was turned down and slippers laid out....the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.....we wanted to take it home with us! I highly recommend this hotel its location is fantastic and has the level of service I think all hotels should aspire to have....

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way and all class”
Reviews.Author: milkyoz
Reviews.Content: we finished our holiday with 5 days at the Langham Hotel...it was just perfect in every way...the staff and service are second to none ...they just couldnt do enough for us both.......cant wait to stay there again and strongly advise anyone wanting just that little bit more take the Club deal...it's worth every cent..made our trip just that little be more memorable...thanks Langham team :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant & amazing corner room views”
Reviews.Author: oh_holidays08
Reviews.Content: The Langham is such a beautiful hotel.. very elegant. We upgraded from a Deluxe room to a Grand room and it was really worth it. We got a corner room with floor to ceiling windows and sweeping views of the city outside. There was also a daybed next to the windows, which was very nice. Quite a bit of space compared to a typical Hong Kong hotel room. We had a few friends over to hang out there comfortably without feeling cramped at all. The location of the hotel is also convenient (well depends on what you're there for). Its connected to a mall, the MTR is right outside and the night markets are just a quick stroll around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Langham twice this year, and would go back in a heartbeat. It is located near the harbour, not too far from the Star Ferry terminal, near luxury shops, such as Chanel and Tiffany. As soon as you walk into The Langham, you are enveloped by the smell of distinctive ginger perfume (I liked, but not everyone might) and the coo air-conditioning, which is important considering the heat and humidity outside. The rooms were absolutely beautiful, with attention to detail, whereby everything, every single feature was of superb quality. The hotel, despite its central location, was very quiet. Overall, it's a luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience from the minute you walk in the door until you leave. Unbelievably friendly and welcoming staff that take you to your room, demonstrate its appliances and continue responding to your queries and needs throughout your stay. Even cleaning was so efficient, we were astounded. Rooms are not overly spacious, but comfortable and large enough for two people with quite a bit of luggage. Having only stayed in Mongkok before, it was nice to find that we could walk anywhere we wanted to go without much effort, and also to be within no distance at all from several shopping centres and the Star Ferry. Breakfast is excellent both for choice and execution, and the bistro in the basement also serves a very good dinner. Otherwise, you will find an amazing array of restaurant choice in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lornaf56
Reviews.Content: My son and I decided at the last minute to go to Hong Kong for a break and to do some shopping. We weren't to sure if we had missed the sales but on arrival found that half the shops were still in full swing with their sales. I looked on Tripadvisor for a reasonably priced hotel in the main drag for quick access to the shops because we were only staying four days and we were visiting a couple of friends as well on Hong Kong Island and Macau. It was such a pleasant surprise to find this hotel was much more than it looked like on the internet. We were treated so very special from the time we entered the hotel, taking us up to our room and at any time day or night the service on the reception was excellent. They did so much for us and answered all our questions and gave us the best service you could ask for. The rooms were bigger than what we thought they would be. The beds were really comfortable and the rooms were really clean. The bathroom had heaps of room and the towels were thick and large. The linen on the beds was always so white and crispy and felt refreshing after being outside in the heat shopping all day. We had the buffet breakfast one morning in the Cafe and found it alright, we have had better buffets before and the price was a little on the dear side but overall it was not bad. We also had an evening meal in the upstairs Chinese Restaurant. This was superb cuisine. The service was unbelievable the whole evening. It was their expensive restaurant and we did not mind paying as we had one of our best meals. The pool area was a little small but this was to be expected in Hong Kong as there is not much space but it was really nice to go for a swim in the afternoon and relax before hitting the shopping again in the evening. We went to Macau and Hong Kong Island and this hotel is only around the corner from the China Ferry and Star Ferry and was really easy to travel to our destinations. The only down side to our experience was the roadworks outside the hotel. You could not cross the street to get to Nathan Road you had to go underground via steps go along the corridoors and then up the steps again to street level. After a few times a day and also in the evening it started to get to you a bit. Once these roadworks are finished there would be no problems. We had a fabulous stay at the Langham and will definitely be staying there again no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs way up!”
Reviews.Author: California1128
Reviews.Content: This is simply an excellent 5 star hotel. Service was impeccable, staff was very friendly and would always approach us to ask if we needed help, advice, etc. Rooms were great. Location was close to the subway and ferries. The pool was great, although a bit small. Our kids loved it, after a long hot and humid day of sightseeing. The only downside was that the cleaning staff threw away some useful travel papers that we had brought..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Place!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSiebert
Reviews.Content: This is the spot. Great location in the busy hustle and bustle of the "real" Hong Kong. 5 minute walk to both MTR station and ferry terminal. Easy to get everywhere. Although we did not use the hotle's eateries, they looked great and other travellers were impressed. The best part though, after big days of sightseeing and adventure we dragged our tired bodies back to the hotel and as soon as we got to the entrance - peace washed over us. This would be one of the most quiet hotels I have ever stayued in. There for 6 nights and never heard a peep from anywhere. I needed a power adaptor at 2 AM and the staff delivered within 5 minutes with a smile and no charge. Excellent. Gym good - pool/spa excellent Loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: jollynomad
Reviews.Content: We booked online and availed of their Early Bird Promo; I asked for the Classic Room which was the cheapest one (about HKD 1,500/day - tax included). Online booking was no hassle at all. Then a couple of days before our arrival in Hong Kong, they sent me an email, welcoming my arrival soon. They also added a location map (which was already in their website), as well as links to Weather and Things to do in Hong KOng. At the airport, since we also bought a round-trip Airport Express pass, we were entitled a free shuttle bus ride from the Kowloon Station to the hotel! Talk about convenience! When we entered the lobby, we were met with a very soothing aroma of something really relaxing. Less than 10 minutes with Valerie at the front desk, we were already led to the elevator, and to a room which they upgraded to de luxe! The de luxe room had just the right size - furnishings were not cramped in the room - and the features were a delight... There was a 37 inch flatscreen TV, and I was really happy to find an ipod dock on the bedside table. The bath tub was indeed deep; they have an iron, ironing board, umbrella (which really came in useful during the rainy days ahead), an adaptor, hair dryer and a safe. They also have thick bath robes as well as slippers. The toiletries included toothbrush and Colgate toothpaste, shampoo, a separate conditioner, body wash and body lotion. Also, they have cotton swabs and ear buds, and combs. They supplied us with fruits and water everyday, even twice a day. When we arrived, we just dropped our things and ate the fruits while we rested. We decided to walk towards the harbour; when we came back, the bed was made up, the water and fruits replenished! On the same day! I was impressed! The bed had four pillows, all soft and clean. There is an extra blanket and pillow in the cabinet. There was a sort-of a stationery box, which was just charming and generous. There were reading materials in the room - national geographic, newsweek and a Hong Kong Travel guide. There were two piles of daily newspaper near the Lift. And below hotel is the DFS Galleria and the Lippo Sun Arcade (there's a Starbucks Cafe there). About 3 minutes walk from the hotel is the Harbour City shopping mall, which is interconnected with the Gateway malls and City Super shopping mall. Lots of shops in one roof. In the same building is the ocean terminal. The TST MTR Station (Tsim Sha Tsui) is about 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. Bringing the hotel umbrella would really help if it rains, as there are a few meters of walk that are not on covered grounds. The hotel also offer to exchange your dollar to the Hong Kong currency. At that time, US$1 = HKD$7.24 was the rate in the hotel (vs. US$1 = HKD$7.02 in Travelex). If you really need to maximize your dollar, you can look at some money exchanger nearby (I saw one offering US$1 = HDK$7.8 on the subway exit going to the TST station. On three occasions i got to call the concierge to ask about directions; he was just always ready with an answer. And accurate ones too. The service staff were very courteous and friendly. The only time we ordered for inroom dining was after a tiring day at the Disneyland and on the following morning. Food was okay; they came with after dinner mints. The bread basket contained toasts, one small danish pastry and one croissant. Had three marmalades and butter too. The coffee came in a two metallic thermos. We were able to have three cups each, and it was not empty! Then, checking out was no trouble at all. it took less than 10 minutes. I like staying in different hotels whenever I travel ~ sometimes, i get frustrated with the outcome not being faithful to how twas presented on the internet. But with The Langham Hotel, I think that it earned a top rank in Tripadvisor because The Langham delivered what they promised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware when paying bill”
Reviews.Author: N1Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 9 nights in April, and liked it very much. We had booked a deluxe room, and on arrival were given an upgrade to a Grand Room, which was very nice, but I was startled at how small this upgraded room was, though my daughter assured me that hotel rooms in Hong Kong are always small. The beds were exceedingly comfortable, and food and service were excellent, though I did find the T'ang Court rather gloomy. We both had wonderful massages in the spa. My only complaint is that on leaving the hotel, and paying the bill, because I was in a hurry, I did not notice that they had converted it into sterling, which meant paying a hefty premium. Had I realised, I would have insisted on paying in Hong Kong dollars, and I urge others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Glee9
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel in luxurious decor. We paid for 2 nights and get 1 more for free and was amazed by the value. Grand reception hall, full of polished marble and comfy armchairs. Reception was smooth and as we had prepaid, we didn't have the upgrade sell that happen to another couple. Room itself was nice and spacious for HK. Apart from the usual furniture, ipod docking station and alarm with a fixed glass writing desk and swivel chair were a nice touch. Bathroom was marvellous with a tub and a shower. Bit fluffy towels and robes were nice finishing touches. Only letdowns: Room-top pool, although great location is in need of a refurb. Grouting needs to be redone. very sharp edges leading from the roman-end into the main pool. Lots of debris at the side of the pool (need better maintenance) Cleaner: seems rushed and left a lot of fluff on the floors Some of the rooms don't have any views! Overall. Great value hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Smart, luxurious rooms and great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: This is a very smart hotel, with a stunning marble lobby and a brilliant location - just metres from Harbour City shopping mall, shops and services of Tsim Sha Tsui or the Star Ferry terminal. The rooms themselves are on the small side - but that seems common in big cities like Hong Kong. The bed was superb and the pillows very comfortable. There's a very nice marble bathroom with separate tub and shower. We tried to use the pool but it had been closed on that day due to a typhoon warning. We did eat several times in the American-style deli downstairs, which had superb US-style breakfasts. (Food in Hong Kong was a big highlight!) Staff in the lobby were very business-like and helpful. Overall a very efficient and pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hong Kong hotel”
Reviews.Author: blubs99
Reviews.Content: This is a gem! I travel to HK often and have stayed in many of the better Kowloon hotels (Shangri-La, Renaissance, Sheraton, Marco Polo, Royal Garden) and the Langham is fabulous. Upon check-in the receptionist escorted me to my room to make sure I was satisfied and to show me the lighting, safe, etc. The rooms are large by HK standards and the bathroom and shower are excellent. The lighting in the room is excellent for reading or working. Buffet breakfast is a little expensive but outstanding food and variety. Health club small but ok and rooftop pool relaxing. Oh, the bed was exceptionally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - in keeping with classic Hong Kong excellence”
Reviews.Author: stevcons
Reviews.Content: Staff is perfect. Food is good. Location is very good (though Kowloon is so small, most locations are convenient). Business center is another nickel and dimer, but adequate. Rooms are well-appointed and classy. Loved the overall experience here. Fun rooftop pool and great amenities. Generally loved everything.

Reviews.Title: “An Immaculate Oasis”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPWorldwide
Reviews.Content: I will preface this by saying that I travel a lot, am super picky about hotels and we also go to Honk Kong frequently. My wife is from there and we generally stay in hotels when visiting her relatives. My hotel experiences in HKG have ranged from “okay” to “run away screaming”. Not so at the Langham Hong Kong. After reading the reviews here, I was encouraged enough to give it a try. And the rate was excellent---with a third-night-free promotion. After a long flight from New York and arriving at the Langham by taxi, I knew right away this place was going to be different. We were practically pulled from the taxi by the bellman who whisked us to check-in. The lobby and common areas were beautiful, spotless and relaxed. Check-in was perfect and highlighted by an upgrade to a better room. In fact, the check-in clerk even escorted us to our room where she showed the features, the thermostat, internet, etc. After the long haul from New York, the room itself was such a treat I almost cried. Recently remodeled, spotless and no dreaded “Hong Kong Hotel Smell”. This comes from the very humid climate and just about every room I’ve stayed at HKG is afflicted with this. Not so at this hotel and they even pump their signature "Langham scent" into the common areas and entry way! The bed was huge and great, the room furnished beautifully, a superb bathroom with both a shower stall and deep tub. Lots of big fluffy towels, complimentary bottled water, a fruit bowl, nice slippers and the room was quiet despite being right in the heart of the action. As far as the common areas, the sense of relaxed perfection continued. The bar area was just like I wanted in the evening---dark, comfortable and a subdued jazz trio who played well. I did not sample the restaurant but the New York Delhi in the basement was excellent. On the roof, the health club is well appointed and immaculate and the rooftop pool area is awesome. Make sure to check it out. Location in the city was also perfect as well---could not get any better. This is one the best hotels I’ve stayed at—period. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Reservation Desk, Great Brunch, Tasteful Enough Room for my in-laws”
Reviews.Author: NaiaRazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Langham for a week before we went to China for the Beijing Olympics. I am a seasoned traveler and I was 7 months pregnant. The reservation desk spent significant amount of time to find the best accommodation for my needs (non-smoking room/ connecting rooms/ acupuncture and massage treatments at the Spa...etc) and then helped me to configure the best possible discount package available. They even cancelled a previous booking when a new discount offer became available. They suggested a new booking with daily Brunch at about the same price- which saved my grace with my in-laws' particular needs, for them being the second time out of the U.S. and quite a bit on the older side, so they prefer Western diet and relative convenience even on the road. The brunch also offered a good mix of Western and Oriental recipes for someone like me who lived half of my life in Hong Kong and another half in the U.S. The room is small but it is expected if you know anything about the value of real estate in Hong Kong as well as its population density. I was pleasantly surprised by the amenities provided and I like the design of its bathroom (it is pretty big and sexy). Good size TV screens for watching the Olympic Opening Ceremony. I didn't get a chance to try the roof top swimming pool but learned that the chlorine level is sufficient but low enough for a pregnant lady to swim in. I would like it better if the business center has more extensive services. I also like its location because I know it is easy to get to the subway, ferries, taxi and minivans. It is within walking distances to major shopping sites and good local eateries. For all its worth- my in-laws found staying in this hotel the best traveling experience during our month long trip in China. By the way, the sculptures within the hotels are humorous and worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Radgoon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Langham in Kowloon for our first stop on our honeymoon. I asked the lady at reception whether it was possible, given that it was our honeymoon and the hotel was not busy, for us to have an upgrade. She said that she didnt want to spoil the surprise but yes, we had been upgraded. We were very excited. However, when she checked us into our room, she checked us into the room that I had already booked and paid for. The "upgrade" she was referring to was a bottle of sparkling wine that was in our room. Most odd and very dissapointing. I was also very dissapointed when I was told that I would be charged for drinking the sparkling wine downstairs in the empty hotel bar and that we should drink it in our room if we didnt want to pay extra. This was not exactly in the spirit of giving us the complimentary bottle. The room itself was ok if a little cramped. The pool facilities were also ok but small and cramped. The best bit was the positioning of the hotel which is just a short walk to the Star Ferry which goes across to Hong Kong Island. Overall, I would not stay there again though as I dont think the service and the room justified the price.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable”
Reviews.Author: etcha
Reviews.Content: a brilliant place to stay in Hong Kong. massive bed, marshmallow pillows, luxury sheets, the best gym i've seen in a hotel, attentive staff, central location, everything you need when you need it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OenoIndo
Reviews.Content: This is a great place if you know what asian hospitality is all about. The club floor rooms and the lounge offer stunning views of the city. The staff is well informed about the city as well as the hotel facilities! The hotel also offers quick and easy access to most shopping areas as well as the MRT system. Remember not to book through a travel website if you want to be eligible for accrual of points.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't stay here, it is your loss.”
Reviews.Author: The-Travel-eater
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 14 nights at this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone. The hotel itself is very well furnished, clean, luxurious with top class facilities. OK, so are many hotels in Hong Kong. But there are 2 main things that make this hotel stand out amoung the rest. 1. The location is superb. Right in the middle of TST, within easy walking distance of MTR, Star Ferry, Nathan Road, Art Museums etc.. etc.. and all the main attractions that the tip of Kowloon has to offer. and 2. The staff at this hotel are incredible. Friendly, understanding (not going into that one in too much detail), helpful and will do anything to assist you in any way they can. In addition you have all the added little extras:- Free water in the room, a daily weather report for the next days planning, daily room cleaning that is all day (for you lazy people like me), Good TV channels, Tea/coffee and kettle, iron and board, turn down service in the evening, a good bar with live music (mild jazz), ... I could go on for ever ..... but won't.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenKW
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of TST, short walk to every transportation means, rooms are clean and well appointed, also very quiet ( that is rare in Hong Kong ), we were on 12th floor, that might help too. The Chinese restaurant was top-notch, the service just excellent, will be our top choice of staying next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Fault Here”
Reviews.Author: Itstime
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hong Kong staying 5 nights at the Langham Hotel HongKong. The hotel staff from start to finish were professional, friendly and were always willing to go the extra mile. The hotel itself is beautiful, with rooms that are well appointed and very comfortable. We upgraded to the Club Lounge which was fantastic with breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks and canapes from 6.00pm -8.30pm included in the tarrif. The location is in Peking Street which is the gateway to the hgh end retail stores, with malls easily accessible. It is also very close to both the MTR and Star Ferry Terminals. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would highly recommend it to future travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Work turned pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: Promila B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was so luxurious that all the tiredness of the day at business conference went like a 'woof' out of the window... The service was prompt and the ambience and facilities in the room were brilliant. The personalised attendance to each of us in the hotel (we were around 200+ members in the conference) was exemplory.... kudos to the hotel staff and it's services... i have made up my mind that i will take my family to Hong Kong and stay at this place to make the holiday a memorable one for all of us. It is at a walking distance from the harbour where we could enjoy the night laser show every day... geographically it is located near to all the attractions and hence the evening extended everyday into a pleasure after work....

Reviews.Title: “the best city hotel ever visited”
Reviews.Author: bernadettesusan
Reviews.Content: From entering to leaving the hotel I couldn't find a fault. Upgrading to the Club was brilliant. We took advantage of the free laundry and having spent the previous two weeks in China, we went home with clean washing. The food was delicious and the service great, always with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: HJS_Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham Tsim Sha Tsui for 2 nights with our 15 mo old daughter. I chose because others said it was family-friendly and had airport transportation. It was a wonderful hotel with an attentive staff, but I would not call it a family oriented hotel. It is clearly an upper-scale business hotel that will also appeal to the well-healed tourist or the couple on a romantic getaway. Also, the airport transportation was not complimentary. Still, the hotel was very comfortable, and the staff was very accomodating to our needs. I would heartily recommend this hotel to the business traveller or to a honeymooning couple, but not to the casual tourist with a family. By the way, the breakfast buffet was worth every cent... absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “First class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: hrtotexx
Reviews.Content: From the Mercedes ride from the airport to the location all was wonderful. The staff is everywhere and so helpful. The Langham Club seemed an unecessary expense at first, but we opted for it at check in. What a Deal! Free breakfast, free afternoon tea; free happy hour drinks and food-several nights we made dinner out of it. Free local calls, computer time and dry cleaning. We loved it and met people from all over the world in the club. It is hard to understand the negative reports. This is a first class place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 night stay at the Langham Hotel Kowloon. We choose this hotel over the Langham Place in Mong Kok purely on the basis of location and I think we choose well. The hotel is placed within a 5 minute walk of the Star ferries and the MTR system. It is also about 5 mins from Nathan Road which is the main north/south road in Kowloon. Along Peking Rd is Harbour City, which is home to some of the finest shops we have ever seen. The hotel is lovely inside and spotlessly clean. The staff are efficient, friendly and very attentive. We were given a free upgrade to a Grand Langham room which was quite impressive with a 7ft double bed, 37" LCD TV and a beautiful bathroom with, unusually, slatted windows you could open to the bedroom. We opted for the buffet breakfast which was excellent and to be recommended. The one disappointment was a dinner in the hotel's L'Eclipse restaurant which cost around £100 for two and was pretty tasteless and indifferent. All in all a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: greeny_4
Reviews.Content: Slightly surprised by the negatuve reviews. Great location on Kowloon, less than 5 minutes walk from Nathan Road and Star Ferry terminus. The hotel, its staff and the rooms ooze understated, relaxed luxury. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely memorable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: astonmartin22
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel in 2 years! We were impressed the first time and had to come back! From the moment you check in you are treated like royalty. We pre-arranged a Limo to pick us up at the airport and that service was fantastic. $150AUD each way is a bit expensive but it was a new mercedes s class! Everyone greeted us every time we walked around the hotel, many times remembering names. We had a large 2 room suite on the 13th floor for 3 adults. the main bedroom was a king bed, but unfortunately the other bed was a roll out that was placed in the living room. Still good enough considering the comfortable spacious room. I had been in a friends 'basic' room last time and it was very ordinary and not very large, so i think you should go for the suites unless you are travelling alone. Our room also had complimentary laundry up to $400HK per day which is plenty. The laundry all comes back neatly folded and wrapped up like its brand new. We also had access to the Club Floor Lounge on the 11th. Which means you can have complimentary drinks & alcohol, cakes and yummy snacks day or night. Perfect for recoving for half an hour between shopping trips. Location is second to none. you are right in the heart of the best shopping area in all of HK. Harbour City is a huge shopping centre you can get lost in thats open till 11pm every night. Otherwise is a quick 5 minute walk to the ferry to go accross to the island. Or taxi around to areas like Mong Kok, Elements shopping centre etc. The only complaint I have about the area is that Tsim Tsa Tsui is home to a lot of tailors and replica watch street dealers. So everytime you walk over towards Nathan Road you end up getting bombarded with people trying to sell you things... I guess we looked like tourists... There is also a wonderful gym/pool area on the rooftop that is a relaxing escape from the busy city downstairs. Next time for a change of scene i would love to stay at the Peninsula Hotel which is not far from the langham which is as glamorous as it is expensive. Or the 4 seasons under the IFC building on Hong Kong Island. Overall though, the Langham is great and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, not chic”
Reviews.Author: merryecho
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for $500US/night through leading hotels of the world, who offer an upgrade 'if available'. We were shown a very well worn, very tiny suite, with corn chips all over the carpet. No upgrade was available. We were spending Christmas there and were looking forward to a nice room, so, even though we had paid in advance, I told them we were checking out. They then came up with a nicer suite, at an add on of $150/night, which we took. This suite was large, but the carpet and furniture were still well worn, and the views were of dirty apartment buildings with laundry hanging off the balconies. Our friends stayed at the Intercontinental down the street, and for the same price had a gorgeous suite with a panoramic view of the harbor. The lobby of the hotel was turned into a street level shopping mall, so the new lobby is at basement level, making it dark and hard to use. One nice feature- the executive lounge, which offered free breakfast, tea, and evening drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wenannou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stopover to Thailand. I can't recommend this hotel enough. It truly is 5 star in every sense of the word. On arriving check in was quick and easy. The room we had was amazing. We ate at the hotel restaurant and again amazing. We only stayed for one night but wished we had stayed longer. The location of the hotel is great with everything on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hong Kong Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Explore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham for two nights at the end of a ten day around-the-world business trip. It was a great way to end the trip! The hotel staff was wonderful. The room was extremely modern and comfortable. The internet connection was strong and reliable. The buffet-style breakfast in the morning had a large variety of food - fresh and hot. The location could not have been better. Within walking distance of the ferry station and the AQUA restaurants in the building directly across the street had wonderful night-time views of the harbour. Highly recommend this hotel and I am hoping to be able to stay again for a longer visit at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: orange_crush6
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Langham HK. I really like all of the branding changes that they made. Anything with the langham logo is now pink with gold. Love it. The quality of service was just the same as before...perfect! Check in/out was easy, the breakfast buffet was delicious, my room was excellent...I was very happy to stay here again for work. I didn't have one thing to complain about. I heard from many people that they could here construction noises, but that's only during the day...I was working during that time so it did not phase me. The front desk was very helpful with suggestions for directions and where to sight see. The location is good for business and for tourists because it's close to everything. I look forward to staying there again in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “World class service experience”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Nearly a year since staying on the Club Floor of the Langham, we still reflect on how wonderful our week in the Hotel was. It is the perfect base for exploring Hong Kong and, combined with staying on the Club Floor, was the pinnacle of comfort. Right from check in we were treated like very special guests, provided with complimentary food, drink and laundery throughout the day. The staff we wonderful and very personable. We wouldn't stay anywhere else and can't wait to return where we will gladly pay the premium for the Club Floor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Weary traveller”
Reviews.Author: worldtripPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July 08 as the final part of a 3 month world trip. Everything about this hotel was excellent. We booked a suite and had complimentary club membership. The club facilities were first class with excellent service and friendly staff who made us feel very welcome. It's in a top location for those who enjoy shopping. Lots of top end stores and a short taxi ride to the Ladies Markets - cost of taxi about 35 HKD from the hotel. The pool and gym areas were first class and we felt totally pampered. Would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction!”
Reviews.Author: Trebor68
Reviews.Content: Really not all it is cracked up to be. Overall the rooms are average but the problem upon checking in for me (19th May 08) was that the building noise was terrible. The entire hotel seems to be undergoing extensive rebuilding. Of course, this wasn't communicated in advance so I complained and was moved 3 times, eventually ending up in a suite, which was great except for the fact that it was a very smelling smoking room. The only alternative offered was a move to another hotel, which I couldn't do as I was meeting colleagues for meetings. Noise was bad in the day time but otherwise hotel services were very good. Without sounding like "who ate all the pies" the breakfast was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Great for No. 1 Peking Road”
Reviews.Author: setsuyuki
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Langham Hotel several times during trips to Hong Kong. The location isn't bad if you like shopping at Boutiques or can afford to blow tons of money on name brands. It's also right across the street from the famous "No. 1 Peking Road" which used to be "Park N' Shop" about 20 years ago. I do like how it is a little off the main streets which are filled with malls so you can get away from the large crowds of shoppers. The only hard part is crossing the street because you have to go down a somewhat confusing underpass to cross the street. There's a Pizza Hut and McDonald's across the street for kids and budget eating. The rooms are also relatively large considering how limited space is in Hong Kong. Like all other hotels in Hong Kong, your hotel window outlooks another building which makes the room rather dark despite having a large window. The only thing I don't like about the hotel is the increasing number of Chinese tourists. I can understand the lobby can be busy at times but I wish they wouldn't let guests pack and unpack there because it makes walking about quite hard. Another thing I noticed is that the Front Desk Staff are increasingly becoming less fluent in English so I was forced to dish out my poor bits and pieces of Chinese to ask for a wake up call, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good size room”
Reviews.Author: Pkwong
Reviews.Content: I traveled with two girlfriends and all of us stayed in the same room and we still have room for walk around. That was wonderful for Hong Kong hotel. Great service and the location was great. Shops and dinings are all around. I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “careful - this is NOT the Langham Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerardN
Reviews.Content: Just in case you did not realise this - the Langham Hotel is a different category to the Langham Place Hotel. The former is a tired 3+ star tourist property, low rise from the 1980s or thereabouts. The Langham Place Hotel on the other hand is a modern 5 star business and tourism hotel directly above the Mong Kok subway station. Interestingly, the two properties are similiarly priced so make sure to check this out.

Reviews.Title: “100% Class Act”
Reviews.Author: Sydneygirl
Reviews.Content: This is one of the absolute best hotels I've ever had the joy to visit! I traveled to Hong Kong on a holiday with my family and we stayed at the Langham Hotel in Kowloon for three nights on each end of a beach holiday in Vietnam. The Langham has the feel of a grand old dame, but features all the mod cons. It was very comfortable, even with a rollaway bed in the room for our little girl. The best feature, though, is the staff. They are wonderful, without exception. The concierge staff, in particular, were consistently above and beyond anything one could have expected. Case in point, we arrived late at night from Vietnam having accidentally left my daughter's favourite stuffed animal on the plane. We did everything we could at the airport to retrieve it, but no luck. Upon arriving at the hotel at midnight, the concierge staff took it upon themselves to find that toy and pulled out all the stops. The toy never was found, but their effort was extraordinary. The food at the Langham is fantastic. Their higher-end restaurant, The Bostonian, was wonderful. They also have a NY deli-style bistro with some of the best sandwiches and deserts we've ever had. Stay at the Langham. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Kowloon Area”
Reviews.Author: EUROPEEXPERT
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 5 nights at the Langham and found everything about the hotel excellent. Check out the NY Deli as the food is excellent and there is even a picture of Anthony Bourdain for those familiar of his show eating at the restaurant. My server was actually in the picture. Also had dinner at the T'ang Court and the meal was good there as well. The location is convenient to the ferry and the metro. The views from the hotel are not good, but all one needs to do is take a short walk to the waterfront to see mainland Hong Kong at night. The reservation people at the hotel are great also. I would stay at the Langham again.

Reviews.Title: “Thats how to treat a guest!”
Reviews.Author: Mazza&Fazza
Reviews.Content: Immaculate, well placed hotel with the best of everything within reach. The room had cleverly placed mirrors to add a feeling of spaciousness, and the design in general contributed to a laid back, classy atmosphere. The hotel provided fantastic amenities kits including toothbrush, bath salts, emery boards etc. The hotel is situated in one of the more happening areas of the city, with upper class shopping centres and decent restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: greatpark
Reviews.Content: The hotel was eveything I expected from website. We paid extra for the club facilities we found them excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was in an ideal position for local transport to get to the sites yourself. The shopping was fantastic. I would recommend going on an organised trip to the racecourses we did Sha Tin and Happey Valley they were very good value. The people of hong kong were helpful and friendly we would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Langham Kowloon about 6-8 times a year between my travels to Mainland China. I find this hotel to be one of the most comfortable and cleanest hotels I stay in world wide. The hotels staff is attentive but not overly attentive. The hotel is not new but the facilities are in perfect shape. Langham is within easy walking distance to China Hong Kong City, Star ferry, MTR and Nathan Road. I highly recommend this hotel to any business or tourist traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margouille
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a trip to Hong Kong. My husband always stays there when he travels for work and it worked very well for our holiday too. The location in Kowloon is ideal. Very close to the ferry terminal and Tsim Sha Tsui station. It's also close to shopping and the art museum and only 2 stops from the markets to the north and Central to the south. You can go and see the light show from the building opposite the hotel called N.1 Peking Rd, aqua - the bar at the top - is great (though a bit expensive). The hotel is very elegant and the standard rooms very nicely appointed. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Langhams luxury”
Reviews.Author: aroberta
Reviews.Content: Langhams is in central kowloon near the Harbour shopping area and 10 minutes walk from the ferry to the island. It is a very comfortable 5 star hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, food excellent, and staff very attentive. We ate in the deli which was very good and also in the Chinese style restaurant which did seem very overpriced. Overall I could recommend this for a short stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: puppyjake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham hotel twice during our last trip to HK. We ended up here as the 1st part of the trip was with work and this is the hotel our corporate travel agency book, we stayed here again as this hotel is also a part of leading hotels if the world of which we are members. We stayed in a renovated grand room with a spa bathroom which included the club facilities. Nice rooms - all modern with great facilities - ipod charger, plasma tv etc. We noticed that when we checked in as leading hotel members they couldn't do enough for us - room tours, free gifts including a nice bottle of rose champagne - plus we had a couple of issues with construction noise and they were very helpful and then offered us free airport transfers as compensation. Regarding the construction - if you want to sleep after 8.00am (which we didn't for the 1st stay as we were working - but did on the 2nd stay) book a room facing the courtyard - you won't get a view (but then there really isn't much of a view anyway as there is a very large building blocking what once was a lovely harbor view) - if you have a "city" view then you may get disturbed. We ate breakfast each day in the downstairs breakfast restaurant as this has a much better selection that in the club lounge - it really was a lovely spread with everything american, continental and asian to choose from. We had a massage at the spa which was great and then went for a jacuzzi and swim in the rooftop pool (the pools heated and a very nice temp.) - we were the only ones there so it was a relaxing experience. The hotel is well located for shopping - you can get everything you could possibly want at the attached shopping malls and on peking road / canton road. Its also close to the subway (very clean, safe and fast) and the star ferry which will take you across to hong kong island - do this at sunset its amazing to see the buildings light up. All in all we enjoyed the langham - its nothing very special - but its a solid business hotel - i think next time i would stay at somewhere you can still get harbor view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSenshotelier
Reviews.Content: -Great location; -Staff are very flexible, friendly, accomodating; -Langham Club rooms are well equipped and have a very modern feel; -Lobby bar is nice, they had some live music and service was very good; -Transportation to and from the airport was simple; -Tours are easily organized with the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham during the peak of the X'mas holiday season. Was there with the whole family - we all agree that it's a great hotel with the best location, shopping-wise! It's right in between the Harbour City Shopping Center and Nathan Rd. so its also very accessible. The best thing my husband and I noticed about the hotel was their service..Most of the hotel staff were very corteous and attentive - not very typical for HKers if you know what I mean. We also loved their breakfast buffet! Selection was good plus they had the best homemade yogurt ever - to die for :-P Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone, especially those who like to be in the middle of the bustling city that is HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ray07
Reviews.Content: The good point about the hotel is its location & room size. The deco is loud verging on rediculous. The lobby has gold paint everywhere, I guess it pemper to the local Mainland Chinese clientel taste (not very classy). The staff services is not very good. We had to drag our own bags, the porter just looks on & grinned. The lobby is like airport checkin lobby, full of people with luggages waiting for assistance I guess. The checkin staff were efficient but not very helpful. We requested a view (NO!), late check out (NO!), complimentry breakfast to compensate for earlier checkout date (NO, NO NO!) Oh by the way have a nice stay....NEXT! The whole process is rather abrupt & the dismissive manner of the senior receptionist was typical Hong Kong customer service style. I guess they have enough Chinese customer to feel they need to make any effort for customer care. The rooms were redcorated from old 70's acoomodation which is very generous for HK. But everything else were extra including use of swimming pool & gym. May explain why rooms with view are charged extra too. Finally a note of warning, the road outside the hotel is under major road diversion works & the place is packed. Access is very restricted & pooly managed. Be carefull crossing the road during rush hour which is just 1 big mad house.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MarzParis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to recommend Stayed on clubfloors , nice room of good size , nice comfortable bed, good service by friendly staff , convenient clublounge serving good breakfast and drinks and snacks. All included in rate . Decoration a little old fashioned .

Reviews.Title: “Langham - better than 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: hazelha
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, luxurious hotel. deserves every great review it gets & its place as the only Hong Kong Hotel in "Leading hotels of the world". Fabulous refurbished rooms with luxury marble bathrooms, great lighting, all the high tech stuff you could want. Great staff on reception, happy to help with sightseeing advice, & uniformed porters to open the doors, park cars etc. Everyone so friendly & able to make every guest seem special. Wonderful bar with excellent singer & pianist & superb service. Only a shame that some guests don't see fit to dress for the occasion, but they don't mind if you are a bit scruffy, just doesn't seem right in this atmosphere somehow. Wonderful breakfasts & lovely restauraunts. A great location near to the Star Ferry Terminal, designer shops & the fabulous 29th floor restaurant opposite. Also not far from botanical gardens & some quainter old streets which are the last remaining parts of "old" Hong Kong. - easy walk to these. I've stayed in many hotels but this one really had the "wow" factor for me! I couldn't fault it. Despite its very central location in Kowloon it wasn't noisy, it was like a little oasis of peace from the bustle around. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Auther
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, rooms very clean - arrived to be told 'we will upgrade you' excellent news - breakfast excellent - service thoughout couldnt be faulted. Credit to staff.

Reviews.Title: “Langham Hotel TST”
Reviews.Author: NSY39
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly having found out that Hotels.Com would charge me 27% more. (Be aware of these people). I booked a superior room and this had twin beds (doubles actually) and this was very elegant and superior to any 4/5* hotel I have stayed in, in Europe. The room was on the 13th floor with a view across to the Peak. Room facilities & service were superb. Throughout the hotel the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. Tipping is unecessary as all services carry a 10% service charge. We tried all the six sources of food in the hotel and they were without exception, excellent. I cannot understand why anyone would give this hotel a poor review. I read every trip advisor review that was available and am glad that I was aware of what to expect. Everyone who reviews does so for a reason and mine is to say that I would recommend this hotel to everyone,except those on a budget as this is a luxury hotel. The internet service is relatively expensive but I found plenty of free wi-fi hot spots (including some from my hotel) and I was able to use my laptop widely. Plenty of free toiletries, a bowl of fruit topped up daily,free bottled water and two useful gifts from Customer Services indicated to me that these people know what they are doing. Above all visit their web site and the dozen or so other useful tourist web sites and you will have as enjoyable time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay, overall”
Reviews.Author: banjo815
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here before heading for Taiwan next evening. Can be accessed by the Airport Express Shuttle at the Kowloon Station. Paid $1750/night. Given a room on the Club Level, which includes local calls, daily laundry allowance, lounge access w/buffet breakfast , evening drinks and internet. The lounge is WiFi-ready and for those who doesn't have a laptop, there are workstations available. Rooms are smaller than expected but functional with LCD TV, marble bathroom w/ample toiletries and electronic curtains. Courteous & speedy check-in & check-out. Request for 3p check out wasn't a problem. Lobby is in the small size which also contends with a lot of foot traffic in the busy Tsim Sha Tsui. Don't expect to see the Victoria Harbor from here b/c the hotel is blocked by other buildings. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: ninameyers24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham hotel for 5 nights at the end of november with my friend.We had a great time and found the hotel to have a brilliant location in Kowloon.It is near the ferry pier and also next to all the shops.It is a 5 star hotel and was worthy of this rating.The rooms were a decent size with comfortable beds and big bathrooms with large walk in showers.We were provided with complimentary water and slippers.They had all the christmas decorations up in the lobby which were really pretty aswell.Hotel itself was very clean and the staff were friendly.It had a lovely roof top pool which was small but seemed very adequate. All in all,would highly recommend and thought it was really good value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lashjack
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for 6 nights because of the reviews on your website and it did not disappoint. We had a standard room that was quite large with a chair and a sofa. The bathroom had a separate shower and large tub. Service was prompt, elegant, and courteous. It is really well located near the Star Ferry and yet seems like a quiet oasis compared to the Peninsula and Marco Polo hotels that were noisy and too bustling. The breakfasts were fabulous and the dinner in the hotel's deli was excellent. It is also less than a block from the major designer mall with lots of restaurants and 2 supermarkets. We would absolutely stay here again when we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: miramol
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel after staying on the executive floor for five nights earlier this year. Room was great and the lounge serves complimentary drinks during the day with snacks available pretty much throughout the day. Staff were very friendly and helpful particularly Katie and Buta. The hotel's location may put some off but it's situated above an MRT station so its easy to travel all over HK from the hotel . the local area is also interesting to explore and as this was our 4th visit to HK it made a nice change. The executive floor is worth the extra cost. However, breakfast in the hotel restaurant has a better selection and was pretty impressive. The head chef is from Glasgow so you are guaranteed a good selection for breakfast and for once even the veggie selection was impressive.

Reviews.Title: “best location, modern rooms, resonable price”
Reviews.Author: hcarch
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights. i never heard of langham but saw the high rating of the other langham. this is the best location in kowloon, right across the street from harbor mall and down from the star ferry. i booked the least expensive room and it was one of the best rooms i'ved stayed. service is excellant hong kong style. even the buffet meals are a mark better than most restaurants entrees. beatiful roof top pool. only down is not many views.

Reviews.Title: “love it and will continue to stay here”
Reviews.Author: marica36
Reviews.Content: 1st time we stayed at langham was in dec 2003 - wasn't sure about it since we've always stayed at a different hotel (couldn't stay there since it was fully booked). it was actually a good thing - LOVE the hotel. excellent rooms, great staff, love the location. after that first stay, we've never switched hotels. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Jewel”
Reviews.Author: averagejoe75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, once in 2003, and once in 2005. Both times I booked a Langham Suite. Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Service. And that really says something for a city filled with opulent 5 Star Hotels. Each time I arrived at the airport, the limo driver was ready with my name on a card, and whisked me away to the hotel. As soon as I arrived, the Assistant Manager walked me into the hotel and did a private check in. Fantastic service and enthusiasm. I know that the new Langham place has opened up in Mongkog with supposedly great rooms. However, at the time I stayed there, I think Langham's Suites were the best around. Pretty good price of US$400 a night for a 600 sq foot room with plenty of space, modern furnishings, high tech gadgets, great views, large plasma TV and entertainment system, great luxurious marble bathroom and an incredible bed. No complaints whatsoever with the room or service. Location is the best possible, right in TST, a minute away from Nathan Rd. I know other people who have complained that the regular rooms are rather small. I don't know about that. However, if you can afford it, I would definitely recommend this hotel to splurge in!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelcritic1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as 5 star somehow, and many people on this forum have said its great, so I would like to share my experience. I arrived in the afternoon and was taken to the club lounge to check in, the staff were polite enough and told me that I had free internet access in the hotel, when I logged onto the computer all I had to do was enter my room number and surname. I thought great. I had just got off a 12 hour flight and needed some sleep, when I got into the room I was a little horrified. How was this a 5 star hotel? the room was tiny and cramped and looked like a Motel 6 or a Premier Travelodge rather then a 5 star hotel, the room was tiny, they had just added afew items to make it look good like a glass sink in the bathroon and non branded plasma screen television on the wall. I am not saying this hotel wasn't smart, but in a place like Hong Kong, this is no where near as good as the Conrad, in the Conrad the rooms are maybe 3 or 4 times as large as this with even the toilets having aquavision televisions. 5 minutes after getting into the room I could hear the people next foor talking, then I heard their tv, it wasn't like they had it playing very loud, but it was the fact that whoever designed this place went for small shoddy rooms with cheap sound insulation in the walls. I called the club lounge and told them I couldn't sleep, they didn't seem phased. I was really frustrated. So I whipped out my laptop and went online, saw charges, but was reassured it was free, so went online (only to be told it was chargeable when I checked out). Eventually I got to sleep that night only to be awoken by intimate noises from the next room, again this is something you expect at a motel 6 or a premier travelodge but not a 5 star hotel. I felt bad for them because I could literally hear everything, and it made me feel awkard. After they were finished, (all of 2 minutes later, lol) I managed to get some shut eye. But for some reason the house keeping staff just don't care about do not disturb signs, I kept getting knocks on the door and was shouting out come back later. Eventually one of the house keepers came in. I told her to come back later so she left. I was so tired, managed to nod off again only to have house keeping call me about 10 minutes later and ask why I didnt want my room cleaned. I was so tired at this stage, and just couldn't get back to sleep. Was tossing and turning in my bed for about 15 minutes and then the tv from next door went back on. Great! The next morning I went to the club lounge for breakfast, which by the way is no where near 5 star standard, its variety is very limited. The staff attending this breakfast were a joke, laughing, flirting and joking with each other rather then serving the guests, I got given tea with no milk and didnt get the milk for ages cos no one paid me any attention, so my tea went cold. They also never cleared plates off my table even when I had finished. The next day I spoke with the concierge about how to get to the office I needed to go to, he showed me the way and I told him of my plans to go to China. I have been to China afew times and because I work out of Shenzhen there I don't bother with a visa as you get a 5 days stay automatically on a British Passport. But this concierge told me there was no way I could do that and insisted I need a full on visa, so being the fool I am I gave him my passport and parted with around 1000HKD to get my visa done. I thought maybe the rules had changed, but they hadn't. When I got to China I just realised he propbably didn't understand English. Now this is a 5 star hotel run by the English and is frequented by English and American guests, why is there a concierge who doesnt spreak English properly? In terms of location, its pretty good I guess if you are there for shopping, because it is near ladies market. In terms of the rooms, its nothing special, if you want an amazing hotel in Hong Kong pay the extra and stay at the Conrad. In terms of the service, again its not great. In terms of amenities in the hotel, its not great, the bar is very small no atmosphere, the restaurants are not very good either. Just to give you an example, the "chunky chips" are in fact french fries. The spa on the top floor gave me sub standard service and treeatment was short for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel with excellent service! We just had to write about it!”
Reviews.Author: tgelson
Reviews.Content: The Langham Hotel in Hong Kong is wonderful hotel with excellent service. We felt compelled to make sure we post our 1st review on TripAdvisors because we were just so delighted with the staff, service, and hotel amenities. We went to Hong Kong for both business and pleasure. The hotel was ideally for located for both. It is super clean, well appointed, and comfortable! Please make sure you say hello to Joseph in the dining room! He greeted us every morning with a warm hello and sincere interest in our day & stay! He is exemplifies why the hotel service was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: noonie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times and found the staff to be extremely attentive. The Customer Service Manager (Glenn) is very helpful and considerate and I think that there are many loyal customers to this place. This stay, like so many others, involved a nice room and a good breakfast (almost too much choice), however they are now in need of a little refurbishment and polishing - but are always clean and very spacious for Hong Kong. Unlike an earlier review I have always found the concierge staff to be fabulous....but then I guess it is how you treat / speak to people that determines reactions. I can't get too excited about newspapers to be honest. The pool and gym are small but I never plan to spend too long in them! All in all, another great stay and a quality hotel - trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: CroydonBoy
Reviews.Content: Room had seen better days and smelt of cigarrette smoke (meant to be a non-smoking room). Pool not big either. That aside it was pretty reasonably priced, food was good, well located and service otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Elysium73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for 3 nights on our honeymoon, on our way to the South Pacific. We enjoyed the Langham. Big, clean room with a comfortable bed. Not much of a view, but that didn't matter much to us. Bathroom was nice and large and sparkling clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, pointing out the sights we could see and advising us of the best ways to get there. The buffet breakfast in the main restaurant had one of the best choices I have seen in a hotel. Adjoining restaurants, including an American burger restaurant, are good, albeit a little expensive by Hong Kong standards. Also, with the oppresive humidity and heat of Hong Kong, it was great to walk into the building and feel the instant hit of cold air as you walk in the lobby! All in all, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good experience at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: LGuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham in May for 2 nights-- friend of mine booked a room for me as he recommended it. Told me that he stays here when he comes to Hong Kong for business. The rooms are a good size, and the beds are comfortable. Excellent and unobtrusive service. Good location -- located next to Harbour City shopping centre ,and the Star Ferry , so easy to cross over to Hong Kong island either by ferry or by MTR which is also near the hotel. It's a very good hotel to stay for business travellers, but I wouldn't recommend that honeymooners or romantic partners come here as this is very much a hotel which acomodates business travellers. The gym is adequate for a hotel gym. I understand that there is a very good chinese restaurant in the hotel , but I didn't have the chance to try it. I would come back again if Im coming to Hong Kong for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: flyingplanes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Langham Hotel for six days and it exceeded all our expectations. The room was excellent - we asked for one higher in the building to avoid road noise, and were placed near the top in a very spacious room. The room was clean and the daily service was exemplary; the bathroom was luxurious and had both a stand-alone shower and a bath. Beds and pillows were comfortable and spare blankets were provided. Internet was respectably fast although very expensive ($50 HK for half an hour, though there was a 24 hour rate as well). The minibar was well-stocked but very expensive, moreso than the second hotel we stayed at. There was a communication error over email when we made our booking, where the hotel was talking about prices excluding taxes and we were talking about prices including taxes, but it was sorted out promptly and to our satisfaction. We found the hotel staff very good - efficient, caring, attentive and fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wazza33
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 3 night stay here during mid August which was just a pleasure. The staff were so attentive and genuine in their efforts to delight, especially the staff in the Langham Club. The pool, whilst on the smaller side compared to other international hotels, had everything one could need and well sheltered from the elements. The location is just perfect in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui shopping, 7 mins walk to MTR and 5 mins walk to Star Ferry. I did find the Main St. Deli a bit over-priced, and lacked that certain something special the rest of the hotel provided. But essentially what the hotel lacks in Hong Kong views it makes up for in service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: Ulrike73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and I was very satisfied. Hotel and rooms are very nice - elegant and very clean. They have good air-condition (not noisy). As the hotel is located within some other big buildings you don´t have a view from the room window, but we didn´t mind. Stuff is very helpful and friendly. The location is very good too - just very close to shopping malls, restaurants (the famous Peninsula Hotel with its Felix bar is only 5 Min. walk away) and also close to the ferry to Hongkong Island. We dind´t have breakfast there...but Starbucks etc. are nearby... They also have a small pool and recreation area in Italian style on top of the building, which is very nice for relaxing after a day of sightseeing. This hotel is also member of Leading Hotels of the World.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night here in July 2006 after having a not too great experience at the Harbour Plaza (also reviewed). 1 Check in was a little embarassing. I checked in with my gay partner. Despite confirming with the airport desk that a double bed was booked, including diagrams of what double beds and single beds looked like, when we arrived at the hotel about 30 mins later, 2 single rooms were allocated to each of us.
