Then a twin room. Then eventually a room with a double bed, with the rest of the guests checking in entertained by it all. I didn't take umbridge or offence but found it funny. It is rather quaint to be thrown back to the dark old days once in a while. However, other "Leading Hotels of the World" hotels are completely au fait with gay couples, and only ask "you have a room with a double room, is that correct?". All cleared up in one question. 2 We were woried about the noise as the hotel is right bang in the middle of TST. The room, on the top floor and the furthest away from anything right in the corner (because we were gay?) was very clean, quiet, roomy and great. Couldn't fault it. And the turn-down service was good and fruit provided as well as decent toiletries. 3 The concierge service was very very impressive. Gave our flight details to the concierge for reconfirmation of our flights and headed off to the shops. He said leave it to him. That evening, a letter was placed in our room confirming everything and giving names of the relevant staff etc. Also, there is always staff in reception foyer dedicated to just answering questions from guests rather than checking in staff only. Like it. 4 Very close to Harbour City shopping plaza, Gucci, Prada etc. and only a 5 min walk from the Star Ferry. 5 Swimming pool was more like an oversized bath tub surround by big walls so not much room for sunbathing. 6 A local we got talking to said the Langham Place hotel was actually better then the Langham Hotel. However, if you like shopping, we would recommend this hotel as the Langham Place is a little further out.

Reviews.Title: “bit bland”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, stayed here for 3 nights. Nice on the surface, "most" staff were quite nice. Restaurants left little to be desired, chinese was great, bostonian not at all, overpriced and outdated food. Plates were chipped and food very average, not what I expect in Hong Kong at all for room service. Linen ok. Room was just tired. Room service cold, fatty food. Had to stay here, company booked. Really good restaurants across the road, which we found out on the last day unfortunately. Enjoy hk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great spa too”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decieded to make the choice from the other feedback on this site. We up graded to a suite on the top floor which probably made all the difference. A spa for two was inluded. Room was very modern and quite nice. Pool was perfect. service - excellent. Spa was perfect as well. Decent hotel gym. Club floor food and snacks were well done. location is part of a very modern (clean) mall.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: lesleyd
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, staff pleasant and attentive. Rooms whilst not state of the art, calming, spacious and well maintained. Memeber of LHW and it shows. We booked through BA website who had best rate in Janunary and paid less than a London TravelInn. Would return, more than I can say for our Branson flight!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with Langham web reservation!!”
Reviews.Author: jssusi
Reviews.Content: I was trying to restrive my reservation from the hotel web site about 3 days before the check in date, but I couldn't. The message from the server kept saying that my reservation doesn't exist. I read again the policy stated in the e-mail of reservation sent and I discovered a statement saying that the guest should pre-registered before 72 hours or the reservation is cancelled. On the booking it was guaranteed with my credit card but reading that statement assured me that my reservation could have been cancelled automatically since the system couldn't find out my reservation. I was told that Langham Palace is a newer sister hotel of the same group and so I made another reservation with Langham Palace. Guess what? A day after the stay there was an e-mail from the sales manager from Langham Hotel (not the Langham Palace) saying they charged me for one night penalty. It's a complete scam and I can't believe after talking to her that she was still convinced that I should have cancelled my reservation firt, but how to cancel since the web site said it didn't exist. I would ask my Amex investigation department for not paying the charge since it is completely the problem of the hotel reservation system. So for you out there, before making the internet reservation, beware! Internet transaction in Asia and especially from the local group companies are not that stable like in global hotel chains such as Marriott, Starwood or Hyatt. I learnt my hard lesson and I definitely won't stay in Langham again. It's a pity since I loved the room in Langham Palace but recalling the trouble I had in the hotel, it just brought unhappily memories.
